loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem, 57 years old, is a married woman who lives in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has 2 dependent children and 6 married children. 

Soem is an active farmer on a small rice farm which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make an average income of $5.00 USD per day. So far, she has been involved in this career for 35 years. 

Soem wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine, something which is currently missing in her house. 

Therefore, Soem is requesting a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Soem is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Piel Rosada Callutaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PIEL ROSADA CALLUTACA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son similares, ya que están basados en la venta y producción de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, mismo que fue un negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad, posteriormente a la crianza lo utilizará para la producción de leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PIEL ROSADA CALLUTACA” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Nicolasa is the president. The businesses that the members have are similar, as they are based on the sale and production of milk.  
 
The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Nicolasa. She indicated that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a milk production business. She says that she learned this business from her parents and it was a family business. Over time, she decided to start an independent business. 
 
The loan she will take out is to increase capital by buying a cow. She will acquire it from wholesalers in her community. After raising it, she will use it to produce milk. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  FAMA  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame  ALIMATA  fait le commerce de fruit dans ce groupe de femme DEMBAGNOUMA. Elle se tient à l’extrême gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt un panier de fruit au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Sa vente se fait en détail en espèce et à crédit à Fama  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
.
texts.en:
The four women of the group DEMBAGNOUMA are married, and they average 33 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in traditional families in FAMA, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 4th solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. The previous loans were correctly paid back.

Ms. ALIMATA does commerce in fruit in this women’s group JIGUISSEME. She is standing at the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a basket of fruit at the big market, where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash or credit in Fama. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Virgelen

texts.en:
Virgelen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old, and her three children are in school.

Virgelen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Virgelen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Henie

texts.en:
Henie is 48 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Henie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Henie has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is thirty years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Nieva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as rice, snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

Nieva has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nieva aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Evalyn is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Evalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

In the future, Evalyn would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Taalisida Group

texts.fr:
Mr DAOUDA est le représentant du groupe TAALISIDA. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants, le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 06 vont à l’école. Il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 03 moutons et  20 poules.
Mr DAOUDA veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur
texts.en:
Mr. DAOUDA is the representative of the group TAALISIDA. He is in good health. A married father, he has seven children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 8. Six go to school. He has seven persons to support. 

Mr. DAOUDA has been a livestock farmer for ten years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. His customers are merchants from his district. He wants to purchase 3 sheep and 20 hens. Mr. DAOUDA wants to use his profits to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep and 20 hens

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years old, and she is married with 4 children, 2 of whom are still in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 8 years. 

Judith has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future Judith would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: José Sergio

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, realizo sus estudios primarios y desde pequeño ha sido una persona que gusta del trabajo, está felizmente casado, su pareja se dedica a los cuidos del hogar. En su casa vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales manda todas las mañanas a que vayan a la escuela.

Desde pequeño José aprendió de su padre el oficio de la agricultura y desde esa edad está acostumbrado a ganarse la vida con el sudor de su frente. Actualmente trabaja para un ganadero sirviendo como corralero, pero también siembra su propios cultivos para alimentar a su familia.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar cemento y arena, debido a que las paredes de su vivienda son de barro y él quiere fortalecerlas con cemento para mayor resistencia y durabilidad. Con esto lograra mejores condiciones en su calidad de vida.

José sueña con ver que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser personas de bien, para así sentirse orgullosos de ellos y envejecer contemplando los frutos de sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
José, 29, completed primary school and has liked working ever since he was very young.  He is happily married, and his wife devotes herself to housekeeping.  He lives in his house with his wife and their three children, whom he sends to school every morning.  
 
José learned farming from his father when he was very young; and since that time he has been accustomed to earning a living by the sweat of his brow. Currently, he works as a ranch hand for a cattle breeder, but he also grows his own crops in order to feed his family.

The requested loan is for purchasing cement and sand because the walls of his house are made of clay, and he wants to strengthen them with cement for better resistance and durability. With this, he will achieve better conditions and quality of life.

José dreams of seeing his children become successful, good people, so that he will be proud of them, and grow old enjoying the fruits of his labor.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand because the walls of his house are made of clay, and he would like to strengthen them with cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them for their entire cycle of growth and development.

loans.name: Abib

texts.fr: ABIB est un homme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter pour les jeunes filles. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Il a un parent bénéficiaire de crédit dans l’institution, et sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des jeans, bodys, tee-shirt, chaussures qu’il revend à ses clientes potentielles.  Il gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir il souhaite avoir une grande boutique de prêt à porter pour pouvoir diversifier son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses commandes. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
ABIB is a man working in the area of ready-to-wear clothing for girls. He has over five years of experience in this business. He has a relative benefiting from loans in the institution and is requesting this loan in this amount to purchase some jeans, leotards, tee-shirts, and shoes that he resell to his potential customers. He manages all the day-to-day expenses for his family and his children’s schooling costs. His day starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. 

For the future, he would like to have a large store for ready-to-wear clothing in order to diversify his merchandise and satisfy special orders. Thus, he would like to increase his revenues and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to resell to girls

loans.name: Villa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yhoselin es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de api, venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, costura de polleras.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yhoselin es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de api (bebida tradicional); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un capital básico en su comunidad, en la actualidad pretende ampliar su negocio ya que cuenta con varios clientes.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carpas y asientos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank “VILLA” will being its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal of Patacamaya. It consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive council where Yhoselin is president. The business that the communal bank members have are varied: selling food, selling api (traditional corn drink), selling cattle, neighborhood store, seamstress. The loan will benefit their small businesses. Yhoselin shares that this is the first time working with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of an institution representative that visited her in her home.

Today she has a business selling api (a traditional corn beverage). She began this business with few funds in her community and today she plans to expand her business as she has several customers. The loan will be used to provide capital to buy awnings and chairs at wholesale from vendors in La Paz and then use them in her place of business. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family. She is single and has 6 children. When asked, she says she likes Pro Mujer for the savings and trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy awnings and chairs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35, married and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a small variety store to help her husband in generating income. She and her husband aspire to become successful in life to give their children a better life. 

She would like to improve her small store, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Ludy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Ludy has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 33 years old, and all three children are in school.

Virginia has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mally

texts.en:
Mally is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Mally works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like eggs, sugar, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc.

Mally has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Mally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like eggs, sugar, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Estrella has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.es:
La Sra. Reinalda proviene de una familia de agricultores, y muy numerosa, es una de las hijas mayores, siempre ayudó a su madre con la crianza de sus hermanos. 
Al pasar de los años empezó a trabajar como empleada doméstica. Se casó y tuvo 6 hijos, a quienes ella le crió, ahora todos ya son mayores, y los cuales sacó adelante con mucho sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para la venta, como harina, aceite, jabones, suavizantes y demás. Está agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Reinalda comes from a large family of farmers. She is one of the grown daughters who has always helped her mother with raising her siblings.

Over the years, Reinalda has also worked as a domestic employee. She is married and has six children that she has raised. They are now grown, but they have been able to get ahead because she has made many sacrifices.

Reinalda is requesting this loan in order to buy various products that she can sell such as flour, oil, soaps, fabric softeners, and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, soaps, fabric softeners, and other products that she can sell.

loans.name: Tugino

texts.en:
This is the story of Tri, son of Tugino:

"Every morning, my father always has to climb a coconut tree to take the juice, then cook it up into sugar, then sell it to sellers afterwards to get money for our daily needs. In the afternoon, he must take coconut juice again and cook it up for about six hours. Taking the juice is not easy; it requires very much effort every day to be up and down, climbing palm trees, as does my family to meet their needs."

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 50 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Perlita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Perlita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anita is 36 years old, and both children are in school.

Anita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Anita requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Anita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a bathroom.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn, who is 49 years old, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has only one child who is currently working as a garment factory worker. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this career for 34 years. He can make a net profit of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

At this time, Thoeurn would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL. He is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. He hopes that this new motorbike will bring him a convenient way of transportation. He would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 9 dentro del programa de comités de mujeres, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que por medio de sus 50 indicadores, ellas conozcan en su generalidad su situación de vida.
Graciela en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado mucho, a través de su esfuerzo y sumado al seguimiento y capacitaciones que realizan las asesoras. Graciela tiene una confitería donde vende masas, tortas, y todo tipo de cosas dulces, tiene ya muy buena clientela ya que son muy ricos los productos que hace.
La Sra. Graciela Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de  insumos para  la elaboración de sus confites y productos varios, necesita de harina, dulces, manteca, y extractos varios. Ella está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is in its ninth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination survey, which has 50 indicators that help them become familiar with their general living situations.

In her latest survey, Graciela was at a Stage 3 poverty level. This indicates that she has greatly improved as a result of her efforts and the monitoring and training provided by the advisors. Graciela has a confectionery shop where she sells pastries, cakes, and all types of sweet goods. She already has a very good clientele because of the many delicious products that she offers.

Sra. Graciela is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making her various sweets. She needs flour, sugar, shortening, and various extracts. Graciela is pleased with the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, shortening, and various extracts for making sweets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is responsible mother who was engages in buying and reselling jewelry within the local community to generate additional income. She is 34 years old and blessed with three children. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of her children and sustain their daily necessities. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail herself of an additional 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of rose gold and silver jewelry to resell. Through this financial assistance, Rowena hopes that she makes her business profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rose gold and silver jewelry to resell

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abdullahi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abubakar, Isiyaka and Kabiru. 

Abdullahi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Abdullahi expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Abdullahi to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Abdullahi said: "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food and farm loan repayment), eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices and increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Benvienida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Benvienida works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling of Personal Collection and Avon products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Benvienida is borrowing 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection and Avon to sell to her customers for her direct selling of Personal Collection and Avon products business.

Benvienida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection and Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta primeros años de estudios secundarios, vive junto con su hijo menor,  su nuera y un nieto. Su hijo trabaja como técnico en sistemas informáticas, puesto que salió de bachillerato en informática. La nuera se dedica a los cuidos del hogar y de su hijo y en ocasiones también se incorpora en el negocio de María.

María se dedica al horneado de pan, hace tamales de gallina y elote para vender, también vende ropa y también se dedica a engordar cerdos en el patio de su casa. 

Desde pequeña María jugaba a que tenía un bazar y hacia vestidos de papel, y creció teniendo siempre ese deseo, luego se acompañó y tuvo 2 hijos, viajo a Estados Unidos y cuando reunió un poco de dinero, regreso a El Salvador con el objetivo de poner un bazar y trajo lociones y ropa, fue aquí cuando se fue ganando la confianza de la gente y luego la buscaban a su casa queriendo adquirir sus productos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar lociones, cremas, telas, listones, botones, ropa para surtir su bazar.  

El sueño más grande que posee es la de poder obtener visa y así viajar a Estados Unidos para así comprar productos allá y poderlos comerciar aquí en su país y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 52, studied through the first years of secondary school. She lives with her younger son, her daughter-in-law, and a grandson.  Her son works as a computer systems technician, as he has a computer systems degree from technical high school.  Her daughter-in-law devotes herself to housekeeping and caring for her son; and sometimes she works with María in her business. 

María bakes bread, and makes chicken and corn tamales to sell. She also sells clothing, and fattens pigs in her back yard. 

When she was a little girl, María liked to pretend that she had a shop, making dresses out of paper; and as she grew up, that was what she always wanted. Later, she found her partner, and had two children.

She travelled to the U.S., and when she had a little money saved, she returned to El Salvador with the goal of opening a shop. She brought lotions and clothing, and she earned the trust of the people here. Soon they were calling on her at home, wanting to buy her products.

She is requesting a loan to purchase lotions, creams, fabric, ribbons, buttons, and clothing, in order to stock her shop.

Her biggest dream is to be able to get a visa, so that she may travel to the U.S. to buy products that she can sell here in her country, and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, fabric, ribbons, buttons, and clothing, in order to stock her shop.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer from Makera village. As a member of Babban Gona, Naomi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Naomi expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Naomi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can now store her maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. This allows Naomi to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Naomi said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food and farm loan repayment), eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices and increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Sa'ade

texts.en:
Sa'ade is a maize farmer from Zaki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Sa'ade is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Sa'ade expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sa'ade would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sa'ade can now store her maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. This allows Sa'ade to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Sa'ade said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell for her egg vending business.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from her general store.

Apolinaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judy is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, school supplies and other personal items.

Judy has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, school supplies and other personal items.

loans.name: Chila Mae

texts.en:
Chila Mae is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Chila Mae is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Chila Mae has been raising livestock for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling Ready-to-Wear items.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a businesswoman from Molave. She is 27 years old, married with one child and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Maricel is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks and to buy sacks of rice for retail to gain more profit. Maricel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and to buy sacks of rice to sell for more profit

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 35 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Fe requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Fe has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samphas

texts.en:
From Kampong Cham Province, Samphas, 31, is an experienced and active farmer. She has two dependent children who are currently enrolled in the local school. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 5.00 per day to support her family's daily demands. So far, she has been involved with this career for almost 20 years.
 
To keep her rice growing well and provide more crops, Samphas wants to use some natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to request a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this loan will help her rice grow well and bring her more benefits. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea has always had enthusiasm for managing her farming activities from which she earns an income and primarily supports her family. At the age of 64 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for providing her capital and supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and pay for labor costs for land preparation, for a more productive harvest. In the future, Aurea wishes to own a truck to be used in delivering her agricultural products to any market place in the province.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and pay for labor costs for land preparation.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Celsa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. 

Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, snack foods, soft-drinks, beers, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sugeng

texts.en:
This is the story of Khoerul, son of Sugeng :
My parents' are farm workers.  If it's rice planting season, then my parents always go to the field.  During the dry season, there can sometimes be uncertain income.  The point is we have less than what we want.  Our whole family has 5 people. I have 2 siblings, a brother and a sister. My brother does not go to school because he has to help my parents earn a living.  My sister is starting the 4th grade. 

In the picture is Khoerul, his father Sugeng and his mother Tukiyah.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Ana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Ana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
From Kampong Cham Province, Vin, 54, is an experienced and active farmer. He has two married children and four single children who are currently enrolled in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this career for thirty four years. He can make a net profit of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  
 
To keep his rice growing well and provide more crops, Vin wants to use some natural fertilizers on his farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, he would like to request a KIVA loan to buy fertilizers. He hopes that this loan will help his rice growing well as well as bring him more benefits.  He also thanks to all the lenders for their generous behaviors. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Sarmono

texts.en:
This is the story of Nurdiyanto, son of Sarmono:

My family consists of 6 people: my parents, grandmother and 3 children. My father is Sarmono and my mother is Siti, my grandmother is called Carmini, my brother is Hendra, I am Nurdiyanto and my sister is Rivaldi. 

My father works every day to provide for the daily needs of my family.  My mother is a housewife.  My brother is in Jakarta and does not yet have a permanent job.  My sister and I are still in school.

I am in vocational education and my sister is in elementary school. My father works every day as a day labourer in cotton and receives a monthly income of about IDR 500,000 per month, but my family needs more than IDR 1,000,000.  So we have to be careful with how we spend money.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Remedios is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherly

Cherly has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Cherly aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

loans.name: Erlie

Every Monday and Thursday the village officials leave the office. My father was working, and if he does not set out to the village he usually does work at home. Faithfully every day except Sundays my mother went to work at home as a tailor; her stitching results in a baby bag. His salary was not certain, because it depends on whether he was diligent. I have an older sister and she is married; she lives in Sumatra. I also have a younger sister who is is in fifth grade. Approximately that is the economic profile, more or less, of my family.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Evangeline

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Cloudimit would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Cristina has been in this business for eight years now.

Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Marlo

texts.en:

He aims to strengthen this business in order to gain a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, he would like to avail an additional loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy more chickens to raise and cracked corn for his chickens. 

He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve the business and hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and cracked corn

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.name: Erlinda

Erlinda has been in this business for 32 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Deogracias

Deogracias has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for ten years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like feeds, rice, snack foods, canned goods, and school supplies

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cristina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell at her vegetable vending business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

Dolores has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:

Elizabeth requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Louela

texts.en:
Louela is 22 years old and married with one child in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Louela is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Louela has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Charito is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and feeds.

Charito has been raising chickens for nine years and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feeds

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 35 years old and single. She works very hard to provide.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, soap, milk, juice, coffee, diapers, sanitary pads, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Emily has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent, soap, milk, juice, coffee, diapers, sanitary pads, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 43 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

Mary Ann has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzminda

Luzminda is 63 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Luzminda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daryono

texts.en:
This is the story of Yohan, son of Daryono :

"Every day my father works as a carpenter. Every day my mother works as a a laborer in the garden.  I have a brother and a sister. My sister has been working on mobile banks. My sister Sidareja is still in the third grade of elementary school. This is approximately the economic profile of my family, more or less."

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Emma

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, hot dogs, chorizo, flour, etc., for her food production business.

Emma has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Florame has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store and fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Florame has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

Bernaditha has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Bernaditha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Ermelinda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, coffee, salt, candies, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years. Rowena earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 25 years old and both of her children are in school.

Evangeline has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for six years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business

texts.en: Savy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gloestela

texts.en:
Gloestela works hard to support her family. Gloestela is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Gloestela requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Gloestela has been in this business for 25 years now.

Gloestela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Kalyan's Group

texts.en:
Kalyan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kalyan makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker, factory laborer, seller,​​ and gold decorator to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kunn's Group

texts.en:
Kunn’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kunn works as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Rosario is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 32-year-old Ugandan. He is married and has three children, aged 11, 9, and 5.

Patrick is a businessman at the town board, and he runs a retail shop that sells especially lubricants. He also sells dry cereals, this being a major activity within the area, to supplement his income from the retail shop.

He applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy corn and will be able to pay it back after making some profits.

His plan for the future is to buy a tractor to engage in large-scale farming, but he is challenged by limited funds. He is thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 40 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lilia has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sreipech's Group

texts.en: Sreipech’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sreipech works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhom makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a tailor and a village coordinator to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas started her business in 2007 with her own working capital of $400. She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy needed items according to what people need, such as balm, perfume, cookies, sewing thread, shampoo, detergent, cooking oil, milk, aqua, sardines, cigarettes, soft drinks and hard drinks. She is very interested in her business, so she has been busy with her business every day. She wants to make her kiosk like a supermarket in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy balm, perfume, cookies, sewing thread, shampoo, detergent, cooking oil, milk, aqua, sardines, cigarettes, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin dice estar felizmente casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Benjamin esta en el rubro del arte como pintor Benjamin quiere un credito para adquirir cuadros contemporaneos y antiguos para poder restaurarlos desde el marco hasta la pintura y luego revenderlos a un precio conveniente, el arte colonial es uno de los mas populares y mejor vendidos en Bolivia, especialmente La Paz, asi que esta es una buena apuesta para el cliente Benjamin es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Benjamin says that he is happily married and has two children. He lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that he owns.

Benjamin works in the art field as a painter. He is requesting a loan in order to acquire contemporary and vintage paintings so that he can restore them to the period in which they were painted. Benjamin will then resell them at a fair price. Colonial art is one of the most popular styles and those pieces sell well in Bolivia, especially in La Paz. This is a good risk for Benjamin to take since this business is his only source of household income. He also enjoys good health.

loans.use: to acquire contemporary and vintage paintings that he can restore for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Jane has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Magdalena has been in this business for five years. Magdalena earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make renovations on her old house.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is 53 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jovencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jovencia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, coffee, sanitary pads, detergent soap, sugar, etc.

In the future, Jovencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 60, is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from rural western Uganda. Even at his age, he is still the caring family man who is committed to his dear wife. For the past five years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk and baby bull sales. David is seeking a loan to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. The cow he wants may be pricier than dominant breeds but he will get real value for his money when it comes to milk production. David will also be able to get more cow dung for manure. With the loan, he will kill two birds with one stone: increased milk production and reduced costs. This will greatly boost his profit margin and thus his income.

Thank you for supporting David.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her late 30s, is single with three kids who are still in school  She has been running two projects, selling fish and selling firewood for three years now.  She works from 5 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Asha's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her firewood and fish stock and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fish and firewood to resell. She dreams of making her business big.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Mshikamano", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, who is in his early 30s, is married with one small child. He has been selling charcoal for two years now. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hamisi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. He dreams of selling charcoal at wholesale prices.

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group "Mt Udzungwa" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Jenalin

texts.en:
Jenalin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fish. Jenalin is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jenalin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Fe is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sardines, rice, bread, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, rice, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Erminda has been in this business for 14 years and earns more income from buying and selling fish.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Erminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as aqua, wheat, cooking oil, dyes, blue bands and other things to sell. Maria started to open her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $250. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add more goods in her kiosk. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy aqua, wheat, cooking oil, dyes, blue bands and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lelita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lelita has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Lelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine and to pay her electric bill.

Josephine has been in this business for 28 years now and earns additional income from her general store.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine and her electric bill

loans.name: Rosarah

texts.en:
Rosarah is 43 years old and married with three children.

Rosarah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosarah has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Rosarah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lolita has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Lolita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
Merilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Merilou requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Merilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Komsan

texts.en:
Komsan is a 26-year-old man and lives in a remote area of Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has two dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living, Komsan manages and operates a farming business in a rice farmland which is located near his house. He has been involved in this business for almost ten years.

Komsan wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Komsan hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

Komsan awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing and her general store. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell. .

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pamela is 46 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Pamela has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Pamela has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Pamela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 47-year-old Ugandan married to Angelica with six children aged 20, 18, 15, 12, 10 and 7. Four of the children attend school.

George is a farmer who grows coffee but he is also an agricultural produce trader and also has a retail shop which supplements his income. He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy corn, the reason being that a large population of the locals is involved in farming and so he will get it cheap and sell at a profit.

George resides near a trading centre and the residents of the area are his major clients who provide markets for him.

His dreams/plans for the future include acquiring more land for agriculture and educating his children.

His major challenges are the changes in weather and crop diseases.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosie has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a manicure and pedicure service.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.ru: Зулайка, 54 года, замужем, 4 детей, все взрослые, семейные. У Зулайки - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1994 году с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Зулайки, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 15 коров разного возраста и земельный надел мерою 1,35 ГА, где Зулайка выращивает картофель и морковь для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зулайка обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы, что позволит развить ее хозяйство и повлечет за собой увеличение прибыли. Доходы от кредита Зулайка планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zulaika is 54 years old, married and has 4 children, all of whom are grown and have their own families. Zulaika has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 1994 with a purchase of livestock. Thanks to Zulaika's hard work, today her business contains 15 different-age cows and 1.35 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and carrots for sale. The monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zulaika requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 cows and mineral fertilizers to treat the soil, which will allow her to develop her business and result in an increased profit. Zulaika plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and mineral fertilizers to treat the soil

loans.name: Villa Yvate Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una pone su mayor esmero en poder crecer en sus respectivas actividades, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras.
La señora Nilsa es la presidenta del  comité, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería, y también a la venta de tortas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de lencerías para la reventa, ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que a través del grupo podrá capacitarse e ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this committee engage in different business activities. Each member invests a great deal of care so that they can grow in their respective businesses, but they also help one another.

Sra. Nilsa is the president of this committee. She sells lingerie, but also sells cakes. Nilsa is a hardworking woman who strives to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy lingerie that she can resell. Nilsa is extremely grateful for the opportunity she has received. Through her group, she will be able to receive training and keep improving.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Robier

texts.en:
Robier is 19 years old. He is a single man who lives with his parents in a remote area of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business in a rice farmland that is located near his house. So far, he has been involved in this career for four years. He is able to make a net profit of $10 per day, on average.

Robier wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Juditha works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and a general store. Juditha is borrowing  29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel, esta divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres ya son independientes, solo vive con el menor que esta en etapa escolar,  viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Si bien percibe ingresos como técnico mecánico, Ezequiel ha visto que es mas fácil para él obtener dinero como chofer, por lo que solicita un credito para cumplir con los tramites de la obtencion de licencia de conducir Ezequiel no tiene a nadie que le ayude por eso quiere su colaboracion. Nótese que el monto es uno de los más bajos que hemos registrado, esperamos que puedan ayudarle a la brevedad posible.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is divorced and has four children, three of whom are already independent. Only the youngest child, who is of school age, lives with him. They live in a house that only consists of one room. The house is located in the city of La Paz.

Ezequiel earns income as a mechanical technician, but he has found out that it is easier to make money as a driver. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can file the paperwork needed to obtain a driver’s license. Ezequiel has no one else to rely on for assistance, so he wants to submit this request. This loan amount is one of the lowest that IMPRO has submitted, so hopefully it will be funded as soon as possible.

loans.use: to file the paperwork for obtaining a driver's license.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, esta acompañada y tiene 3 hijas; dos estudian y una esta acompañada, su compañero de vida viajo a Estados Unidos, desde hace dos años, ella tiene desde 2001 un taller de costura y trabaja haciendo uniformes para las escuelas publicas. Ella aprendió el trabajo gracias a que su papá le regalo una maquina de cocer;  luego el abuelo le pago el estudio en la academia para que aprendiera ese oficio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para reconstruir una pared que se derrumbó con un terremoto reciente en el país.  Desea que una de sus hijas estudie para doctora y ella esta dispuesta a apoyarla la otra hija quiere ser como ella y también le enseña para que aprenda un oficio y puede tener su empleo en casa.
texts.en:
