María is 33 years old and has an eighth grade education. She is married and has three daughters; two attend school and one is married. Her life companion went to live in the United States two years ago. 

She has had a sewing workshop since 2001 and works making uniforms for the public schools. She learned this work thanks to the fact that her father gave her a sewing machine, then her grandfather paid for her to study at a vocational school so that she might learn that trade.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to rebuild a wall that collapsed during a recent earthquake in the country. 

She wants one of her daughters to study to be a doctor and she is prepared to help her. The other daughter wants to be like her, and she is teaching her so that she can learn a trade and work from home.

loans.use: To rebuild a wall that collapsed during a recent earthquake in the country.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 61 years old. He lives with his wife in a remote area of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business in a rice farmland that is located near his house. So far, he has been involved in this career for 24 years. He is able to make a net profit of $5 per day, on average.

Sarom wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has been able to bring up her five children and provide them with a good-quality education. Rose is a very loving and responsible mother who always does all she can for her family so that they have a good quality of living.

Many years ago, she started to sell green bananas, fruits and vegetables close to her homestead. When her husband got sick and was unable to work for some time, she had to increase her sales to support the household expenses. So she had to work very hard.

Today Rose has some requests from her clients and, since she does not have a lot of capital, she is looking for a loan to buy papayas, watermelons and bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas, fruits and vegatables

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 60 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice and corn in the Philippines. Carlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Carlita has been farming rice and corn for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Elvira has been farming vegetables for 24 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Emelyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall. Bebelyn has been in this business for 11 years. Bebelyn earns more income from prepaid mobile load.

Bebelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruits

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркул 44 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. У Атыркул среднее образование, она ведет свое небольшое хозяйство с 2004 года, занимается животноводством и полеводством, в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 30 овец, 16 коз и 2 лошади. Также на земельном наделе мерою 1,50 ГА Атыркул выращивает пшеницу и эспарцет. Добрые и хорошие отношения в семье дают хороший результат, а именно на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль до 10,000 сом (KGS). Атыркул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и намерена накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Atyrkul is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. Atyrkul has a secondary education and has been running her small business since 2004, involved in animal husbandry and farming and has 3 cows, 30 sheep, 16 goats and 2 horses. Atyrkul also grows wheat and sainfoin on 1.50 hectares of land. Her good and kind family relationships provide a good result, specifically today her business yields a monthly profit of up to 10,000 som (KGS).  Atyrkul requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep. Atyrkul plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase her livestock headcount and intends to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and frozen foods to resell

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zosima is 44 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Zosima has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Zosima has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a resilient young farmer, 29 years old, who learned to work in the countryside due to his family background. He was very young when he was orphaned. He is a man who lives with his siblings. He doesn't have a partner. He works hard to earn sufficient income to support his siblings and meet their needs. 

He needs a loan to purchase supplies to re-fertilize his fields. The amount is considerable; the price is very high and rural people don't have the money to pay this cost in cash.

He dreams of continuing to progress and to find someone to share his life with. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Organizadas, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento.
La Sra. Isabel es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad, sale a vender su productos alrededor de su zona y un poco mas alejado donde tiene sus clientes. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como comestibles y bebidas.
Todas agradecen porque con el programa de comité de mujeres podrán ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Organizadas” (Organized Women) is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of Concepción, which is in a remote area in the central region. This place is still growing.

Sra. Isabel is one of the members. She is from an area that is distant from the central part of the city. Isabel sells her products in the surrounding neighborhoods and in areas that are a bit further out where she has customers. She is requesting a loan in order to buy various items to sell, such as food products and beverages.

All of the members are appreciative because the Women’s Committee Program will enable them to improve.

loans.use: to buy food products and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 20-year-old married man from Jenin City. He lives with his wife in a small room in the family house. Shadi works with his father in a restaurant they have. They sell traditional sandwiches and soft drinks. It is a very good business and the demand is high.

Shadi took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials for the family restaurant. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to increase his productivity and also his sales. Shadi appears in the photo while he is working.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for the family restaurant.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida, 59, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost seven years,  earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. She also sells snacks such as noodles and porridge to generate additional income. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses and medicines. Due to insufficient capital, she would like a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase gasoline, juices, canned goods, detergent soap, toothpaste, food seasonings, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and expand so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, juices, canned goods, detergent soap, toothpaste, food seasonings, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann is a 51-year-old. He lives in a remote area of Battambang Province, Cambodia. He is a married man who has two dependent children. He is a soldier. Besides his main job, he also helps his wife to manage and operate a farming business, growing cassava and selling the crops to the local dealers. He is able to make a net profit of USD 5.00 per day, on average.

Chann wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Through prayers and trust with the Lord, Felicitas believes that she can succeed life’s hardships. Felicitas is a widow and a mother of three from Jaen, Nueva Ecija. Even though she is earning from buying and selling Palay grains, she can’t sustain her daughter’s college education, for she is the only one who provides for the family. 

Her daughter Jennifer is a student of BS Criminology. As the eldest among the siblings, Jennifer wants to finish college to be able to help her mother support the schooling of her younger siblings.

loans.use: to pay for daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk, cheese and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell snack foods

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ligaya is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig-fattening business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jeriel

texts.en:
Jeriel works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jeriel requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Jeriel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 41 years old and has five children. Rhoda is a married woman, and two of the children are in school.

Rhoda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rhoda has been raising pigs for 16 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shrifa Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four women from Hodiedah, Yemen. After all the members finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan which was given by Kiva lenders, they applied for a second loan of 120,000 YER.

Shrifa applied for a first loan to purchase a new sewing machine to increase her business more. In reality, the first loan which was given by Kiva lenders helped her very much to improve her business more. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan. After she finished the repayment of the installments of the first loan, she applied for a second loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase stylish fabrics to increase her business more to be able to meet all the demands of her customers. Sharifa hopes to be financed in this loan.

loans.use: to purchase stylish fabrics to increase her business more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.name: El Chaguite Group

texts.es: El chagüite es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, quien lo coordina es la señora Rosa de 44 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica  al destace de cerdo, además elabora nacatamales, este negocio lo impulso hace quince años con capital suministrado por su hijo, es segundo ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de un cerdo en pie, con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la los productos ofrecidos, ya que este es uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene en su comunidad. El resto de integrantes son la señora Damaris quien tiene la edad de 30 años y comercializa pescados y tomate en Tisma desde hace cuatro años, y la señora Augustina de 49 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dieciocho años.
texts.en:
“El Chagüite” is a solidarity group that consists of three enterprising women. The coordinator is Sra. Rosa. She is 44 years old and in a relationship. Rosa is in the business of butchering pigs, but she also makes Nicaraguan tamales. Her business was started 15 years ago with capital provided by her son. This is the second time she is requesting a loan from ADIM. She will purchase a live pig. With her previous loan, Rosa was able to increase the amount of products she could offer since she experiences a great deal of demand in her community.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Damaris is 30 years old. She has been selling fish and tomatoes in Tisma for four years.
• Sra. Augustina is 49 years old. She has been the owner of a grocery store for 18 years.

loans.use: to buy a live pig for butchering.

loans.name: Kuña Tekove Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Kuña Tekove” está integrado por 17 señoras ellas tienen diversas actividades comerciales, pero también se ayudan y hacen actividades en conjunto que fomentan el compañerismo. Son Señoras muy emprendedoras y solidarias en la comunidad.
Rogelia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la costura, es una señora que es muy buena en lo que hace, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que le llevan trabajos para hacer. Su sueño es poder tener un gran taller donde pueda dar trabajo también a otras personas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, lo que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá continuar con sus confecciones.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Tekove” consists of 17 women who engage in different business activities. They have been able to strengthen their camaraderie by helping one another and working together on other activities. These enterprising women are supportive of their community.

Rogelia is one of the members. She is a seamstress and is very good at what she does. Rogelia already has a good clientele who bring her work to do. Her dream is to have a large workshop where she can provide jobs to other people.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread. This will be a great help since she will be able to continue sewing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Omurgul

texts.ru: Омургул 33 года, замужем, мать троих детей школьного возраста. У Омургул среднее образование, вместе с супругом уже много лет занимаются животноводством и полеводством. На участке мерою 1,0 ГА собственной и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли Омургул выращивает ячмень, клевер и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Также в хозяйстве Омургул имеется: 4 коровы и 50 овец. Деятельность Омургул приносит ей прибыль в размере 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Омургул нужно построить теплый сарай для скота и подготовить его на зиму, она считает, что не нужно продавать скот для постройки сарая, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку цемента, щебня и прочих строительных материалов. Кредит поможет Омургул сохранить скот, улучшить условия для его содержания  и получить весной здоровый приплод. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Omurgul is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-age children. Omurgul has a secondary education and, together with her husband, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming. Omurgul grows barley, clover and corn for household consumption. Omurgul's business also contains 4 cows and 50 sheep. Omurgul's business yields her a profit of 20,00 som (KGS) per month. Omurgul needs to build a warm barn for her livestock and prepare for the winter. She does not think that she needs to sell livestock to build the barn, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cement, gravel and other building materials. The loan will help Omurgul to save her livestock, improve conditions for keeping it and get healthy offsprings in the spring. She will invest the earnings from the loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel and other building materials in order to build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells local brew and spirits on both a retail and wholesale basis at the market. She has been in this business for 9 years. She works 7 days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer, and spirits. She also generates additional income by selling onions and cabbages. The main business challenges for Milly include defaulters and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. 

Milly lives in a rented house and has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, jerrycans of local brew, and spirits.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years and earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 58 years old and widowed with one child.

Emerita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc..

Emerita has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Emerita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Cresencia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippenes. She has been in this business for 14 years. Marlyn earns more income from pig fattening.

Marlyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ay's Group

texts.en:
Ay, 40, is a mother of eight children living in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice to earn an income to support her family. She  earns extra income fishing. She  earns 38,900 KHR per day. 

This is Ay's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of 2 and will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can increase the yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 44 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family that consists of five persons; her, her husband, and three sons. She lives with her family at Dhupguri, a small town in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband Mekhan is a mason by profession. One of her sons is a student of grade 6, one works as a mason, and the third one is unemployed. 

Though Kalpana has a primary education, she is active and hardworking and determined to help the family.  When she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them, then she decided to start a tailoring business at home.  She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to people of her locality. She mainly stitches ladies' garments like frocks, salwar suits, blouses, petticoats, etc. 

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives, and the local community.  She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her stitching work, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. 

So Kalpana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BJS to issue her loan as per her requirement. Kalpana is very hopeful that this loan will help her to enhance her business as well as income.

She is very thankful to Kiva partner BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, 33, is married with three dependent children who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Morng Russey district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for ten years, earning about KHR70,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR40,000 each day. 

Saron received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Saron wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
Aun, 47, lives with family members in the rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of seven children, two attend school and  two are not yet school age. 

She earns an income selling  cassava and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for many years and earns34,400 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She leads a group of 2 and will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer. 

She hopes to improve the yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 27-year-old woman from the rural village Anandanagar in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Saraswati sends her children to the local village school. 

She is a hardworking mother who struggles hard and tries to give her children everything they need. Saraswati and her husband both are engaged in a business of making bori (a conical ball made of pulses), used in vegetable curry in India. She prepares bori and dries it (as shown in the picture)and then sell them in market. They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They work hard to generate income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family.

Saraswati is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase ingredients to make more bori, in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business which will generate more income. She dreams of earning more profit from her business and hopes to have a comfortable life and further expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for their "Bori" business (a conical ball made of pulses).

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Maya is a housewife and mother of two children. She lives in the village of Kalirhat under Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri. Her husband is engaged in agricultural work and his income is not enough for their family. To meet the excess expenditures, Maya helps her husband in his agricultural work so they can have some extra earnings to solve their poor economic condition.

Maya’s husband Gangadhar cultivates their own farmland but the area of their land is not very large so they cannot produce a sufficient harvest. They think if there are a variety of products they can produce,  then their earnings may also increase with that variety. Now Maya has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS to buy broad bean seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of broad bean. 

The loan enables Maya and her husband to cultivate more broad beans and they may earn more revenue for their family’s well being. The extra income will also be used for the higher education of their children and they may able to stand on their own feet.

Maya gives her heartfelt homage to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of broad beans.

loans.name: Anaju

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Anaju is an active and enterprising woman. She lives in Baroghoria, a small village in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). All are students of different grades.  Anaju is an uneducated woman; she can sign her name only. Her husband Hamidul is also illiterate. He earns for the family by cultivating vegetables.

Anaju's husband's income is barely enough for his family. So, to earn an additional income, Anaju is involved in an animal husbandry. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they are full grown. It takes 8-9 months for her to have them ready to sell.

Anaju goes out in the morning to leave the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way, she is earning to manage her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily needs.

Anaju wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase more goats. In this way, she can earn a good amount from her business. She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can earn more, and she will strengthen her family’s economy.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 27 years old and living with her husband and three children(two sons, one daughter). Her husband, Bappi, 29 years old, is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. They live at Baroghoria, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district. Alima attended school until eighth grade, and her husband passed fifth standard. Her children are receiving education. 

Alima's husband started to cultivate vegetables, but later on he grew paddy. Now he mainly grows paddy, which is in good demand in the market, being the staple food for the people of their locality. He cultivates paddy with the help of Alima. He harvests and sells the produce in the local markets. He has a very good relationship with his customers, as he supplies quality products at cheaper rates and on time.  

Now, they have a new idea of cultivating paddy on a large scale to provide better economic conditions to the family. But due to a shortage of funds, he can't fulfill his dream.

To help her husband, Alima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to earn more income from her current business to improve their living conditions. She will use the loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

She dreams of constructing a decent and better house for them with the profit generated, and she is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her husband's paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Ghaitha Group

texts.en:
Ghaitha is the same group which has received a previous loan from Kiva lenders. This group is consists of four women from Hodiedah city, Yemen. They applied for a second loan of 170,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Halima is the same leader of the first group. She has applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to buy a new fridge to keep ice cream cold. In reality, the first loan helped her very much increase her business. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help. Halima didn't complete the first loan and applied for a concurrent loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase a mount of ice cream materials such as sugar, tang, and other items to make ice cream and sell in the streets to improve her business more. All the members of this group hope to be financing this loan too.

loans.use: to purchase a mount of ice cream materials such as sugar, tang and other items to make ice cream

loans.name: Wilian Noel

texts.es:
Wilian de 32 años de edad, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria, esta casado desde hace cinco años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Wilian es albañil desde hace 5 años cuando después de acompañarse comenzó a trabajar como ayudante con un amigo y vio que era una buena fuente de ingreso, aprendió y decidió ponerlo en practica su experiencia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una motocicleta, pues le es muy útil para desplazarse a su trabajo, debido a que tiene que salir a otras comunidades.
texts.en:
Wilian is 32 and only studied up to fourth grade in primary school. He has been married for 5 years, and his wife looks after the home.

Wilian has been working as a bricklayer for 5 years. When he decided to get together with his wife, he began to work as an assistant with a friend and, seeing that it was a good source of income, he learnt it and decided to put his experience into practice.

He is asking for a loan through CREDICAMPO to buy a motor cycle. This will make it very easy to get to his work as he has to go out to other communities.

loans.use: to buy a motor cycle as this will make it very easy to get to his work.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta acompañado , es agricultor, no estudio, porque en el lugar donde vivían estaba lejos la escuela y no tenían opción. Es padre de un hijo, su señora se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al comercio de pescado fresco, desde hace unos 4 años por motivos de salud se quedo sin dinero para la inversión y desea comenzar de nuevo.  Benjamín es agricultor y trabaja como jornalero.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pescado y seguir llevando ingresos a su casa a través del apoyo de su compañera de vida. É piensa en grande pero por el nivel de pobreza, porque teme no poder darle a su hijo el estudio adecuado para su desarrollo profesional y tenga que quedarse como agricultor igual que él.
texts.en:
Benjamín is a 57-year-old farmer. He has a partner. He did not have the opportunity to study because the place where he lived was far from the school and they didn't have the option. Benjamín is the father of one child and his wife works as a homemaker and as a fresh fish merchant. For health reasons, she hasn't had money to invest in the business for four years, and they would like to start again. 

Benjamín is a farmer and works as a daily labourer. The loan that Benjamín is requesting from Credicampo is to purchase fish and to continue to bring home an income to his household through the support of his life partner. He thinks big but for their level of poverty. He fears he will not be able to provide his son with an adequate education for his professional development, and that he will remain a farmer like his father.

loans.use: to purchase fish and continue to bring home an income with the support of his life partner.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo es un una persona que ha luchado muy duro para salir adelante, ha formado una familia con una esposa que lo apoya de manera incondicional y un hijo pequeño quien es el principal motor de su vida para luchar, vive en San Martin junto a ellos.
Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, ha sembrado cacao y también está innovando con el maíz y el plátano porque quiere diversificar sus productos y así tener más demanda entre sus clientes. Él se esfuerza siempre en obtener buenos productos, y cree que le está yendo bien por su dedicación y gran trabajo.
Raymundo en esta oportunidad piensa utilizar el crédito para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao y así obtener una excelente cosecha, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con los ingresos adicionales que obtenga podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Raymundo is a person who has fought very hard to get ahead. He has a family with a spouse who supports him unconditionally and a young son who is his principal motivation in life to keep fighting. Raymundo lives in San Martin with his family.

For more than 20 years, Raymundo has worked in agriculture. He plants cacao and is also innovating with maize and banana crops because he wishes to diversify his products and thereby increase the demand from his customers. He always pushes himself to obtain a good product and he thinks that it is going well thanks to his dedication and hard work. 

On this occasion, Raymundo plans to use the loan to care for his cacao crops in order to obtain an excellent harvest. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that the additional income he could earn would help improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his cacao crops.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She makes chips at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, cabbages, cooking oil, charcoal and tomato sauce. 

Her major challenges includes seasonality of Irish potatoes and power shortages. Her goal is to buy a fridge so as to start serving cold drinks. She would also like to buy better serving utensils for her customers. 

She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cabbages, tomato sauce, charcoal and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of five children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling fresh fish and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy fresh fish.

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability of fish. She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked stall and also to buy a fridge to keep fish that has not been sold.

She resides in her own house and the family has no electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock to fatten up for sale in 6 months, and in this way to take advantage of his crop residues.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, donde creció era el grado más alto que enseñaban, por lo que para continuar tenía que trasladarse a la ciudad, por lo que sus recursos ya no se lo permitieron.  Es madre soltera pero con unas grandes ganas de sacar a delante a sus hijos, la niña de 12 años cursa  cuarto grado, y el de 8 segundo grado, los otros aun no asisten. Ella vive alquilando ya que no tiene una casa propia donde vivir.  

Ella es tortillera, el negocio es propio desde hace 6 años de dedicarse, la necesidad de tener ingresos al hogar la llevo a tomar acciones, ya que es ella la principal fuente de ingreso para sus hijos, al ver que la actividad le producía y le generaba ganancias, fue así como se decidió a continuar, también es ama de casa. El puesto de las tortillas lo tiene a las afueras de su casa, es un lugar bastante transitado por lo que la venta es bastante buena, no le toca hacer ningún recorrido ya que esta inmediato. 

Inicia desde las 4 am a preparar el maíz, luego va al molino y a las 9 am está iniciando y termina a las 3 pm. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  dos quintales de maíz y un viaje de leña, ya que es la materia prima para la actividad que realiza,  la mejora que el préstamo hará es el poder comprar lo necesario para su actividad.

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes espera apoyar en sus estudios hasta donde le alcancen su economía,  con lo que les dará una mejor estabilidad y un diferente estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37 years old, studied until the fourth grade. This was the highest grade they taught where she lived. She would have had to have moved to the city to continue her studies, but her family's resources did not permit this. Rosa is a single mother with a huge desire to help her children get ahead. Her 12-year-old daughter is in the fourth grade and the 8-year-old is in the second grade, while her other children are not in school yet. She rents her home since she does not have her own home to live in. 

Rosa has run her own business making tortillas for the last six years. The need to bring home an income led her to take action, since she is the main source of income for her children. When she saw that tortilla-making helped and generated earnings, she decided to continue with it. She is also a housekeeper. 

Rosa's tortilla stand is just outside her home, in a well-travelled area, which means that her sales are pretty good. She doesn't have to commute because the business is nearby. She begins her day at 4:00 am, preparing the maize, then goes to the mill. She starts sales at 9:00 am and finishes at 3:00 pm.

Rosa is requesting this loan in order to purchase two quintals of maize and a load of wood, since it is the primary material for making tortillas. The best that the loan will do is make it possible to purchase the necessary inputs for her activities. Rosa's dream is to continue to grow her sales, and thereby make better earnings in order to help her children to get ahead. She hopes to support them through their studies as much as she is able to economically, which will provide them with more stability and a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase two quintals of maize and a load of wood, the primary materials for her work.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a married mother of five children and three go to school. She takes care of an additional family member.

She is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed and feeding trays.  

She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include diseases which affect the quality of her poultry. She is aspiring of building more rooms for her poultry.    

She resides in her own house and the family has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and feeding trays.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU est une jeune  femme âgée de 39 ans qui évolue dans la confection des habits pour hommes, femmes et enfants. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans un autre quartier que celui du guichet. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter des tissus pour la confection des habits qu’elle vend à ces clients.  Elle a comme charges particulières ces besoins personnels car c’est son mari qui gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour descendre à 13h pour reprendre ses activités  à 15h après le repas de midi pour finir sa journée à 20h. Elle souhaite diversifier ses commandes afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Astou is a 39-year old woman who is building up her business making clothes for men, women and children. She is married and a mother and she lives in a different area to the one where the branch is. She has more than ten years' experience and is asking for this loan to buy fabric to make clothes which she will sell to her customers. She has responsibility for providing for her own personal needs only since her husband manages the family's daily outgoings and their children's school fees. She begins her day at nine o'clock in the morning and has a break between  one and three in the afternoon before returning after lunch to work until eight o'clock at night. She would like to diversify her orders so that she can increase her customer base and her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes and sell them.

loans.name: Inyungu Group

texts.fr:
Callixte fait partie du groupe Inyungu  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 34 ans et est marié à Euphrasie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 a 12 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de bière de banane et de bière industrielle depuis 5 ans. 

C’est à son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de casiers de bière  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Callixte belongs to the Inyungu group and lives in Gitega. He is 34 years old and married to Euphrasie, a farmer. They have four children together, ranging from three to 12 years of age; two of the children are studying.

Callixte has been selling banana beer and industrial beer for the past five years and this is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of crates of beer to resell, so he can earn more money.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of crates of beer to resell so he can make more money.

loans.name: Kafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kafo est composé uniquement de  femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de toutes les qualités, du jus, des parures, des oignons et des céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assan (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans des habits (pagnes wax).Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20m de basins, 20 pièces de pagne  wax et 25m de légers en gros au grand marché de Bamako.La revente se fait en détails au marché de Badialan et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Assan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Kafo group is made up exclusively of polygamous women. They average 32 years of age with five children each, and they all live in the Kanadjiguila municipality in the Mandé circle of Kati. They got to know each other as neighbors and have small businesses selling clothing of all qualities ("pagnes wax"), juice, linen sets, onions and cereals. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they could get fresh supplies for cash, and they are on their second group loan.

Assan (who is standing second from the right in the photo) has a good reputation for selling clothing ("pagnes wax" which are brightly colored and highly decorative pieces of African cloth). She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 meters of damask fabric, 20 pieces of "pagne wax" and 20 pieces of light fabric wholesale at Bamako's Grand Market. She resells her goods on a retail basis at Badialan market and on a door-to-door basis to a mixed customer base. With this loan Assan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her aim is to use this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed and has six children. None of her children go to school, but she takes care of additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying for utility bills. 

She has a restaurant and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, beans, flour, rice and beef. Imelda earns additional income from renting out rooms. 

Her major business challenges include rainy seasons and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beef, flour, rice, beans, green bananas.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredeme est composé uniquement de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’oignons, ustensiles plastiques, du bois de chauffe, de pains, d’encens et d’habits. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 sacs d’oignons en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à  Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée de femmes. Madame Djénèba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Yeredeme group is made up exclusively of polygamous women. They average 35 years of age with five children each, and they all live in the Kanadjiguila municipality in the Mandé circle of Kati. They got to know each other as neighbors and have small businesses selling onions, plastic goods, firewood, bread, incense and clothing. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they could build up their stocks, and they are on their second group loan.

Djénèba (who is standing second from the left in the photo) has a good reputation for selling onions. She is planning to use her loan to buy five sacks of onions wholesale in Médine. She resells her onions on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila to a female customer base. With this loan Djénèba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 95,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her aim is to use this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with ten children, five of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. 

Sarah has been selling green bananas on a retail basis in the market for the last 12 years, working six days a week. She has applied for a loan of Ugandan Shillings 2,000,000  to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell. She has no other source of income. 

The main business challenges she faces include seasonality and transportation. She would like to buy a delivery van in order to ease transportation and also to build her own house. She is renting a house with both electricity and piped water now. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Kossiwa âgée de 41ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Tous sont scolarisés. Elle revend des pagnes et chaussures de façon ambulante à KPALIME(une ville située à environ 122km de la ville de Lomé). Elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère étendre leurs activités et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is 41 years old, married, and has three children under her care. The children all go to school.

Kossiwa sells pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and shoes by traveling around Kpalimé (a town about 122 kilometers from Lomé). She is seeking her first loan to buy more goods in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

Kossiwa hopes to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and shoes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is single with one child. She has no additional family members. 

She is tailor. She has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials for making clothes. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality.  

She aspires to buy an electric sewing machine. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Tegawendé1 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de femmes travaille dans le domaine de la restauration et de l'habillement. Ces braves dames travaillent avec ACFIME depuis 2008 et elles sont toujours à jour de leur remboursement. Haoua, emprunteur représentatif est veuve et elle à 3 enfants à sa charges. Cette dame battante a scolarisé ses 3 enfants à l'aide du commerce des pagnes qu'elle fait. Ce prêt lui sera d'une importance capital car elle pourra s'approvisionner en pagne de plusieurs qualités pour son commerce. Cette veuve avec le bénéfice de ses ventes soldera la scolarité des ses enfants, prendra soins de sa famille et continuer son commerce.
texts.en: This group of women works in the restauration and clothing trades. These good women have been working with ACFIME since 2008 and are always on time with their repayments. Haoua, who is the representative borrower of the group, is a widow and has three children in her care. She is a fighter and manages to educate her children with the help of her business selling "pagnes" (brightly colored pieces of African fabric). This loan will be of great significance to her because it will enable her to get fresh supplies of "pagnes" of various quality for her business. With the profit she makes from her sales this widow will be able to pay the balance of her children's school fees, take care of her family and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African fabric) for resale.

loans.name: Jay Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Subhadra is 33 and the mother of two children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Nayagarh  district of Odisha, India. She and her husband both are engaged in vegetable selling. 

Subhadra has requested a loan for her and her husband's green grocery business. She has been selling vegetables for eight years, and she sells seasonal fresh vegetables in her hometown. Her husband has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now her husband has opened a shop to sell his vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial supplies to run his shop correctly. 

The needs of his family have suddenly increased recently and he does not have any other sources of income to cope with these needs. Therefore he decided to expand his current business, and he wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize his vegetable sales every day.

Subhadra has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Peoples Forum, so that her husband can buy an initial stock of seasonal vegetables and both can sell them to make more money.

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities such as milk selling, grocery store etc. Subhadra thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders and Kiva's field partner, Peoples Forum.

loans.use: to buy an initial stock of seasonal vegatables.

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak, 20, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with one kid. The main family’s sources of income are from growing rice. She has been in this business for 2 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day.

Sreyleak is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreyleak wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Bhagyalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
The Nayagarh District of Odisha is witness to the most brightly colored sarees and typical shawls. It is impossible for any tourist to stop and not admire this product, and get a good deal for it. This is the work of Sailbala, 41 years old with great aspirations to publicize her community and acquaint all who visit with the work she does with so much effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband and together they desire to get ahead in life and achieve the big dreams that she wants to do in life. She has three children. The first two children are excellent students in the university and third one is in school.

The work she does so lovingly is the buying and selling of typical fabrics. This activity is done at home and in nearby places in the community where she lives. She has been doing this work for 15 years. The second job she has is selling packet food items made ​​with her ​​husband for the past five years. Thus they generate a profit for the welfare of their family and improve the economic conditions of their families and communities.

She has been an example in her community and that is why a group of women have joined with Sailbala to improve their businesses so that each of them can get ahead and generate more revenue.

The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of merchandise such as typical costumes which she will then sell around her community. One of her aspirations is to have a stall in the local market in her community and see her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as typical clothing.

loans.name: Thean's Group

texts.en:
Thean is aged 41 and is a mother of five children, all of whom are in school. She and her husband make a living through farming rice, which they have been in for 11 years. The current business earns them about 60,000 KHR per day and they are able to save about 40,000 KHR daily for their future needs. 

This is the second loan for Thean with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Thean wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticide for her farmland and spend a portion of it for labor. She hopes to have more crops to sell them for a good price so as to let her family live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Tegawendé 2 Group

texts.fr: Tegawendé 2 est formé de 3 membres qui prennent des prêts a ACFIME depuis novembre 2011. Elisabeth, femme battante est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse du bois de chauffe depuis 10 ans. Ce prêt permettra  à Elisabeth de payer un chargement de bois pour vendre. Elle rendra un service énorme aux ménages car au Burkina, beaucoup utilisent encore le bois pour faire la cuisine. le commerce du bois est une activité rentable donc Elisabeth pourra faire ses remboursements sans difficulté et les bénéfices serviront à la continuité de son activité. En plus de cela, elle pourra aidé son mari à faire face aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Tegawendé 2 is made up of three members who have had loans with ACFIME since November, 2011. Elisabeth, a brave woman, is married and a mother of four children. Three of the children go to school.

Elisabeth has been selling firewood for ten years. This loan will allow her to buy a load of firewood. She sells this firewood mostly to housewives, because in Burkina Faso, many still use wood for cooking. Selling wood is a profitable business, therefore Elisabeth will be able to make repayments without difficulty. 

Profits will serve to continue her business. In addition, she can [also] help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khen is aged 47 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. She and her husband earn a living through growing corn and they have been in this business for almost twenty years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 60,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the third loan for Khen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to have a better crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is 48 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province. To make a living, Mach has been farming rice and working for other for a fee. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Mach is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Sophat is aged 40 and is living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice as the main source of income and they have been in this business for 20 years. 

Sophat is in her fourth cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income so they can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis only, in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to start importing used clothes.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of her mother. She resides in the family's house where she has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

Sarah sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week and has been in this business for the past seven years. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy several bales of used shoes to sell. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used shoes and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy several bales of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44 years old, Sreang is a rural villager from the Kang Meas district. She earns a living through planting rice as her main source of income and she has been in this business for 24 years. She has six children. To supplement the income from rice, she also sells Khmer noodle. The current businesses earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Sreang’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is the first cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more ingredients and some materials for making Khmer noodle. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and some materials for making Khmer noodles.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She has a butchery business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cattle for slaughtering. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and Kampala capital city authority law enforcement officers. She is aspiring to buy a bigger fridge to keep unsold meet. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.name: Nor's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Nor is a 21-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming and working for others for a fee have been the sources for her family’s income and the way she makes a living for 3 years. The current businesses earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Nor’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. She is in her first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and is leading her group to apply for a loan, Nor, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ami Atiwossa

texts.fr:
Agée de  32 ans, Ami habite le quartier Attiégou. Cette jeune femme célibataire a débuté en 2009 le commerce ambulant des produits de beauté. Elle sillonne les quartiers environnants pour vite écouler ses marchandises et s’approvisionne deux (02) fois dans le mois au grand marché de Lomé.

Faute de fonds de roulement insuffisant et la forte demande des clients, elle sollicite diversifier ses  produits en achetant 03 parfums et 06 douzaines de pommade.
texts.en:
Ami is 32 years old and lives in Attiégou. This young woman is single and has been selling beauty products by traveling around since 2009. She travels around surrounding neighborhoods and quickly sells her goods which she procures twice a month in the Lomé Grand Market.

With insufficient cash flow and strong customer demand, she is seeking [a loan] to diversify her products by buying three [units of] perfumes and six dozen ointments.

loans.use: to buy three units of perfume and six dozen ointments

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, aged 35, is a mother of three kids, one whom is still in school. She struggles for a living, growing cassava on a two hectare area. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. 

This is not the first loan for Saran with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loan successfully for this cycle. Now, she is requesting a new loan in order to support her cassava business and to pay for weeding fees. 

She hopes that she can gain a better yield from her cassava than before.

loans.use: to support her cassava business and to pay for weeding fees.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha is 44 years old and a widowed mother of four children. Her residential area is in Kampong Cham province where her rice is grown. Besides agribusiness, she works at a construction site to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for ages. 

This is the second cycle for Sopha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan and it has returned her a decent income to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she teamed up in group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kanouya 2 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de femmes dynamiques travaille avec ACFIME depuis 3 ans et jusque là, ces dames ont toujours été à jour de leur remboursement. Djaha, membre représentatif est marié et mère de 3 enfants. Cette brave dame fait de la bouillie à base du petit mil et du dégué aussi fait à partir du petit mil et du yaourt. Avec ce prêt, Djaha pourrait acheter des sacs de petit mil  et de lait pour son commerce. les bénéfices serviront à pérenniser son activités et à s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of dynamic women has worked with ACFIME for three years and has always been on time with their repayments.

Djaha, the representative [for the group], is married and a mother of three children.

This brave woman makes millet porridge and dégué, another type of porridge made from millet and yogurt.

With this loan, Djaha would be able to buy sacs of millet and milk for her business. 

Profits will serve to continue her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy milk and millet to make yogurt and porridge

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Jenifer lives in a rented house: her family has electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Jenifer operates a beauty salon and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation.  

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, oils, relaxers and a hand dryer. She aspires to buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, treatments, oils, relaxers and a hand dryer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of three children; two of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. 

She operates a beauty salon, and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cosmetics, cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. She works from home and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. She generates additional income through tailoring. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. 

She is aspes to build rental houses. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to see her business and her family prosper. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy relaxers, treatments, weaves, cosmetics,and braids.

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is aged 50 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she has eight children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for twenty years earning about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Loun’s group consists of three members who are all female and she has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Loun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sochan's Group

texts.en:
A rural village from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Sochan is aged 39 and is married with four children. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living through farming rice. They have been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day.  

Sochan has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and successfully paid back the past loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her family improve their business. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sochan wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income so as to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife and blessed with 4 children. Her husband runs a general store in Lahore. He is a hardworking and fair person. He has 10 years of experience in this business. His business has grown over the years and he has managed to maintain a good customer base. He still wants his business to become self-sufficient. 

He needs to buy inventory for the store. So Razia has requested a loan to help her husband buy inventory to overcome the shortage in stock. They are hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is aged 35, a mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits and betel leaf at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the fruits. Therefore, Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could be empowered to buy seasonal and fresh fruits.

Farzana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and betel leaf for the shop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Sarah is a hairdresser and has been in this business for six years. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Sarah generates additional income by selling cosmetics. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages.

Sarah has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids, weaves, shampoo and hair chemicals for her salon. She aspires to owning a fully stocked salon and also a fridge. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO due to their good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, shampoo and hair chemicals for her salon

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is aged 36; she is a mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband works selling dairy products like milk, curd, butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk every day to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He provides for the necessities in his household from his income from milk sales. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through milk sale business. So Razia requested a loan. In this way she can support  her husband's milk sales business.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a milk sales business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. 

For many days now his rickshaw hasn't been working properly because it has been used so regularly. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore Nazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazia is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 33-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 5 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Humaira is also providing sewing services and earns income so she can contribute and help her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and other things for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Humaira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her tailoring business.
