loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

For the past six years, Teddy has operated a business where she sells used clothes. She sells door to door on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. 

Teddy has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.  She aspires to own a fully stocked clothes stall. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO due to their good customer care.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Annet rents a house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Annet operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for three years. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality.

Annet has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, sugar, rice and cartons of salt. She aspires to owning a fridge so she can start selling cold drinks. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO due to their good customer care.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, rice and cartons of salt

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in Lahore. She is 44 and blessed with 6 children. Raising 6 children has not been easy for them therefore Nazia started embroidery to support her husband in his embroidery business. She has 9 years of experience doing embroidery. She is skilled and makes intricate designs and the customers are happy with her work. 

In order to empower herself more by contributing more to her husband's business she has requested a loan to buy raw material so she can make more orders. She wants to save money for her children's weddings and is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery work.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily fee because this rickshaw does not belonging to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs are growing as well. He was worried for many days about how to stop having to pay the daily fee, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Razia has been making savings for many days to buy new auto rickshaw for her son but at the time of purchasing she was short some of the needed money. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that now her son doesn't have to pay the daily fee to anyone, he will be able to have an increase in income. 

Razia is a 50-year-old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Razia is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Yasmeen's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are completely damaged. He has sold it to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Yasmeen's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw, so Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. 

Yasmeen and her husband thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, 33, is married and the mother of three children. Her husband, a driver by profession, provides transportation services with his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to maintain its functional routine. 

For this reason, Rukhsana has applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This work will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transportation service for his passengers. 

Rukhsana is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband fix his rickshaw.

loans.name: Jay Maa Parwati Shg Group

texts.en:
The “Jay Maa Parwati Shg” group is about to start its first loan cycle with Peoples Forum. The group is made up of eleven members and is run by a group committee of which Dhobani is the President. The businesses which the members of the group run are varied and include: selling groceries, selling vegetables and milk production. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Dhobani is one. Currently she has a business selling groceries items. She says she started this business four years ago.

The loan she is taking out now is to have capital for buying groceries in bulk. She will buy these from the wholesale vendors in the city of Nayagarh and will then sell them through customer orders. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she has four children.

She is grateful to Kiva and Peoples Forum for this support.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is 47, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, and she is the mother of six children. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. 

Shamim and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Shamim wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her elder daughter, so that she can contribute to the family income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy a new sewing machine for her daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Shamim thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Jhunu has been married for eight years and has two children. She lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her children in a brick house that her husband owns in a small village of Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. The home only has light and water.

Jhunu, the lady sitting with her hand raised, sells and manufactures milk and needs a loan for the purchase of a milking cow. Her husband helps her out working as a daily laborer, but what they both earn is not enough. It is for this reason the Jhunu would like your help. She enjoys her good health and is very hardworking.

Other women of this Maa Durga Shg areengaged in different activities such as milk selling, grocery shop, vegetable cultivation etc. and all would like to thank the Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth, aged 37, is the mother of six children and lives in Kampong Cham province. To earn her living, she grows rice as her main source of income and sells grocery items to supplement her earnings. She earns income of about 36,100 KHR per day. 

This is Sareth's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to request a loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she will then receive a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis 39, is married and a mother of 6 children. Her husband has a metal shop where he melts metals and uses molten cast iron to manufacture tools. He is hardworking and has gained enormous experience. He is the sole person earning in the family and makes sure that all his family needs are met. He needs to buy some tools and cast iron for manufacturing but is short of cash as he is unable to save due to increasing daily expenses.

Nargis has therefore requested for a loan to help him buy cast iron and tools. They are hopeful for a better future and thank Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy tools and cast iron for manufacturing.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and equally responsible for all of them. 

She belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses, so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers earning daily wages. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. 

Her son owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Suraiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son so that he would be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Suraiya is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana 36, is married and a mother of 5. They live in Lahore in a rented house. Her husband provides transportation services in Lahore. He has many years of experience driving a rickshaw. 

He now plans to buy a new rickshaw so that he can rent it out and earn some more money and become more stable. Farzana has therefore requested for a loan to help her husband with the purchase. They are hopeful for a better future. They thank the Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Thi's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thi is now 25 years old and married. She has two children. Thi and her husband are rice farmers: sometimes, they work for others for a fee to earn additional income. Their current business earns them about 70,000 KHR per day to support their family’s needs.

Thi is a nine loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden and to generate more income for her family. Thi is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to grow an increased amount of healthy rice to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 45, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store; he speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and says that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a press machine for her husband to bend metal sheets.

loans.name: Chantheurn's Group

texts.en:
Chantheurn, aged 44, is the mother of nine children. She is a farmer who lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Chantheurn earns income to support her family's living conditions via rice cropping. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully fully repaid her previous loan. In her group of four, Chantheurn is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions so they are better off than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is age 31; she is a mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and also his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rabia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Rabia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Rabia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Margret lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Margret operates a retail business selling new bags, clothes and shoes in a shop that she rents. She has been operating this business for six years and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major challenges are the fixed high taxes based on her revenue and the seasonality of her products.

Margret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings to buy new clothes, bags and shoes to sell in her shop. She would like to access the loan amount to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy new clothes, bags and shoes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng, aged 41, is married with five children and is a rural villager living in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She has been growing rice and planting corn for 15 years. Together with her husband, they can earn about KHR 60,000 per day from the current business and manage to save KHR 30,000 daily for their future needs. 

This is the seventh loan for Neng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Neng wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing water tanks with an injection-molding machine for many years. He buys plastic crushing raw material from the market and puts it into an injection-molding machine. The raw material becomes melted under high temperatures and then is injected into the dies through compression to give it a round shape. In this way, he manufactures water tanks and then sells them in the market and makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.

Rukhsana has seven children and barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is repeating a loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her husband can increase his sales. He expects a boost in his earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of his business.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for manufacturing water tanks

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is 52 years old and a responsible mother of five children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son works in a factory. He has some cattle and produces milk to sell in their locality. He has been keeping his herd at home; through breeding, he has been increasing his cattle for many years. Kubra wants to buy an additional cow so that her son can grow his herd and increase his production and sales of milk. However, due to lack of capital, she is unable to buy a cow.

Therefore, Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy an additional cow. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cattle for producing milk.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya, age 25, has been involved in a business selling embroidered clothing for about two years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Aliya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy stocks of different clothes for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a good-quality education to her children through all her efforts in her business. 

Aliya thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy printed and embroidered clothing for reselling from home.

loans.name: Claudia Marcela

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Claudia mostro gusto por la estética y la belleza, realizando arreglo de uñas y cabello a sus amigas y familiares, y desde que descubrió ese gusto siempre ha querido hacer de esto su forma de vivir y a sus 24 años va de hogar en hogar donde es llamada a hacer su trabajo de arreglo de uñas y peinados.

Claudia es una joven emprendedora y gracias a la oportunidad que le está brindando Interactuar puede soñar con tener un local comercial propio y es que el monto que están poniendo a su disposición lo usara en la compra de una silla para realizar manicure, pedicura, comprara implementos, herramientas de esterilización, hará la respectiva señalética del negocio y tiene muchos proyectos pero por ahora solo cuenta con ese dinero y gracias a este prestamos constituirá su negocio, tendrá un lugar fijo para atender y espera muchas ventas para seguir reformando su negocio que es su sueño.
texts.en:
From a very young age Claudia was interested in beauty products and work, doing her friends' and family's nails. After discovering that she so liked this work she wanted to make it her career. Now, at 24 years old, she goes from house to house to meet her customers and do their nails and hair.

Claudia is an enterprising young woman and, thanks to this opportunity from Interactuar, she can dream of having her own premises. She will use this loan to buy a chair to use when doing manicures and pedicures and to buy tools and equipment for sterilizing these tools. She will also make signs for her business. Claudia has many plans but, with this loan, she will have a salon to tend to her customers. She hopes to have many sales in order to achieve her dream of changing her business.

loans.use: to buy a chair to use when doing manicures and pedicures, signage for the business, and to have sterile tools.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano de 67 años de edad, estudio segundo grado de educación,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar tuvieron en común 6 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ellos.  

Él es agricultor, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 40 años y desde que era pequeño, su papá le enseño a cultivar el maíz y el frijol, se decide dedicar a esta actividad  porque no estudio y no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes, semillas y abonos para su cultivo de maíz. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la producción agrícola porque tendrá la oportunidad de cultivar a tiempo. Tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá mejorar la alimentación. 

Los sueños de Justiniano son tener su propio negocio para comercializar los productos agrícolas que cultiva. Para su familia sus sueños son seguirlos apoyando para que cumplan sus sueños.
texts.en:
Justiniano is 67 years old and has a second grade education. Justiniano's wife looks after the household chores. The couple has six children, two of whom still live at home.  

Justiniano is a farmer. He has been making a living in this work for 40 years. When he was a boy his father taught him to grow corn and beans. He decided to do this work because he did not have an education and found no other way to support his family.  Justiniano works near his home. He starts at 6am.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy fertilisers, seeds and manure for his corn crops. This loan will help Justiniano to improve farming production as he will have the chance to grow the crops on time. He will then earn a better living and will be able to eat better. 

Justiniano's dreams are to have his own business where he can sell the products that he grows. His dreams for his family are to continue supporting them so that they may achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, seeds and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Luzmila De Jesus

texts.es:
Luzmila es una madre cabeza de familia de 59 años de edad, con 4 hijos los cuales levanto sola, gracias a una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que constituyo sola, como necesidad económica para mantener sus muchachos. 
 Luzmila quiere solicitar crédito que lo hace pensando en tener mejor surtido para comprar vivienda, incrementar su utilidad, aumentar sus clientes, ser mas competitivo.

El crédito lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de mercancía en general como abarrotes, productos de aseo, grano, Snack, refrescos y espera seguir realizando su trabajo pues es lo que mejor sabe hacer y con lo que ha podido salir de múltiples crisis monetarias que se le han presentado.
texts.en:
Luzmila is the head of her family. She is 59 years old and has four children whom she raised alone. She was able to do this as started a shop selling staple goods in order to cover the costs of raising her children. 

Luzmila is applying for this loan as she wants to have more stock, to increase productivity and her number of customers and to be more competitive. She would also like to buy her own house.

Luzmila will use this loan to buy general merchandise such as groceries, cleaning products, grains, snacks and soft drinks. She hopes to continue in her work as she knows how to do it well and with the business she has been able to get out of a number of financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy staple items, groceries, grains and cleaning products; Luzmila is 59 years old and the head of her family.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 68 años de edad, es agricultor, esta casado y padre de 3 hijos. Estudio hasta cuarto grado ya que hasta ese nivel había en la escuela mas cercana, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Manuel ha trabaja la agricultura desde temprana edad, oficio que se han dedicado en familia. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos, herbicidas y pesticidas para sembrar camote y yuca. Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan casa propia y un buen trabajo para que sus nietos estudien.
texts.en:
Manuel, 68 years old, is a farmer, married and father of 3 children. He studied up to the fourth grade since this was the highest grade available in the closest school. His wife is a housewife.

Manuel has been working in agriculture from a young age, a job that has been kept in his family. The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertiliser, herbicides and pesticides to grow sweet potatoes and cassava. His dream is that his children have their own homes and a good job so that his grandchildren study.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, herbicides and pesticides to grow sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 48-year-old woman living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her hometown is in a very populated area. Most people like to chew betel leaf. A few years ago, her son decided to open a paan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to people. He offers different kinds of betel leaf, such as sweet paan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices; and tobacco paan, which consists of powdered tobacco. He is an expert in preparing paan because he has run his shop for many years and lots of customers like to buy his betel leaf. 

To cope with increasing demand, he wants to keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, and tobacco to sell.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, and tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, 42, is married and a blessed with four children. Her husband drives a three-wheeled rickshaw in Lahore. He provides transportation and pick-up-and-drop service to people within the city.  He is a hardworking and humble person. As the sole earning person in the family, he has to work really hard. 

His rickshaw needs maintenance due to constant wear and tear. Due to shortage of funds, Safia has requested a loan to help her husband and to make sure that their income becomes steady. They are thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on their rickshaw.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 38 and is blessed with three children. She is a responsible and caring housewife and looks after her house. Her husband buys fruit from the local market and then resells it to customers at a profit. He works hard and tries to meet their family expenses in a timely manner. 

Her husband wishes to buy more fruit for the upcoming season of winter and resell it, for which reason Sughran has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. They are hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: To buy fruit to resell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de Chigorodo.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 4 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

Ella guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Ana is a very nice person.  She always has a smile for the customers that visit her grocery store in the Chigorodo municipality.  Thanks to her charisma and good humor, she has been able to win over the hearts and appreciation of the people in the area who always prefer to go to her store to get their products.  She works every day in order to give her four children a good quality of life.  She aspires to give them an excellent future.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy basic needs stock like grains, groceries, candy, and drinks, among others.  This way she will give a significant impulse to her business.

She has the hope of being able to continue with her business.  This way she will continue impacting her customers’ lives through her good service.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to improve her life conditions, as she is a single woman who takes are of her parents

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su motocicleta a través de las veredas del municipio de Carepa posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas aéreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es padre de dos hijos de 13 y 5 años a los cuales siempre ha procurado por ofrecerles la mejor educación.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su motocarro ya que es su único medio de trabajo y con el que puede llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehiculo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jairo is a very hardworking and organized man. He makes a living offering personal transportation services in his motorcycle taxi throughout the lanes of the municipality of Carepa, making movement of the community to all of the different areas of the municipality possible. 

He is a friendly, helpful, and entrepreneurial man. He is the father of two children of ages 13 and 5, to whom he has always tried to offer the best education.

He is requesting a loan to carry out maintenance and repairs for his mototaxi, since it is the only means of work with which he can bring sustenance to his home.

With this loan he will be able to improve the conditions of his vehicle and continue offering his service with total security, and without risking his life or those of his customers.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer for his billiard business and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Brigido Jose

texts.es:
Don Brigino de 55 años de edad, es casado, técnico, del Municipio de la Libertad Chontales, su labor diario es de Supervisor de Obras en una empresa Privada, su esposa es ama de casa y esta al pendiente de los quehaceres del hogar así como la buena alimentación de don Brigido,  en la zona donde habita don Brigido es una zona Minera, la gente tiene sus trabajos fijos como jornaleros en las minas, ademas muchos ya han establecido sus propios negocios de oro, joyería o algunos salen a comercializar el oro a diferentes ciudades donde tienen sus contratos y solo entregan así la gente ha prosperado en la zona. 

Don Brigido casi tiene terminada su vivienda y muy bonita, con el crédito y sus ahorros anteriormente logró poner verjas en las ventanas y puerta del frente también terminó de construir un cuarto que ocupa para su nieta, ahora tiene mas espacio y seguridad en su vivienda; se va tranquilo a su trabajo por el día que su esposa queda sola hay menos riesgo los ladrones se le metan a robar o a hacerle algo a su familia.

Continuando con las mejoras don Brigido solicita este crédito para construir sumidero en la parte del frente de la casa es decir tiene que remover el ladrillo de la acera y luego empezar la construcción, cuenta con el permiso de la Alcaldía, también instalará el servicio higiénico dentro de su vivienda que lo tiene en espera, para el y su familia será de gran importancia esta inversión pues contará con mayor higiene y condiciones en su hogar.  Su próximo proyecto es hacer su vivienda de dos plantas  y posterior comprar una camioneta para movilizarse en su vejez previendo cualquier emergencia de antemano, pide a Dios le concede mantener sus ingresos para hacer realidad estos sueños.
texts.en:
Brigido, 55, is married. He is a technician in the Municipality of La Libertad, in Chontales, where he works every day as a works supervisor in a private company. His wife is a homemaker, and she looks after the household duties, such as cooking for Brigido. 

Brigido lives in a mining zone, where people have steady jobs working as day laborers in the mines. In addition, many people have already established their own gold and jewelry businesses, and some sell and deliver gold only in the cities in which they have contracts. This way people in the zone have prospered. 

Brigido’s house is very pretty, and he is almost finished working on it. With the loan and his savings, he was able to put grilles on the windows and front door, and he also finished building a room for his granddaughter.  Now his house is more spacious and secure, and he feels better about leaving his wife alone in the house when he goes out to work for the day, because there is less risk of thieves breaking into his home to rob or do something to his family.


Continuing with the improvements, Brigido is requesting this loan in order to build a drain in front of his house, which entails removing the brick sidewalk before beginning the construction. He has permission from City Hall.  He will also install a toilet in his house, something that he has been waiting to do.  This investment will be very important for him and for his family, as conditions in their home will be more hygienic.
 
His next project is to add a second story, and later, buy a little truck to get around in when he is old, planning for any emergency ahead of time. He asks God to allow him to maintain his income, so that he may turn these dreams into reality.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for a drain, and install a toilet.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es casada y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cacao el principal producto que cultiva e sus terrenos. Es un ejemplo de coraje y dedicación, siempre preocupándose por brindar lo mejor a sus hijos para poder mejorar su futuro.
Enith quiere utilizar este crédito para poder comprar abono para sus cultivos, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con esto quiere lograr una mejor cosecha y así mejorar sus ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Más adelante con un poco de ahorros podrá ampliar sus plantaciones y convertirse en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Enith is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She is married and lives in San Martin with her family. For 20 years she has been working in agriculture, cocoa being the principal crop that she grows on her land. She is an example of courage and dedication always thinking about providing the best for her children to improve their future.

Enith wants to use this loan to buy manure for her crops. She is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva because with the loan she wants to have a better harvest and improve her revenues to get her family ahead. Later on with some of her savings she can expand her plantation and become a big entrepreneur.

loans.use: to fertilize her cocoa crops.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 60 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. Дамира на пенсии и занимается сельским хозяйством. Главной ценностью жизни она считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье детей. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат, Дамира на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы и 2 лошади. Дополнительно Дамира занимается полеводством, выращивая на своем участке мерою 1,89 ГА эспарцет, картофель, ячмень и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дамира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки овец. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Damira is 60 and married with four children. She is on a pension and works in agriculture. She places the greatest value in her life on the well-being of her family, the prosperity of her business and the happiness of her children. Thanks to her persistence, hard work and focus on her goals, she currently has two cows and two horses. She also grows potatoes, barley and wheat on her own 1.89 hectare piece of land, with a total monthly business income of about 5,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Damira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She intends to increase her head count of livestock, which will lead to an improvement in her family's financial situation. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 30, is married and lives with her husband in Lahore. Her husband is a barber and runs a shop in the nearby community. 

They live in a rented shop near to their house. Her husband is very hardworking and skilled at his work. Apart from regular shave and hair cuts he also provides massage and facial services to his customers. Due to constant usage some of his instruments have deteriorated, but he does not have sufficient cash to repair or replace them. 

Therefore Abida has requested a loan to help her husband buy the instruments. Her husband wants to enhance his business in the future and they are thankful to BRAC for its assistance.

loans.use: to buy instruments for his barber shop.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana 38, is married and blessed with three children. She is a supportive and kind housewife. Her husband is a milk man by profession and sells to households. Every morning he wakes up and he and Rehana prepare the animal feed and then fetch milk which they pour into containers to deliver to households. 

They want to increase milk production and want to buy another cow but has insufficient cash due to their increasing expenses.  Rehana has requested for a loan to help her husband. 

They look forward to a happy and stable life. They are thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for producing milk.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem, 45, is a mother of seven children and lives with her family in Lahore. 

Her husband  is a rickshaw driver by profession. He is hardworking and experienced and knows all the routes within the city. He makes sure that all the family needs are met. 

His rickshaw body has depreciated due constant usage and now he wants to replace it with a new one. Therefore Tasleem has requested for a loan to help her husband. She is thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy rickshaw body for husband.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is widowed with five children, and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She knits sweaters and table mats and has been in business for over ten years. 
,
Nulu has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, to buy thread, needles,material for making clothes and sweaters. She works in the shop six days every week and sells on a retail basis. 

Nulu generates additional income from rental rooms and poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. 

She aspires to buy more land to start farming on a larger scale. Nulu resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy needles,thread and material for making clothes.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos, ellos ya no dependen de él ya que están casados.

Miguel tiene muchos años de trabajar la tierra, manifesta que desde temprana edad ha trabajado y trabajo junto a su padre para llevar el pan de cada día al hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz. Sueña con poder dejarle un buen  patrimonio a sus hijos para que puedan trabajar en lo propio.
texts.en:
Miguel is 69 years old, studied until sixth grade, and is married. His wife takes care of the household chores. He has three children. They no longer depend on him since they are married.

Miguel has been working the land for many years, and from an early age he has worked alongside his father to bring home the daily bread. 

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizers for his corn crops. He dreams of being able to leave a good inheritance to his children so that they can work for themselves.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is single with three children, and two are in school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Edith operates a retail shop from home and sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for five years. 

Edith also gets additional income from poultry farming. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, rice, maize flour, soap, and bags of sugar. 

Her major business challenges include increasing costs of commodities, seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to build rental houses. 

Edith lives in her own house where her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, maize flour, soap, and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She has had a secretarial business for three years. 

Florence has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of paper, boxes of ledger books,and cartridges. 

She generates additional income from knitting table cloths. Florence works seven days a week from a shop that she rents and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, power shortages and thieves. 

Florence is aspiring to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and piped electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy many reams of paper, cartridges and ledger books.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un humilde hombre de 66 años de edad que junto con su esposa atiende el negocio de cría y distribución de cerdos, una actividad muy vista en el sector de pueblo Rico donde faltan oportunidades para emplearse y por tal razón se ve el emprendimiento y la fuerte competencia de la actividad porcina.
Antonio buscando ser más competitivo quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una cerda de cría, y cerdos de engorde pensando en la temporada de diciembre donde el empresario que tenga mejores precios triunfara. 
Para Antonio este crédito es muy importa ya que tendrá buenos animales para trabajar y seguir llevando a su hogar el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Antonio is a humble, 66 year old man, who alongside his wife works in the breeding and sale of pigs. This is a very common occupation around the town of Rico where there are not many employment opportunities, and for this reason there is a lot of undertaking and competition in the pig industry.

Antonio, hoping to become more competitive, wants to request a loan to buy a sow for breeding and pigs for fattening. He is thinking of the season of December when the business owner that has the best prices will succeed.

This loan is very important for Antonio since he will have good animals to work and continue bringing the daily sustenance to his home.

loans.use: to buy a sow for breeding and pigs for fattening, seeking to become more competitive since others are taking his customers.

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola runs a restaurant in a rented space at the local market. She works six days a week and has operated her business for the last six years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She lives with her husband and their two children in Kampala. Both children attend school. She also helps to support two additional family members. The family lives in a house that does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Sikola has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy bunches of green bananas, rice, beef, beans,flour, peas and cooking oil. Her goal is to build a residential house.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beef, beans, peas, bunches of green bananas and rice.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children, and all of them attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She has sold used clothes for eight years and has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Florence goes door-to-door, selling used clothes and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. 

She hopes to build her own house and currently resides in a rented house.  Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Nazish's Group

texts.en:
Nazish is a 24-year-old married woman, living with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a bakery in their hometown; he sells different kinds of cakes, fresh cream cake, rusks, milk, biscuits, and juices. He purchases the inventory in large quantity from a nearby bakery and sells it from  his own bakery. Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers but does not have a sufficient amount to buy these additional sweets. 

Therefore, Nazish has requested a loan so that her husband  can buy his desired bakery items to sell. His wish is to prepare these bakery items at home so that he can minimize the cost and maximize the income as well. He will start to put aside savings with the profit amount and hopes in future he will prepare all sweets by himself. 

Nazish thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy additional bakery items for reselling.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 34 years old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. 

Her husband has run a general store for past two years. Shabana's husband wants to purchase commodities including rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for business purposes. 

But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy the commodities to resell. 

Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy commodities and he is hopeful to earn maximum his profitable.  The extra income will help manage their household and business. 

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase commodities for husband's general store.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
This is Shamim from Pakistan! She is married and has three children. 

Shamim requested a loan for her husband; he offers Alu Chat (A Pakistani food) at evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he has a need for more potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onion, spices, etc. in large quantity.  Shamim helps her husband  prepare alu chat at noon.  He wants to offer more alu chaat to his customers because the demand has been increasing from time to time.
 
Shamim is 30, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that through this loan her husband would be able to generate more income than earlier. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan's team.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onion, spices, etc. in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various provisions and remodel her store. Ana is a woman that was left a widow with two children to take care of.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Shameen

texts.en:
Shameen is a 35 year old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of their family. 

Shameen also provides sewing services and earn an income to contribute towards their household expenses.
 
Shameen needs to purchase needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and other items for her business.  But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore Shameen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help increase her monthly sales and profits.

Shameen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ashirbad Shg Group

texts.en:
Rasmita, the lady standing with raised hand, is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and parents-in-laws in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India.

She is engaged in personnel care products and costume jewelry selling. She purchases personnel care products and jewelry items in bulk from a nearby market and sells on a retail basis from her little shop. She earns 6,000 INR per month from this activity. Her husband works as a daily laborer in a small factory situated to near her village. She wants to expand her business so that she can make more money and can buy a bike for her husband and save some money for her future.

Rasmita, along with her group, has requested a loan and she will use her portion to buy personnel care products and fancy costume jewelry in bulk. Along with her group, she is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kindness.

loans.use: buy personnel care products and fancy costume jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Jeeban Jyoti Shg Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Jeeban Jyoti Self Help Group, which is located in the Koraput district of Odisha, India.

The member who deserves to be highlighted is Prabhanjani; she is 24 years old and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with a food-selling business. She sells her products from a food stall. She also raises small animals. She hopes to be able to keep on working so that she can continue to support her family.

Prabhanjani is requesting a loan to buy products such as edible oil, rice, and spices in bulk. She is grateful for the granted loan and is committed to making all her loan payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

The other members make a living selling vegetables, selling food, raising animals, selling grains, and running a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products such as edible oil, rice, and spices in bulk

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is aged 32, and she is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Sakina's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sakina is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last two years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and he has been unable to generate income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sadaf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members of Maa Thakurani Self Help Group decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Peoples Forum and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Sushila, the woman standing with raised hand in the photo, is 29 years old, a married woman, and has one child. She owns a grocery shop where she sells basic household items. She intends to use her loan to purchase basic household items in bulk directly from wholesalers in Jeypore town. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in her village.

Sushila and her group members are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase basic household items in bulk directly from wholesalers

loans.name: Elvis Alexander

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Santa junto a su familia. Debido a las situaciones difíciles vividas en su hogar no pudo estudiar una profesión, es por ello que por iniciativa propia empezó su propio negocio de venta de frutas y él cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy trabajar, responsable, amable y atento con los clientes.
Elvis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, entre distintos tipos de frutas que hay en esta época para ofrecerlas a sus clientes, con esto espera mejorar sus ventas y así poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Elvis is a man who really wants to get ahead. He is single and lives in Santa with his family. Due to the difficult situations experienced in his home, he could not study a profession. This is why, of his own initiative, he started his own business selling fruits. He believes that things are going well for him because he his hardworking, responsible, friendly, and attentive with his customers. 

Elvis is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided he will be able to buy merchandise for his business, between different types of fruits that are in season, to offer them to his customers. With this he hopes to improve his sales and, little by little, improve the quality of life of his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fruits to stock his business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 38-year-old married woman, living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a business of generators for rent in which he provides electrical generators for rent to the general public. He has been doing this work for the last ten years. 

To carry out his work, he has to stay at the shop to deal with the general public. He wants to buy one more generator to cope with demand but due to high cost he is unable to purchase. Safia hopes that with this Kiva loan cooperation her husband would be able to carry out his plans for purchasing a generator to rent out. Therefore she requested a loan so that her husband could buy a generator to enhance his business.

Safia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her husband's rent-a-generator business

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita, 25 years old, lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Sahidgarh village, Jalpaiguri , West Bengal. Gita has an education up to grade 6 and her husband, 40-year-old Pradip, attended school till eight grade. Their children are attending school. 

Gita is associated with a milk supply business. She diligently saves a small amount and is setting it aside for her children’s education. The rest is spent for the family's household expenses. Now she wants to grow her business. 

So, Gita plans to develop her milk business by buying an extra cow. The extra milk from the cow will bring in extra income per month. Gita seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy a cow.

She appreciates her lenders' support.

loans.use: To pay for a milk cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old married woman, and she is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Nazia's husband owns a clothing sale business, which is the only source of income for their family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. 

For that, Nazia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings to pay for electricity and gas bills. Nazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's clothing sale business by purchasing a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a van for the last ten years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Kishwar's husband needs to make repairs to his vehicle because the current condition of his van is not good. Due to insufficient funds, he is unable to maintain his vehicle. Therefore, Kishwar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Kishwar's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide better transportation services to earn a  profitable income. Kishwar also plans to save some of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Kishwar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's van.

loans.name: Nury Sulay

texts.es:
Nury es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace más de 30 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la practica aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 47 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de blusas y ropa interior; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la adecuación de su lugar de trabajo para trabajar de una manera más amplia, cómoda, eficiente y organizada.

Nury sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Nury is a dedicated and hardworking small-businesswoman who provides sewing services to others.  

It all started  more than thirty years ago when she was employed in a sewing shop where she learned the trade on the job.  Nowadays, at 47, she's got her own shop and has one employee.  She works every day; her main strength is making blouses and underclothing.  This is how she makes enough to support her husband with household finances.

She is seeking a loan which she'll invest in improvements to her workplace so she can work in a larger, and more comfortable, efficient, and organized environment.

Nury dreams of enhancing her workshop and increasing production by the day so she can create more job opportunities and improve the quality of life for her family as well as the people they affect every day in their work.

loans.use: to expand her sewing shop

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un emprendedor, muy ingenioso y con excelentes ideas que busca a través del micro-crédito una ayuda para iniciar sus proyectos de ampliación de cultivo, y cría de ganado, con el crédito que está solicitando comprara insumos para sus campo como abonos, fertilizantes y riegos, comprara cuido para alimentar a sus animales y lo más importante es que rodeara su terreno de alambre para evitar que vecinos aprovechen su espacio limitándolo a él.
Gracias a este crédito Fernando podrá iniciar nuevos cultivos, tener su ganado en un lugar cómodo, vigilado y cercado y su idea es progresar implementar sus ideas y para eso si requiere su apoyo tendrá un gran impacto en sus actividades y en su pensamiento.
texts.en:
Fernando is a resourceful entrepreneur with excellent ideas. By means of micro-financing schemes, he is looking for help to begin his projects, which include the expansion of his farm and livestock. The loan he is asking for will buy supplies for his fields, such as fertilisers, irrigation, supplies for looking after his animals and, most importantly, wire so that he can fence off his fields, in order to prevent his neighbours making use of land marked out for him. 

Thanks to this loan, Fernando will be able to plant new crops and keep his livestock in a safe, comfortable, enclosed space. He wants to continue implementing his ideas, and for this he needs your support, which will have a great impact on his activities and on his thoughts.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, feed for his livestock, irrigation, and wire in order to fence off his land.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a business selling clothing, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that reason, Kaneez is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the profit from the business he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills. Kaneez hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una madre muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 9 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Luz y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde siempre sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising mother with a great desire to progress and succeed.

For nine years she has earned her living selling catalog products like clothing, accessories, and beauty and home products.  She mainly sells to friends, neighbors, and relatives that know her and want her to make strides in her business.

She has always had a great affinity for business and sales.  Now she is very skilled in her work thanks to her geniality and excellent customer service. 

Luz is seeking a loan to stock up on beauty products and clothing to expand inventory and improve sales so she can make a good income and contribute to household expenses.  

She hopes to be able to succeed thanks to backing from the goodhearted people who support these types of projects.

loans.use: to stock up on beauty products and clothing to increase inventory and improve sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one cow for the milk sales business

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the age of 36 and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them from the shop. He has been selling gents' shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies' shoes as well, according to customer demand, but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount. 

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy ladies' shoes as well. Irshad is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's shoe shop

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham province, Him is 29 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn income to improve her family's condition. 

She earns income of about 32,900 KHR per day. This is the second loan cycle for Him with VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nhean's Group

texts.en:
Nhean, 55, is a farmer living in Battambang province and the mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, Nhean grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has been invloved in this business for 15 years. She can earn an income of about 31,100 KHR per day, and she can save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting her daily expenses. 

Nhean is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group of three to apply for a new loan. She will spend her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Tharen's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Tharen is 32 years old and a mother of two children. She earns income to support her family via raising pigs. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income. She can earn income of about 22,200 KHR per day. 

For Tharen, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two members, she is the group leader to get the new loan. She will spend her loan to buy piglets and pig seed. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en:
Vith is the mother of three children living in Kampong Cham province. She grows cassava as her main source of income. Moreover, she grows rice to supplement her income. 

She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 33,500 KHR per day. This is her first loan with VisionFund. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel es un hombre de 30 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el armado, actualización y mantenimiento de computadoras.
Él es independiente, inteligente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en una zona comercial de la ciudad. 
Fidel es de tez morena, estatura mediana, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara por cultura general. Su trabajo es la reparación, actualización, mantenimiento y armado de computadoras, él trabaja como empleado en una empresa que se ocupa de esa actividad. Su vida la comparte con su madre que es de la tercera edad y ya casi no puede ver, por lo que él se encarga de cuidarla. Su carrera es técnico en hardware y software que tiene una duración de cinco años y se encuentra cursando el cuarto año, su necesidad principal es mejorar su conocimiento con una herramienta actualizada.
Su sueño es ejercer su profesión y tener su propia empresa para generar mejores ingresos económicos y ayudar a su madre a recuperar la vista. Él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para sus estudios y para trabajar con una herramienta actualizada.
Es por esos motivos que Fidel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil, herramientas y libros para trabajar, estudiar y ayudar a su madre a recuperar la vista.
texts.en:
Fidel is a 30 year old single man with no children. His business is assembling, upgrading and maintaining computers. He is independent, intelligent, consistent, responsible and hard-working. His work is located in a commercial part of the city.

Fidel has dark skin, is of medium stature and wears glasses. His mother tongue is Spanish and he knows Aymara from the general culture. His work is the reparation, upgrading, maintenance and assembling computers. He works as an employee in a company that is involved in this business.

He shares his life with his mother who is elderly and almost cannot see. So he takes care of her. His studies are as a Software and hardware technician. It is a 5 year course and he is in his 4th year now.

His principal need is to improve his knowledge with up to date equipment. His dream is to exercise his profession and have his own business to generate higher revenues and help his mother get her vision back. He wants to buy a laptop for his studies and to work with an up to date machine. For these reasons Fidel is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop, materials and books to work, study and help his mother get her vision back.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, materials and books to work, study and help his mother get her sight back.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 33; she is mother to two children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well; some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Sumaira requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Sumaira thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance the inventory of her husband's general store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en:
Iffat is 32; she is mother to two children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Iffat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Iffat is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Marlen Yadira

texts.es: Marlen, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en  unión libre con su esposo con quien  tiene 1 hijo y reside  en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace un año decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento familiar y estableció una pulpería. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende productos alimenticios como ser, harina de maíz, manteca, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pollo, productos lácteos, jabón, papel higiénico, refrescos, golosinas etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo actualmente por 6,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, huevos, pan, café, manteca, frijoles, Lácteos y Embutidos. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener surtido el negocio con el fin de aumentar el volumen de ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlen is 23-years-old and lives in a civil union with her husband.  They have one child and live in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.  A year ago she decided to get her own source of income to help support the family, so she opened a grocery store in her house.  She sells food products like corn four, butter, rice, beans, chicken, dairy products, and soap, toilet paper, soft drinks, candy, etc.  

Marlen is currently seeking a loan for 6000 lempiras which she'll invest in flour, sugar, eggs, bread, coffee, butter, beans, dairy products, and sausage.  The loan will help her keep the store stocked so she can grow sales and make a higher profit.

loans.use: to stock up on flour, sugar, eggs, bread, coffee, butter, beans, dairy products, and sausage to sell.

loans.name: Diappo 2 Group

texts.fr: DIAPPO 2  est un groupement de promotion féminin composé de 5 femmes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier et pratique la même activité.  Elles évoluent toutes dans la vente des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, le lait etc…..Madame SOKHNA est la présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des produits alimentaires  comme le sucre, lait, jus de fruit, glace, confiture et les revendre à ses clients. SOKHNA démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir un magasin dans le marché central et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Diappo 2  is a group aiming to promote women's affairs, made up of five women who all live in the same neighborhood and have the same sort of business. They have all been selling foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. Madame Sokhna, the one raising her hand in the photo, is the president. She is married and the mother of a family. She helps her husband provide for their daily expenses and cover the school fees of her children. 

Sokna has been working in this business for more than five years. She is requesting this loan to buy foodstuffs such as sugar, milk, fruit juice, ice, and jam to resell to her clients. Sokhna begins her day at 8 am, ending at 7 pm. In future, she would like to have a shop at the central market and so as to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn is 27 years old and married. She lives in Kampong Cham province. She has two children. To support her family, Orn has been growing rice for years. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the first time for Orn with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a clothing sale business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, Ghulam Fatima is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings amount to pay for electricity and gas bills. Ghulam Fatima hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's clothing business with a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Nat is 52 years old and she is a mother of four children. 

To support her family, she has been growing rice. Moreover, she earns additional income by working for others for a fee. From her current business, she can earn about 31,100 KHR per day and she can save about 20,000 KHR each day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the first microloan for Nat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading her group to get a new loan. Nat will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy business.
