loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Jab's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kampong Cham province, Jab is 33 years old and married. She has two children, one whom is in school while the other is too young. Jab has earned a living through farming rice and growing cassava for seven years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is Jab's first microloan with VisionFund. As the leader of her group, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava so as to fulfill her dream of having a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme divorcée de 36 ans. Elle a un enfant à sa charge et vit à Bè kpota, une banlieue de la ville de Lomé. Yawavi vend à la criée des fruits de toutes sortes dans les quartiers et marchés.
Grâce aux formations de l’équipe Assilassimé, elle sait attirer puis fidéliser ses clients par son acceuil chaleureux et les petites remises qu’elle fait sur les prix des produits. Avec ses maigres moyens, elle se rend 02 fois par mois au marché Akodessewa pour se ravitailler.
Pour accroitre son profit, elle souhaite acheter 01 panier de mandarine et un et demi de panier de goyaves.
texts.en: Yawa is a divorced 36 year old lady.  She has one child in her care, and lives in Bè kpota, a suburb of the city of Lomé. Yawavi sells fruits of all types in her neighbourhood and at the market. Thanks to training from the Assilassimé group she has learned how to attract and retain her customers by her warm interactions and via the small discounts she gives on her products. With her modest means, she goes to the Akodessewa market twice a month in order to stock up. To boost her profit, she would like to purchase 1 basket of mandarins and half a basket of guavas.

loans.use: to purchase 3 baskets of fruit

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is a 23-year-old married mother of one little kid. To support her family, she has been growing rice for several years. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. From her current business, she can earn about 31,700 KHR per day, and she can manage to save about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Savy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to support her farmland

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth, 37, is a resident living in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. For her family, she grows rubber and works for others for a fee to support her family's living conditions. She has been involved in this business for 19 years, and it earns her about 23,600 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy plastic and pay for labor fees to support the rubber growing. She hopes that she can sell her rubber at a high price.

loans.use: To buy plastic and pay for labor fees to support the growing of rubber

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan lives in Battambang province. Chan is 43 years old and she is a mother of three children, two of whom are still in school. To support her family, she grows rice and does other work for a fee. She can earn income of about 31,000 KHR per day.  

For Chan, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can extend her business to better her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak, 32, lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. He has two children who are still in school. He has made a living by growing rice and cassava for 12 years. The current business earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Vannak is just with VisionFund for this cycle, and now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice and cassava. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice and cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sergio Andres

texts.es:
Sergio, de 22 años, tiene un negocio de transporte de diferente tipo de mercancía y cargas en un camión que está intentando comprar desde  hace aproximadamente 8 meses con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento en nació su hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hijo tiene 7 meses y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para tener dinero suficiente y pagar una parte del camión con el que actualmente trabaja y así poder mejorar su capital y patrimonio de trabajo.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  su negocio, a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Sergio para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Sergio is 22 years old. He has a business transporting different merchandise and cargo in a truck that he been trying to purchase for the past 8 months. He wants to find a business to generate revenue to subsist.

When his son was born he found the inspiration to work tirelessly so he can provide him with a better life and development. Today his son is 7 months old and has become the happiness of this hard-working man.

He is requesting a loan to have enough money to pay for part of the truck he currently works with so he can increase his capital and his working assets. With this loan he can support his business, and offer his wife and child a better quality of living. Support Sergio so that he can continue with his business.

loans.use: to make a payment on his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Sonungul

texts.ru: Сонунгул 44 года, замужем, есть дочь школьного возраста, супруг и дочь активно помогают по хозяйству. У Сонунгул среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сонунгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,35 ГА, где Сонунгул выращивает люцерну.  Ежемесячный доход Сонунгул от бизнес деятельности составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 1 бычка. Доходы от кредита Сонунгул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, в будущем это поможет ей сделать ремонт и купить мебель в дом.
texts.en: Sonungul  is 44 years old, married, and has a school-aged daughter. Her spouse and daughter actively help her with the farm work. Sonungul has a secondary education. Since she was eighteen, she has been farming which is the main source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work Sonungul's farm now has two dairy cows and one bull. Also she has a 1.35 hectare parcel of land where she grows alfalfa. Her monthly income from the business is about 9,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, she turned to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy one cow and one bull. Sonungul plans to invest profits from the loan into developing her business. In the future, this will help her repair her home and buy furniture.

loans.use: buy one cow and one bull-calf.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 48 years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children, and her husband is a welder by profession. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shameem has also been running her business of selling clothes for many years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Shameem needs to buy a variety of clothes to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more income to support her family and business. Shameem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 29-year-old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working as a tailor for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Samina is also providing sewing services and earns an income to help manage the household. 

She needs a new sewing machine for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a new machine and its accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories which will be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her stitching business.

loans.name: Celina Marisol

texts.es:
Celina de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor tienen 7 hijos y 5 de ellos están a su cargo, 2 trabajan y el resto estudia 7°, 6° y 2° grado y con su pareja son los encargados de mantener a sus hijos.

El negocio que tiene es una venta de ropa y desde hace 5 años que lo tiene aprendió por medio de su madre quien se dedica al mismo negocio, anteriormente trabajaba en los oficios domésticos, le ayuda a vender sus productos una hija y su horario es de 7 am a 4 pm

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ropa para mujer, pantalones de hombre y ropa para niños y ropa interior. Con esto mejorara su negocio porque tendrá más mercadería y si lo vende todo en poco tiempo tendrá mayores ingresos.

Desea seguir trabajando en el negocio y que vaya creciendo, seguir dándole el estudio a sus hijos y en un futuro tener un local en un mercado para no estar viajando de un lugar a otro.
texts.en:
Celina, 38, has a 7th grade education.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  They have 7 children, 5 of whom are still in their care.  Two of these children are working, and the others are in the 7th, 6th, and 2nd grade, respectively.  Celina and her husband work to support their children.

Celina has a business selling clothing.  She's had the business for 5 years, and she learned it from her mother, who had the same type of business.  Previously, she used to work as a domestic.  Her daughter helps her with her sales, and she works from 7am until 4pm.

Celina is requesting a loan to buy women's clothing, men's pants, children's clothing, and underwear.  With this investment, her business will improve because she will have more merchandise, and if she sells everything quickly she will have more income.

Celina wants to continue working in her business so that she can make it grow.  This way, she can continue to support her children's education.  In the future, she wants to have a retail space in the market so she won't have to travel from one place to the other.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and she works seven days a week. She has been in this business for three years. She sells her clothes to different categories of people. 

She has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality of clothes.

Her future goal is to expand her business into a modern boutique selling different types of used clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala. She is married and has 4 children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells used clothes door to door. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from making African crafts. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a bale of used clothes. Her business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food,rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married with four children and two of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She sells bags of charcoal from home and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from selling piped water.  She sells on a retail basis, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. 

She aspires to educate her children to university level. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married  mother of three children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for 3 years. She sells her shoes door to door. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation. 

She aspires to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle a 30 ans et demeure dans une chambre louée dans le quartier Dabadakondji. Pour contribuer au bien-être de la famille, elle entreprend depuis 2007 la revente des mèches. A cause de la demande de plus en plus grandissante, elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au grand marché de Lomé.
texts.en:
Adjo is a married mother of two. She is 30 years old and lives in a rented room in the Dabadakondji quarter. 
In order to contribute to the wellbeing of her family, since 2007 she has sold hair weaves for a living. To satisfy the growing demand of her customers, she sources her goods once a week at the large market in Lomé.

loans.use: to purchase 34 weaves

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

Her husband is only a single person who has to support his family and old parents also. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with future expenses. Therefore, Zahida has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

Zahida is the mother of five children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home looking after her children. She hopes that her husband  will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. 

Zahida thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts for reselling.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 37-year-old woman, and a mother of six children. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. Her husband is a dry fruits retailer by profession; he sells different kinds of dry fruits. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Kalsoom's husband needs to purchase different types of dry fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes. Therefore, Kalsoom has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy dry fruits for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Alan Dagoberto

texts.es: Alan, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Yoro. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y produce leche para la venta. Lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad para obtener los ingresos que necesita para el hogar. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para sembrar nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Su plan próximo es sembrar dos manzanas de frijoles y comprar una vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Alan, 38, is married, has two children and lives in a village in the Yoro municipality. 

He has always worked in agriculture and livestock. He grows corn, beans and produces milk for sales. He has been in this line of work for the past 14 years and this is how he obtains the necessary income for his family. 

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL ($400) to buy fertilizer and labor to plant new crops of corn and beans. 

His plan is to plant 3.5 acres of beans and to buy a milking cow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and labor to plant new crops of corn and beans.

loans.name: Leandro Mauro

texts.es:
Leandro es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en la Tinguiña junto a su familia.
Es una persona muy estudiosa y emprendedora, para ayudar a sus padres con el apoyo de sus estudios trabaja como ayudante de venta en un puesto en el mercado y con eso está saliendo adelante. Está estudiando la carrera de Administración en un Instituto porque quiere convertirse en un excelente profesional para poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Leandro piensa utilizar este crédito para poder hacer el respectivo pago de sus matrículas y comprar algunos materiales como libros. Él está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con esto seguirá con sus clase sin ningún inconveniente. Más adelante espera convertirse en un profesional exitoso para el orgullo de su familia.
texts.en:
Leandro is a youth with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is single and lives in Tinguiña with his family. He is a very studious and enterprising person. To help his family with the support for his studies he works as a sales assistant at a stall in the market and with this he is getting ahead.

He is studying Administration in an Institute. He wants to become an excellent professional in order to get his family ahead and improve their quality of living. Leandro is planning to use this loan to to be able to pay his tuition and buy some materials like books.

He is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for their generosity as with the loan he can continue his studies with no problems. Later on he hopes to become a successful professional and make his family proud.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy materials for his Administration studies.

loans.name: Merry Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
This group was created in 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same area and whose main activity is farming.

Pinky, with her arm raised, is an active member of the group. She is 25 years old and married. She sells fish and dried fish.

She hopes to buy fish and dried fish and pay transport costs. The profits will enable her to cover the monthly expenses of her household, as well as their clothing and medical costs.

The members of this group are very humble and hardworking. All are grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for this kind support.

loans.use: to buy fish and dried fish and pay transport costs

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan, with her three children. Her husband has been working in an auto workshop for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Rehana is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her sewing business purposes.

loans.name: Urkupina Group

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 5, 3 años y uno de 6 meses de edad, y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas.
Ella es independiente, responsable, buena madre, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio la primavera de la zona plan 3000, un sitio caracterizado por el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas por parte de nuevos habitantes del interior del departamento y del occidente del país.
Jessica es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (al centro, con gorra celeste, polera azul, pantalón capri de jean). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se ocupa de la construcción y sus hijos; los dos mayores asisten a la escuela. Su necesidad por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la hiso formar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos y ya lleva un año de experiencia en su negocio.
Ella sueña con tener un local propio para poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, y desea realizar una inversión en la ampliación de su negocio realizando la compra de 2 juegos de mesas y sillas para tener mayor clientela. 
Es por esos motivos que Jessica solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos juegos de mesas y sillas para tener mayor clientela y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 34 year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She has 4 children, aged 11, 5, 3, and 6 months.  She has a business selling soft drinks.

Jessica is independent, responsible, reliable, and hardworking and she is also a good mother.  She carries out her business in the "La Primavera" neighborhood of the Plan 3000 district.  This place is known for its constant growth in commerce in all parts of the district, generated by the new residents from the interior part of the Department and from the western part of the country.

Jessica has a dark complexion and long black hair, and is of medium height.  Her mother tongue is Spanish, and she also learned Guaraní from her family.  (In the photo, she is in the center, wearing a light blue cap, a blue shirt, and jean capri pants.)  She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and their children.  Her two oldest children attend school.

Her need to improve her family's quality of life led her to form a communal bank with other business people so that they could obtain loans.  The members of this group have businesses selling food, selling sweaters, knitting baby clothes, selling fried potatoes, selling sports clothes, a neighborhood store, and a butcher shop.  This is their first loan cycle, and they already have a year of experience with their businesses.

Jessica dreams of having her own shop where she could provide her customers with greater comfort.  She wants to invest in her business so that she can expand it.  She will purchase 2 sets of tables and chairs so that she can attract more customers.   This is why Jessica is requesting a loan to buy two sets of tables and chairs to increase her customers base and pay for her children's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 sets of tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to have maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to have maintenance done on his taxi. Therefore, Safina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Safina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. 

Safina also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Safina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the expense of her husband's taxi repair

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa une jeune femme de 26ans a pour conjoint un mécanicien auto avec en charge un enfant d'1an. En 2009, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des pagnes. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis un moment. Pour renforcer son activité, elle fait une seconde demande. Le profit tiré lui permettra de créer une boutique de vente de pagnes et assurer l’éducation de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 26 year old lady who lives with a mechanic with whom she has a one year-old child. She began selling pagnes (wax cloths) in 2009, so has significant experience in this field. In order to boost her business, she is seeking a second loan. She will use the profit that she generates in order to open a pagnes shop and to see to her family's education.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (wax cloths)

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr: Ayant pour conjoint un maitre maçon avec en charge 5 enfants tous scolarisés, Délali pour prêter main forte à son conjoint a décidé de vendre des poissons fumés à KPALIME(une localité située à environ 122km de Lomé). Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé. Vu que l'activité ralenti à cause de manque de marchandises, elle sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des poissons fumés afin de vendre aux clients. A l'avenir, madame Délali espère étendre l'activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.  Elle est âgée de 42ans avec 14ans d'ancienneté dans l'activité.
texts.en: Délali lives with a carpenter with whom she has 5 children who all attend school. In order to help her partner, she decided to sell smoked fish in KPALIME (an area situated around 122km from Lomé). She sources her goods from Lomé. Given that her business has slowed as a result of low stock, she is seeking a second loan so that she can stock up on smoked fish and satisfy her customers' demand. In future, madame Délali would like to grow her business and ensure that her family thrives. She is 42 years old, and has worked in this field for 14 years.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 41 year-old lady and a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a three-wheeled autorickshaw for many years. Shaheen's husband needs to purchase a new rickshaw for his business.

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase the new rickshaw. To fulfill the need of her husband Shaheen has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy a new rickshaw. The new rickshaw will enable him to earn more income and this income will support him in fulfilling his family's needs

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transport services.

loans.name: Trupti Shg Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali is a 26-year-old woman who lives in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. She is a hardworking and creative mother with two children.

She deals in jewelry for women and women's personal care products with a capital base of 40,000 INR. Gitanjali is borrowing from People's Forum now for the first time, taking a loan through the group to expand her stock.

After her husband's illness, Gitanjali resorted to vending to earn a living and support her young family. Since then, Gitanjali has never looked back. She says her hard work has helped her to survive in business among her peers. Her major problem however is price fluctuation. This happens so often, forcing her into losses.

She intends to use the loan to acquire more stock, and in the future, she hopes to acquire a permanent place to operate, as they are always faced with threats of eviction by market authorities. She is hardworking, and the group appreciates the work done by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for women and women's personal care products for sale

loans.name: Agbéssi

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, Agbessi est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants depuis la mort de son mari. Très courageuse, elle entame en 1990 la vente des petits poissons fumés. A cause de la mévente, elle change d’activité en ouvrant un restaurant non loin du domicile. 
Agbessi est très aimable et les clients ne cessent d’augmenter. Pour assurer l’engouement autour de son activité,  elle souhaite un prêt pour acheter 1 sac de maïs, des poissons et des condiments. Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer le bien-être  de ses enfants.
texts.en: Agbessi is a 41 year old widow and a mother of five children. She has been looking after her children alone since the death of her husband. She is very brave, and in 1990 began selling smoked fish for a living. Owing to a slump in sales, she changed business and opened a restaurant not far from her home. Agbessi is very friendly and her customer base keeps on growing. In order to ensure that the demand for her business keeps on growing, she is seeking a loan to buy a bag of corn, fish and condiments. The profits that she generates will enable her to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bag of corn, 5 boxes of fish, 5 chickens, and condiments

loans.name: Nizanjum

texts.en:
Nizanjum is a 40 year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and her husband is a garments retailer by profession--he is responsible for fulfilling the financial needs of the entire family. Nizanjum has also been selling clothes for many years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Nizanjum needs to buy different types of clothes to resell, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. To do so, she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily and she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Nizanjum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: AWA est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans le même quartier que le guichet et évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et parfums. Elle a une expérience de plus de 4ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaires de crédit dans l’institution. Elle sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des tissus et parfums qu’elle revend à ses clients. Elle n’a aucunes charges particulières a part ces besoins personnels. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour l’arrêter à 16h prendre la pause pour ensuite reprendre son activité à partir de 18 pour la terminer à 20h. Elle souhaite diversifier d’avantage ses produits en augmentant son stock de marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: AWA is married with children. She lives in the same quarter as her stall, and is growing her business, selling fabrics and perfume. She has over 4 years' experience in this business. She has no relatives that have benefited from loans from this institution. She is seeking this loan in order to purchase fabric and perfumes, which she sells on to her customers. She has no specific expenses, except for her own personal needs. She begins her working day at 9am and takes a break from 4-6pm, after which she re-starts before finishing at 8pm. She wishes to diversify her product range by boosting her stock levels. In this way she will drive her revenues and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and perfumes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire de 29ans, résidant à KPALIME Yawovi a appris la tapisserie. A la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel Yawovi confectionne les matelas. Ses matières premières s’achète à NOTSE. Il souhaite porter des aides à ses frères et sœurs dans le domaine scolaire et en apprentissage et créer un plus grand atelier à l'avenir avec le gain tiré. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter de la matière première.
texts.en: Yawovi is a single 29 year old man, who lives in KPALIME. Following his apprenticeship, he opened his own studio in which he makes mattresses. He buys his raw materials from NOTSE. He wishes to help his brothers and sisters with their schooling and apprenticeships, and to create a larger studio in future with the profits that he generates. His first loan will enable him to purchase raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make mattresses

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 36 year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of two children and her husband is a driver by profession. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Kiran has been selling clothing for many years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the house hold.

Kiran needs to buy different types of clothes to sell, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. To make this possible, she has applied for Kiva loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily and she can earn more income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Леся замужем. У нее есть один ребенок. Леся вместе со своей семьей проживает в квартире. Она имеет свой бизнес.

Леся продает посуду, сервизы и сувениры на рынке. Она орендует магазин. Леся дружелюбная, открытая, вежливо ведет себя с клиентами. Она хочет развивать бизнес и мечтает открыть вторую торговую точку.

Леся просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку праздничных свечей и украшений. Она надеется получить хорошую прибыль во время праздничного сезона.
texts.en: Lesya is married and has one child. She lives with her family in an apartment. She has her own business selling dishes, sets, and souvenirs at the market where she rents a shop. Lesya is friendly, open, and courteous to customers. She really wants to develop her business and dreams of opening a second store. Lesya is requesting a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to buy holiday candles and decorations. She hopes to earn a good profit during the holiday season.

loans.use: to buy candles and  decorations

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en:
Alaskar is a driver. He is married with three children and he is 58 years old. He is living in the Baku region. Alaskar’s wife Sumaya is a housewife and isn’t engaged in income-generating work. His sister Lamina Aliyeva has a loan on Kiva with Alaskar's picture which has ended. He helped his sister to take a loan from Kiva. But today he needs your help. His car is broken and he can’t work. Today he needs 1000 AZN to repair his car. He want to buy a new motor for it. He wants to increase his monthly income and his family's quality of life will be better.

Alaskar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid.

loans.use: to buy a new motor

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Taxila, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working as a cable operator for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. 

Musarat has a sewing business and earns an income to contribute to the  management of the household.  She needs a new sewing machine  but due to insufficient finances, she is unable to purchase it. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase a new sewing machine which will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit.  She will be able to provide better sewing services.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a maize farmer from Kuradawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Lydia is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Lydia expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Lydia would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lydia can now store her maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. This allows Lydia to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Lydia said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Bek

texts.ru: Бек, 30 лет, женат, есть сын дошкольного возраста. Бек в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2004 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Бек на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову, 2 лошади, 20 овец и 5 коз, есть участок мерою 2,00 ГА. Ежемесячный доход Бека составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Прибыль от ведения бизнеса позволила Беку сыграть свадьбу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Бек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность купить дополнительный участок земли.
texts.en: Bek is 30 years old, married, and has a young son. Since 2004 he has farmed and raised animals to earn additional income for his family. Thanks to tireless work, Bek today owns a cow, two horses, 20 sheep, and five goats, as well as a 2 hectares of land. Bek's monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS). The business's earnings allowed Bek to pay for a wedding. With the goal of further developing the business Bek approached Bai-Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two steers. He plans to invest proceeds from use of the loan into further development of his business, to eventually be able to buy additional land.

loans.use: to purchase two steers to earn a profit and buy an additional plot of land

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a responsible mother with two children. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. 

Her husband has provided transportation services by driving a hiace van for twenty years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his hiace van. Due to insufficient finances, he is unable to pay for the repairs. Therefore Naheed has applied for a  Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan,  Naheed's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs. He will be able to provide better transportation services and earn a profitable income. 

Naheed  also plans to save money to meet her family's needs in future.

Naheed is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en: Hashimu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hashimu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Awaisu, Bauhinia and Musa. Hashimu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Hashimu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize (double the national average of 14 bags/hectare). Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hashimu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hashimu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Hashimu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Hashimu said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Helen has been raising livestock for 24 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat, in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock of coconut meat to sell. Gerlie has been in the coconut meat business for eight years, and she earns additional income by selling rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan, to further build her businesses

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her businesses, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconut meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 35-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan with her four children. She maintains her household properly and has run a beauty saloon for the last few years. She is a good trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her client base increases day by day. She needs  facial cream, combs, dressing chairs, and mirrors. She contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and their staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance in her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es padre de 3 hijos de 12, 8, 6 años de edad los cuales tienen estudiando y formándose para buscar un buen futuro, se dedica al negocio de producción agrícola el cual heredo de su padre y empleo pro necesidad económica ya que a sus 20 años ya tenía su primer hijo. 
Luis quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos como abonos y pesticidas para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos, pues es un hombre de bajos recursos que no dispone de mucho capital y se enfrenta a una plaga que afecta la mayoría de sus cultivos y necesita erradicarla rápidamente. 
Con el préstamo espera poder incrementar sus ventas, tener más clientes a quienes ofrecerles y poder algún día entregarle el negocio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis is the father of three children, who are 12, 8 and 6 years old. They are in school, receiving an education so that they can achieve a better future. Luis works in agricultural production, a business he inherited from his father. He does this work out of economic necessity, since at the age of 20 he already had his first child.
 
Luis would like to request a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops. He is a person with few resources and does not have much capital, but he is facing an attack of pests affecting the majority of his crops, and he needs to eradicate them rapidly. 

With the loan, he hopes to increase his sales and offer his agricultural products to more customers. He hopes one day to pass on his business to his son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Luis has pests threatening his crops, and he has to combat them as quickly as possible.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan with her seven children. She is a house wife and looks after her family. Her husband provides services in building construction. Her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories to improve his  work. He wants to generate more income to financially support his family. Rehana is applying for loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's work.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 4 hijos y solamente la menor vive con ellos, estudia 2 año en la Universidad.

Carlos toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería aprendió por medio de su familia pues de igual manera se ha dedicado al oficio, por lo general siembra 42,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 21,000 de frijol, además cuenta con ganado propio que poco a poco ha ido aumentando. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar novillas con el propósito de crecerlas y reproducirlas para tener más ganado y poder explotarlas pues cuanta con los conocimientos necesarios para realizar el trabajo.

Para su familia el sueño más próximo que tiene es que su hija se gradué de la carrera profesional, y seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlos is 62 years old and studied through the ninth grade.  He is married and his wife works in the home. They have four children and only the youngest lives with them.  He is in his second year in the university. 

Carlos has worked his entire life in agriculture and livestock. He learned this field from his family and like them he has dedicated himself to it.  He generally plants 42,000 square meters of corn and 21,000 of beans.  In addition he has his own cattle and little by little he has been increasing his herd. 

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase heifers with the aim of raising them and reproducing in order to have more cattle and thus to better benefit from his work. He has the necessary knowledge to have success in this effort.

His greatest desire for his family is for his daughter to graduate with a professional career, and he also hopes to continue working in order to provide for his family so that they do not lack anything.

loans.use: to purchase heifers with the aim of raising them and have them reproduce to build his herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials for his tile workshop.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat was born in 1970 in Tajikistan. She is a hardworking Tajik woman. She is married and has four children. Saodat is going to start her own business deal because she needs a source of income to provide her children with all necessary things. She is able to sew women's national dresses, so she decided to start a business sewing. With this aim, Saodat took part in a course "To Get Ahead" of the women's organization. She got a certificate. Now, she is ready to start her business and to be successful in business but she needs an electronic sewing machine. She is asking for a loan to buy an electronic sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to organize a new business.

loans.name: Fayoziddin

texts.en:
This is the story of Fayoziddin:

"I live in a village which is located far from town with my parents. My parents are workers. My parents always tried to give me a good education. Until now, my schooling has been financed by my parents. My parents have a small salary and for this year they couldn’t save money for my education in National university of Tajikistan. I study at the faculty of Finance and credit at the first course. Now, I need to loan in the amount of 2,000 USD to pay for university tuition. I await your support.”

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to resell, including canned goods, bread, and noodles

loans.name: Iryn

texts.en:
Iryn is 40 years old and married; she has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Iryn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, sugar, rice, soap, eggs, and other groceries.

Iryn has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years, and she also earns income by selling pre-paid mobile phone time. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, like shampoo, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 54 years old and married with three children.

Letty earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Letty has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 41 years old and married with 13 children. Eight of her children are in school and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elsie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has seven children, three attend school. She works hard to support her family.

She has a retail veterinary supplies business and earns additional income from milling corn.  Evelyn requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase  veterinary supplies.

Evelyn has sustained her business with 15 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, 1 attends schools. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Esmeralda has had a food vending business for 1 year It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Esmeralda requests 5,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy ingredients to restart her business.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients of her food production business.

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Diana is from Qaraberd village, where she lives with her four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in neighboring country who left his family with the hope of finding a well paid job and providing for his children. 

Diana runs their family farm and raises cows, calves, sheep, pigs and piglets.  She also grows wheat and barley. 

This is Diana's second loan from Kiva. She took her first loan to pay for her elder daughter's university tuition. She now has 4 children and works day and night to be able to cover their daily needs. 

She applied for a  loan  to invest in her farm. Diana  asks lenders to support her second loan so she can purchase wheat seeds and feed for the livestock. 

Please help this kind woman-farmer to sustain her farm and enlarge it.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is married, and has two children. She has a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fruit selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 35,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit to resell

loans.name: Mali Parbat Kalanjiam Shg Group

texts.en:
Khilla, 43, belongs to the Mali Parbat Kalanjiam SHG group in a village called Khudi in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is married with two children and operates a fruit sales business. She sells apples, oranges and other fruit in local markets. She wants to continue the business, she says, because her income from it helps to support her family.

Khilla, along with her group members, applied for a loan and she is using her portion to carry on her fruit business. She is grateful, she says, for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time. 

The other members of the group operate a variety of businesses including animals sales and agricultural products sales.

loans.use: to stock her fruit business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is age 35 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Recently, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to help cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize vegetable sales. Therefore, Nusrat has asked for a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's vegetable shop

loans.name: Gulsada

texts.ru: Гулсада, 52 года, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Гулсады - высшее педагогическое образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулсады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, а также большой земельный надел размером 12,00 ГА, на котором Гулсада ежегодно выращивает клевер под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Экологически чистую продукцию, а также вкусное домашнее молоко Гулсада реализует местным жителям. Супруг Гулсады помогает ей по хозяйству, а также занимается выпасом скота и пассажирскими перевозками. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Гулсады составляет в среднем 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Гулсада планирует накопить средства на покупку нового дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulsada is 52 years old, married, and has a grown son. Gulsada has a college education in teaching. She earns the primary source of income for her family by raising animals and farming. She started 19 years ago by buying 10,000 som (KGS) worth of animals. Thanks to her tireless work she today owns two milk cows, one steer, and a large, 12 hectare plot of land where she grows clover each year for use on her farm and for sale. Gulsada sells environmentally clean products and delicious fresh milk to local residents. Gulsada's husband helps on the farm as well as pasturing animals and providing transportation services for people. Gulsada earns an average of 40,000 som (KGS) per month from the business. In order to further develop the business, Gulsada approached the Bai-Tushum bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two dairy cows to increase production of milk. Gulsada plans to save money to buy a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to increase the volume of eco-friendly milk sales

loans.name: Joseline Cristina

texts.es:
Joseline de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado, es madre soltera con un hijo de 8 años, estudia 1° grado, vive con su abuela y una hermana.

El negocio es venta de tortillas desde 6 años se ha dedicado al oficio, aprendió por su abuela quien fue la que inicio el negocio, el trabajo lo realiza en casa todos los días desde las 8 am a 1 pm. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz para hacer las tortillas y otra parte para compra de insumos agrícolas porque ha sembrado 7,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, y es para comprar fertilizantes y abono.

Desea tener el negocio y que vaya creciendo así vender más y poder solventar los gastos del hogar, y con el cultivo que sea de buena producción, así en un futuro con las ganancias ir ahorrando para poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Joseline is 23 years old and studied through the fifth grade.  She is a single mother with an eight year old child.  He is studying in the 1st grade. They live with her grandmother and her sister. 

Her business involves selling tortillas and she has been working in this area for the past 6 years.  She learned the business from her grandmother who was the one who started the business.  She does her work at home every day from 8am to 1pm. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn to make tortillas and also to purchase agricultural feed because she has planted 7,500 square meters of corn.  She will buy fertilizer and feed. 

She wants to continue with her business and see it grow and thus sell more and be able to manage household expenses.  With her corn field, if it has a good crop, she would like to save some money and in the future open up her own store.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas and also to purchase agricultural feed for her corn crop.

loans.name: Merry Shg Group

texts.en:
Created on July 20, 2014, the "Merry Shg" loan group consists of women who are quite involved in developing income-generating activities. All the group members live in the same neighborhood and maintain good neighborly relations. Most of them also have extensive experience with the "Merry Shg" system. 

Mrs. Susila, standing with her hand raised, is the group's featured borrower. She is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. In the evening, she sells porridge made from millet in front of her house. She buys millet in 50-kilo bags, milk powder to make sour milk, sugar and other ingredients. After years of practice, she has acquired solid experience in this business,
 
She intends to use her new loan to buy millet, sugar, powdered milk and other ingredients. 

Revenues generated by the activity will enable her to bolster her savings, and support her husband in taking care of family needs as well as covering her children's education fees.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, powdered milk and other ingredients

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Bo, 41 years old, is a married woman who lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has five children, one is single and four are married. She is an active farmer on a small rice farm which is located near her house. She grows rice and sells it to local dealers to earn 3.00 per day. She has farmed for 20 years.

She wants to improve the  living conditions of the entire family and build a latrine. She will use the loan to help her family member gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general lenders.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Nour Elhuda Group

texts.en:
Nour is the featured borrower for Nour Elhuda Group. She got together with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lead good lives at the same time.

Nour is a 23-year-old single lady and a Syrian refugee, who ran away with her family from the war in Syria, and came to Lebanon in an attempt to find a safer place. Two years ago, upon her arrival in Lebanon, she started working in agriculture to help in cover her family's needs and expenses.

Nour is a very talented hairdresser, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to open her own beauty salon which will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

With respect to the other group members, Najwa is a 28-year-old married woman who wants to open a grocery shop to help her husband in satisfying the needs of their family, while Rima is a 22-year-old who works in agriculture and wants to prepare for her wedding.

In the photo, Nour is the first lady on the left, Najwa is the first lady on the right, and Rima is the lady3 standing in the middle.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 22-year-old divorced woman from Gaza City. She lives alone in a small room in the city with very poor living conditions. 

Two years ago, Hanan started her own business which is a sewing workshop where she makes women's clothes upon order and sells them in a small stall. It is a good job and provides Hanan with a fair income.

Hanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials such as textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity. 

Hanan appears in the photo in her stall.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, who is 63 years old, lives in the community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three dependent children who currently are garment factory workers and he also has one married child. He is a rice farmer who can make a net profit of USD $2.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been in this career for sixteen years.

An wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

An is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan providers.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a mother of four children, lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business, selling general merchandise, for eleven years. She started the business to look after her family.

She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy soft drinks and other goods to sell, such as sodas, water and other merchandise. Agnes hopes to expand her business; however, competition is a challenge she still faces, plus price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell, such as sodas, water, and other merchandise

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 34 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 48 years old and married with seven children; two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming bananas for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to be able to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aitykul

texts.ru: Айтыкул, 27 лет, женат. У него среднее образование, 7 лет назад в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи стал заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 20 овец, а также 1,68 ГА поливной земли, где он выращивает картофель и люцерну. Айтыкул известен, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день его деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 13,000 сом (KGS) от продажи скота и преимущественно от реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айтыкул обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Айтыкул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерен построить жилой дом.
texts.en: Aitykul is 27 years old and married. He has a secondary education. Seven years ago he began farming to earn the primary income for his family. Today he owns two cows, a horse, 20 sheep, and 1.68 hectares of irrigated land where he grows potatoes and alfalfa. Aitykul is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable man. Today his work earns him a monthly income of 13,000 som (KGS) from sale of livestock but mainly from selling farm products. In order to further develop his farm Aitykul asked the Bai-Tushum bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to be used to purchase 10 sheep. He plans to use proceeds from use of the loan to develop his business and intends to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Heghush

texts.en: Heghush lives in Shishkert village, works as a teacher in the village school, and has also cared for her parents farm for many years. She specializes in beekeeping, and the honey she harvests is well known among local people as very tasty and high in quality. She is requesting a loan to enlarge her beekeeping business by buying new colonies of bees and bee families. She is eager to produce moe honey because demand for it is now very high.

loans.use: to pay for new 18 bee colonies and 15 bee families.

loans.name: Chand Bibi

texts.en:
Chand Bibi is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns a clothing sale business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of her business. For that, Chand Bibi is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.

Chand Bibi hopes that this loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's clothing sale business

loans.name: Sangimo

texts.ru: Сангимо замужем за Холбозора. Он по профессии фермер. У них четверо детей, из которых двое мальчиков и двое девочек. Сангимо со своей дружной семьей проживает в одном из сел района Вахш. Ей 47 лет. Она вместе с мужем занимается растениеводством. Дополнительно Сангимо еще и занимается животноводством. Эту деятельность она начала 9 лет назад. Разводить скот ей помогают ее сыновья. Сангимо в основном выращивает маленьких бычков и после месяца откармливания продает их на скотном рынке по выгодной цене. В хозяйстве Сангимо в настоящее время осталось всего один бычок и для продолжения деятельности ей необходимо закупить еще пару бычков. С этим намерением Сангимо обратилась за кредитом в размере 1000 долларов США. Этот кредит ей очень важен для продолжения и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sangimo is married to Holbozor, a farmer. They have four children, of which two are boys and two are girls. Sangimo lives with her family in one of the villages in the Vakhsh area. She is 47 years old. She and her husband grow crops, and for the past nine years Sangimo has also been raising animals. Her sons help with the livestock. Sangimo mostly raises young calves and after a month of fattening, she sells them at the livestock market for a profit. At this time Sangimo only has one calf left and she needs to buy another pair to keep her business going. In order to do that, Sangimo is asking for a 1000 USD loan. This loan is very important for the continuation and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy young calves to increase the number of livestock she has

loans.name: Thoeurng

texts.en: Thoeurng, who is 43 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are garment factory workers while the other three are students. To make a living and support her family, she has grown rice on a small farm since 1990. The average income that she can make is $5.00 per day. To supplement her income, she would like to raise pigs near her house to re-sell when they are grown. She lacks enough money to do this, and is requesting a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the pigs. With this loan, she hopes to improve her living standards. She thanks for all lenders for their financial assistance for poor people such as her.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Jacky

texts.en:
Jacky is 26 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jacky's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jacky is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Jacky has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Jacky is committed to rebuilding, and in the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Leah has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from fishing.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business. Angeles has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns more income from making dried fish.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additonal fishing net

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Herminigilda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Herminigilda has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 44 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Soledad works very hard to provide for them.

Soledad's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Soledad is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Soledad has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Soledad is committed to rebuilding and, in the future, she would like to save enough money so that she might be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.ru:
Александра занимается тепличным бизнесом. Ее муж пережил инсульт; сейчас он поправился, но работать в теплице не может. Александра занимается теплицами вместе со своим младшим сыном. Дети собираются перехать в свой новый дом этим летом.

Александра принимала в гостях своих родственников:беженцев с восточной Украины (из города Донецк). Они жили у нее два месяца. Сейчас В Донецке затишье и они вернулись обратно домой. 

Александра просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку семен, угля, пленки и удобрений. Она надеется получить хорошую прибыль в новом сезоне, чтобы было с чего заботитья о своей семье.
texts.en: Alexandra runs a greenhouse farming business.  Her husband had a stroke some time ago, and he has since recovered, but can no longer work in the greenhouses like he used to.  Alexandra tends to her farm together with her youngest son.  Her children will be moving into a new home this coming summer.  She invited some of her relatives to stay with her earlier this year; they were refugees from Donetsk in eastern Ukraine, and lived with her for two months.  Things have quieted down in Donetsk, and they've gone back home.  Alexandra is seeking a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, coal, plastic film and fertilizer.  She hopes to make a good amount of money this season to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, coal, fertilizer and plastic film

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leona works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling prepaid mobile phone time.

Leona is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like canned goods, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: S Mayai Leikai Lup Group

texts.en: Pramodini is a courageous woman who shows determination in achieving her aspirations. She is 45 years old and pictured with her hand raised with the rest of the group members. She has two school-going daughters. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw driver who earns his daily income by carrying passengers up and down from their locality to the main market in town. Their village is 20 kilometres from town. Pramodini owns a poultry farm at her home. “I started a poultry farm since it is a good choice to exercise my skills and earn instead of depending totally on my husband’s income, which scarcely meets our needs,” she said. Four years ago she constructed her own poultry coop at home using bamboo and using her expertise. It was low cost and she has been using the same coop since then. She provides school fees, medical expenses, household expenses and joined the local banking within friend circles with the profit she makes by selling the fully grown chickens. There are also unfortunate business times when the chickens die, and she has a loss. Now she hopes to broaden her business by building more coops and buying more chickens to raise. She also needs to buy a stock of fodder for the chickens. With the Kiva loan, she will buy a stock of fodder and more chicken to raise them. She will sell the chickens when they are fully grown and use the profit for her daughters’ educational expenses and poultry business. She is looking forward to the next loan. She says, “thank you so much” to the lenders. The rest of the group members are working hard to meet their business goals and strive for their own financial freedom with their best capability. They are engaged in weaving, embroidery, poultry farm, rice hotel, vegetable vending and cosmetics businesses.

loans.use: To buy fodder and chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Ríos de Agua Viva está conformada por nueve integrantes  ocho mujeres y un varón, madres padres responsables de quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.
