Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles a sus hijos la estabilidad que necesitan. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Dora y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos. El negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su actividad unas ocho horas diarias, cargando un bulto de unos veinte kg, para ofrecer su mercadería a clientes fijos como eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es para surtir sus productos como : perfumes, vanidad, rubor, delineador, sombras de ojos, anteojeras, antiarrugas, lápiz de ojos, crema hidratantes, body, labiales etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores  ingresos.  La Asociación comunal Ríos de Agua viva agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is comprised of 9 members, 8 women and 1 man. They are responsible mothers and fathers who have 15 children in their care.They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the northern part of the region. 

They are hardworking, responsible people with a desire to succeed. Unfortunately, they were not able to study due to a lack of economic resources. Currently they fight daily to give their children the stability they need. 

Due to her desire to succeed, Dora is the coordinator. She sells cosmetics. She sells her products door to door as well as at her house. She works for 8 hours a day, carrying a 20kg (44 lbs.) bag offering merchandise to her regular and new customers. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy products such as: perfume, blush, eyeliner, eye shadow, eye cream, anti aging cream, moisturizer, body cream, lipstick etc. This will allow for better income in a near future. 

The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy products such as: perfume, blush, eyeliner, eye shadow, eye cream, anti aging cream, moisturizer, body cream, lipstick etc.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de 47 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee desde hace 4 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old and lives in his own home with his family. For the last four years he has run a small store from his home. He has a lot of customers because of his fair prices and his friendliness at the point of sale. 

Oscar is applying for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, lollies, pastries, etc. so that he can have a bigger income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, lollies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Shg Group

texts.en:
This is the "Maa Gayatri Shg",  a entrepreneurs group, which is composed of 10 optimistic and hardworking women. 

Lakhsmi, pictured standing with her raised hand, is 27 years old, has two dependent children, and is separated from her parents-in-law. She sells office supplies. For over two years, she has been making her sales of  paper, pens, magazines, and other stationery items and her business is going well. Her greatest wish is to have a store of her own and to offer books for all purposes.

She, along with her group, requested this loan and she is using her portion to purchase office supplies in bulk for sale. 

The whole Maa Gayatri Shg group is grateful to the Kiva investors who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy office supplies in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.en:
Mavludakhon is a kind woman who is married with two children. Being a responsible mother, she works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send one of her children to school.  

Mavludakhon is dedicated to her farming business, growing onions and maize on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning till late evening for five years.

Mavludakhon would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. She hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject her loan, and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Panales No 2 Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Panales No 2, está conformada por diez integrantes, madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Todas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, por la cual luchan día a día para brindarles  estabilidad  a sus familias.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es María Ofelia y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su actividad unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es  invertir en la compra de lote de cerdos en pie. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  la asociación comunal  Panales No2 agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Panales No 2" communal bank is composed of 10 members who are responsible mothers with 15 children under their care. 

They are natives of El Sauce in the north of the region. They are hard-working, responsible and want to get ahead. 

They all have different economic activities and they work from day to day to provide stability for their families. Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead María Ofelia is the coordinator. She buys and sells hogs. Her business is located in her home. 

She works for 8 hours a day trying to sell her products. 

The loan will be used to buy hogs so that in the near future she can have a better income. 

The "Panales No 2" communal bank is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who support people of low economic resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy and sell hogs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 48 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, posee un taller de calzado,  repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Gerardo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con la elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He runs a shoe store where he repairs and makes shoes. His store is located in his home and he has a lot of customers because of the quality of his products. With the income from his sales he is able to get ahead and pay the household bills. 

Gerardo is applying for a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc. so he can continue making shoes, since this is his only source of income. This will give him and his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tarps to sell

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
Chandrama is a 30-year-old member of the Maa Saraswati SHG group. She lives in a small village in Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a self-employed bicycle mechanic who sells bicycle spare parts and installs them.

Chandrama has been a tailor since 2009 and has managed to survive off the tailoring business since then. She specializes mostly in ladies dresses such as blouses and salwar-kurta. She has been helping her husband with household obligations. 

Before coming to People’s Forum, business for her was low. This was because she did not have enough capital to buy materials to meet her demand. She also lacked business management skills that she obtained from the training offered at People’s Forum. After receiving her first loan, Chandrama was able to double her revenue. With her savings, she also purchased an industrial sewing machine for her business, and this has enabled her to achieve better efficiency and effectiveness.

With the Kiva loan, she hopes to get more materials and an assistant so she can be able to take on bigger jobs as her business is expanding. She wishes to one day have her own house where she can live with her family.

loans.use: to get more materials and an assistant so she can be able to take on bigger jobs as her business is expanding.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, harina de arroz, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 55, lives in her own house with her husband, her daughter and her two grandchildren. 

For the past 6 years, she has sold "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas). Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy maize, cottage cheese, sausage, beans, rice flour etc. This will allow her to keep making "pupusas" and in this way improve her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy maize, cottage cheese, sausage, beans, rice flour etc.

loans.name: Rosa Evelyn

texts.es: Rosa vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de especies desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas achote, ajonjolí, pimienta,  consumes, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa lives in her own house with her nuclear family. She has worked for many years selling spices. Her business is located in the Municipal market, and she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more annatto, sesame, pepper, clear soups, etc. at wholesale prices in order to continue with her sales, and in this way have more earnings.

loans.use: to buy more annatto, sesame, pepper, clear soups, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Bhimabhoi Shg Group

texts.en:
The Bhimabhoi Self-help group, from a small village named Dharadapal of Angul district, represents the empowered women folk of rural Odisha. Formed in the year 2000 out of responsibility to family, Bhimabhoi SHG succeeded in overcoming the hindrances of a prejudiced patriarchal society. President Dukhi, a mature lady aged 46, herself went through very harsh times when she took the role of her husband after his demise.

But, the mutual trust and determination of this group of ten brave women changed their future forever. Here after 14 years of formation, each one of them has a fascinating success story to tell.
  
Bhimabhoi SHG has applied for a loan amount of 200,000 INR for enhancing the new business activity they started a year ago. Dukhi will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

Two of the members, Labanya and Sukanti, started mushroom cultivation on their own, and are now planning to expand the cultivation involving more village women. The other women are engaged in farming different products.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 54-year-old married mother of eight children, three of whom are in school. She has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for eight years, and earns additional income selling vegetables, fertilizers, and duck eggs.

Merly is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and vegetables seeds. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Atamoqlan

texts.en:
Atamoqlan, a 26-year-old single man, lives with his parents in an IDP settlement. He has worked as a gardener for four years, raising seasonal fruits (apples, pears, figs, quince and etc.) and vegetables (greens, onion, potatoes, tomatoes). His monthly income is 150AZN.

Azerbaijani people have a high demand for fruits and vegetables, using them in delicious national dishes in everyday life and for holidays and parties. Atamoqlan wants to increase his  income from selling vegetables, and so has applied for a 500AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and fertilizers. 

Atamoqlan wants to earn enough money to repair his old house and get married.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace algunos años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face is blurred is 23 years old and lives in a high risk zone. For several years he has worked farming growing corn and beans. He sells his product in different markets located near his home. He lives with his wife and child in their own home. The young man seeks a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticide, etc. and to improve the farmland you see in the photograph to be able to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticide, etc. and to improve the farmland.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella  se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, Yesenia  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yesenia is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has been selling shoes for various years. Her business is located in a very busy area so she has many customers. With the sales she is able to pay her expenses. Yesenia is seeking a loan to buy shoes at wholesale in order to be able to have greater income and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Danelia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cada mañana Guadalupe, despierta con ganas de salir adelante y mejora la situación higiénica de su familia. Tiene 44 años de edad, esta soltera y es madre de dos hijos. La necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y prevenir las enfermedades es la razón por la que solicita un segundo crédito para la construcción del servicio higiénico de uno de los cuartos de su vivienda. Gracias a este crédito y al apoyo de su hija podrá tener servicios privados en cada uno de los cuartos de su vivienda. Luego de realizar esta mejora en su vivienda aspira a construir y mejorar la estructura de la cocina de la misma. Así poco a poco desea ir mejorando cada área de su casa hasta verla completa y mejorada.
texts.en:
Guadalupe wakes up every morning with the desire to get ahead and improve the hygienic situation for her family. 

She is 44 years old, single and the mother of two children. 

In order improve the conditions in her house and to prevent disease, she is requesting a second loan which will allow her to build a bathroom in one of the rooms in her home. 

Thanks to this loan and the support from her daughter, she will be able to have private bathrooms in all the rooms of her house. 

After making these improvements to her house, she wants to build and improve the kitchen. 

This way, little by little, she wants to improve every area of her house until it is complete and improved.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in one of the rooms in her home.

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: La señora Eloina es una persona mayor, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y a su cargo tiene tres dependientes económicos que son sus hijos, alcanzo estudiar solo hasta el nivel primario, su actividad principal es la agricultura, produce papa, haba y otros productos en la provincia de Tiraque, tiene terrenos agrícolas propios y otros heredados de su padre, actualmente logro adquirir su casa propia, pero se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de ganado bovino para hacerlo engordar y después venderlo en un precio más elevado, de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos y por lo tanto la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Eloina is an older woman, married, lives with her husband has three children who depend on them. She completed elementary school. She farms in Triaque, growing potato, beans, and other products. She has her own farm land and other land inherited from her father. Today she has her own home. She seeks a loan to buy cattle to fatten and then sell at a higher price. In this way she will improve her income and thus the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to generate income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.name: Maa Santosi Shg Group

texts.en:
Sushama is a member of Maa Santosi SHG Group. She is 42 years old and has two children, both of whom are teenagers. Her husband Raghab works in the field of agriculture earning 5,000 INR per month. Sushama intends to send her kids to better schools and, subsequently, a good college so that they can have the opportunity to generate a better livelihood for themselves. However, she cannot achieve that solely on the income of her husband. Therefore, she joined Maa Santosi SHG to take a small loan and expand the agriculture business with her husband.
 
Sushama, along with her group, has requested a loan of 165,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay labor charge so she will be able to produce more output and save more. which comes in handy on a monthly basis to save for the future of her kids.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay labor charges

loans.name: Mother Teresha Shg Group

texts.en:
Benjulata is a 34-year-old woman and a Self Help Group member of the Mother Teresha Shg. She has two children under the age of 10. Her husband is a hardworking farmer who cultivates crops on his own farm. She belongs to Thakurgara village in Athamalik block in Angul district of Odisha, India. She wants to help her husband out with a little extra income so that she can provide a better life for her kids. She joined the Mother Teresha Group on 15th of Feb, 2014 and since then has been taking regular loans to enhance her economic conditions.This will be the group's first loan with Peoples Forum.

Her husband is also 34 years old and makes 5,000 INR per month. After taking a loan from Peoples Forum, Benjulata will be able to invest in buying better cultivating tools and derive more output.  She now wants to buy more farms and expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy more tools and farmland

loans.name: Esperanza  De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Ketty de 33 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida Con El Futuro” está conformado por 10 socios responsables y solidarios. Ketty se dedica a la venta de gas doméstico hace más de 02 años donde todo le va bien. Producto a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de balones de gas. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su local para poder almacenar sus productos. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida Con El Futuro” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Ketty se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado derecho, viste casaca negro.
texts.en: Ketty is 33 years old and married, with one dependent child. The group “Esperanza de Vida Con El Futuro” ["Hope for Life with the Future"] is made up of 10 members who are responsible and have solidarity with each other. Ketty has worked for more than 2 years selling household gas, and it is going well for her. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve her quality of life. She applied for the loan in order to buy gas canisters. Her greatest desire is to expand her shop so she can store her products. The "Esperanza de Vida Con El Futuro” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan. Ketty is standing in the back row; she is the fourth from the right, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy gas canisters for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to be able to sell soda pop.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.en:
Emerson is 31 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children now at their school age. 

Emerson has been earning a monthly income from his salary as a heavy equipment mechanic abroad for four years already to support his family. He earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month from doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to purchase additional construction materials for finishing his house construction. Emerson became a member of PMPC just this year. 

In the future, Emerson hopes to establish his own business here in the country together with his wife and family.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials to finish his house.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Narcefa has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Don Gregorio, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos,  y reside con su familia, en el municipio de Morazán Yoro. Don Gregorio siempre a cultivado maíz y frijoles. y hace 10 años que empezó a cultivar café.  Este cultivo lo realiza en un sector cafetalero y vende el  producto en grano húmedo en la misma zona. El préstamo que solicita es de 6,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para darle asistencia a la finca de café. Su plan es asegurar su fuente de ingresos, dándole buena asistencia a al cultivo para sacar mejor producción.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 55 years old, married with three children and lives in the municipality of Morazán Yoro. Gregorio has always grown corn and beans and ten years ago he started growing coffee. This coffee crop is located in the coffee growing area and he sells his product as wet processed coffee beans in the same area. 

Gregorio is applying for a loan of 6000 lempiras which he will use to purchase fertiliser and pay for the cost of labour to help him on his coffee farm. His plan is to have a secure source of income which will be a big help to his coffee crop and allow him to produce a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pay for labour to help him with his coffee farm

loans.name: Edward Esau

texts.es: Edward, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside con su familia en un barrio suburbano del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Edward, Trabajó por varios años en una empresa privada y luego de quedar sin empleo,  hace 9 meses él  ha decidido con su esposa establecer una pulpería donde vende pan, churros, refrescos, verduras, salsas, harina, huevos, jabón, papel higiénico, azúcar, sal, café y otros abarrotes enlatados. y para surtirla e incrementar el inventario ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar carne de pollo, productos lácteos, churros, pan, azúcar, harina, frijoles, manteca, huevos, productos de aseo, productos enlatados etc.así mismo le ayudara a obtener más ganancias. Tiene como meta darle un buen estudio a sus hijos, crecer con el negocio y a futuro piensa aperturar otro negocio.
texts.en: Edward is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula. He worked for a few years in a private business but was left without work. 9 months ago he decided with his wife to open a small convenience store where he sells bread, churros, beverages, vegetables, salsas, flour, eggs, soap, toilet paper, sugar, salt, coffee and other canned groceries. To stock and increase the inventory he decided to seek a loan of 21,000 Lempiras to buy chicken, dairy products, churros, bread, sugar, flour, beans, butter, eggs, canned goods, etc. which will help him obtain greater profits. He has as a goal to give his children a good education, grow his business, and in the future he plans to open another business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, dairy products, churros, bread, sugar, flour, beans, butter, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Shg Group

texts.en:
The story of Radhakrushna SHG is a contradiction to the common concept of gender bias and inequality prevailing in the eastern part of India. Here is a group of eight hardworking women from Angul district of Odisha, supported and motivated by their husbands in getting involved in all spheres of decision making, once dealt only by men. And it has proved right through their active involvement in the cultivation activities. 

These women in all means have justified the name Radhakrushna, a divine love story of Hindu mythology which talks about male and female being equal parts of a single soul.

Shaila is a 55-year-old widow woman and an active member of this group. She lives with her three children. She has been engaged in paddy and vegetable cultivation since 1992 when her husband passed away. She will use her loan portion to buy hybrid sides of paddy and vegetables so she can produce more and can make more money.

Shaila, along with her group, would like to thank to Kiva lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to buy hybrid sides of paddy and vegetables so she can produce more paddy and vegetables

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Janaki, from Khamar Village, Odisha, India, was just 30 when she lost her husband, leaving her with three small children to take care of. Since then, she has been struggling and leading a difficult life. With no options left, she became engaged in the business of leaf plates-making, which gives her 5,000 INR monthly, that too seasonally. With such a small penny, it is very difficult for her to give education to her children, take care of their health, and get them meals two times a day.

Janaki, the lady standing third from the left hand side, is a member of Maa Laxmi SHG and is a determined woman. She wants to give a good life to her children so that at the end of the day, if some mishap occurs, they will be able to tackle it and lead a respectful life. She has expertise in making leaf plates, which are used in marriage functions, birthday parties, and temples, and have good market demand. Leaf plates have a ready market in the village itself, so she does not need go to the city or find market linkages.
 
In a day, a machine can produce a minimum of 300 plates, and each plates cost 3 INR, so she can earn 900 INR in a day, making it to 27,000 INR monthly. As the business will grow, she can also employ a few women, creating employment.

She will use her loan portion to buy a leaf plate-making machine.

loans.use: to buy a leaf plate-making machine.

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is 38 years old and married with two kids. The family is IDP and lives in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a worker. She is a gardener and has been raising fruit trees (figs and quince) and selling the fruit at a local bazaar for 12 years. Her monthly income is 190 AZN.
 
Azerbaijan people know that figs and quince are very useful for health. They like to eat these fruits fresh and use them to prepare quince or fig jam or pie.  People drink quince with hot milk when they catch a cold and recover after drinking this. 

Hicran’s fruit assortment for selling isn’t wide enough and that’s why her income doesn’t increase. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new fruit tree seeds and make her assortment at the bazaar wider.  She hopes that one day she will be able to recover her previous happy life.

loans.use: to buy new fruit tree seeds to increase her assortment at the bazaar .

loans.name: Hada Carolina

texts.es: Hada vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hada lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling pupusas (a traditional stuffed tortilla) for more than 10 years, Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. She is seeking a loan to buy corn, cream cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, etc. to be able to continue with her work and in this way be able to have better income in order to have an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cream cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, etc.

loans.name: Nazirakhon

texts.en:
Nazirakhon is an industrious woman. She is a very kind woman and always helps her relations and neighbors if they need her help. Nazirakhon is careful mother of her children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Nazirakhon is a seamstress. She has been sewing national women’s dresses for seven years. She also sews a variety of curtains and new fashions. She provides high-quality services to her clients. Her clients return to her and thank her for the high-quality service. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni because she must buy fabrics, thread, and needles, and she also must pay for electricity. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and needles, and to pay for electricity.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal as her main source of income to earn a living. She is married with nine children, and five are able to acquire education. She desires to build houses for renting so as to generate more income, though inadequate capital is still a challenge to her.

She wants a loan to buy more charcoal for selling.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Radhaswami Shg Group

texts.en:
Sumitra, aged 48, is a very humble woman with a dream of helping village women live with menstrual hygiene and dignity. She is a member of Radhaswami SHG of Sanahula village located in Odisha, India. She wants to break the social taboos related to menstruation. She is a mother of two young girls whom she sees missing their classes and hiding from every one each month due to their period. 

She has passed half of her life living in social taboos where women are treated as untouchables when they get down and the number of girls drop out of  their schools due to poor hygiene facilities.

She wishes to realize her dream but she lacks resources and financial support. Sumitra’s monthly household income is just 5,000 INR as her husband passed away and she is the only earning person in her family. She wants to support her family economically by doing some business and she want to contribute to improving the social status of women in her village. She has a dream of starting a micro-enterprise for sanitary napkin production for which she wants to buy a machine. This will generate employment for other SHG members, improve hygiene practices among women and girls and contribute to increasing her household income. 

Sumitra says that if we will take one step, they are ready to take 10 steps and will contribute to breaking the silence of women. For establishing the micro-enterprise, she has requested a loan of 20,000 INR for each member initially.

loans.use: to buy a machine for sanitary napkin production

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: CHEIKH est un jeune homme âgé de 30 ans qui est marié et père de famille. Il habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet et évolue dans la commercialisation des chaussures, pantalons et des sacs. Etant à son 2ème prêt, il sollicite ce dernier pour acheter des pantalons, chaussures et sacs pour les revendre à ses clients. Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Il gère toutes les charges quotidiennes  de sa petite famille. Il a une expérience de plus de 3 ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Il voudrait renforcer et financer d’avantage sur ces activités pour satisfaire ses clients et cela il ne pourra le faire que grâce à l’institution.  Ainsi il verra ses revenus augmenter et l’amélioration des conditions de vie  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a thirty-year-old young man, married, and a father. He lives in the neighborhood where the finance institution is located, and works retailing shoes, pants, and bags to his customers. He does not have any beneficiary parent in the institution.

Cheikh takes care of all the daily expenses for his small family. He has over three years of experience in his business. He starts the day at 9 a.m. and leaves work at 7 p.m. He would like to strengthen and capitalize his business further to increase client satisfaction, which he can only do thanks to the institution. This way, he will increase his revenues and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, bags, and shirts.

loans.name: Nelson Fredys

texts.es: Nelson de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos,comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Nelson vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar concentrado para los cerdos y asi poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelson, 50, has worked for several years by raising pigs. He sells the pigs in different markets. With the sales he makes, he is able to pay household expenses. Nelson lives in his own home with his life partner.

He is requesting this loan to buy pellets for his pigs and continue raising them to have more income.

loans.use: to buy pellets for his pigs.

loans.name: Wilzon

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 6, 3 y un año, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Él es independiente, trabajador, responsable, comprensivo y buen padre. Su trabajo lo realiza en la ‘comunidad Isquellani’ cercana al lago Titicaca donde sus pobladores se ocupan de la agricultura y la pesca como forma de vida.
Wilson es de tez morena, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará y conoce el español por el comercio. Su negocio es la cría y engorde de ganado vacuno para su comercialización en la feria de la comunidad. Su sueño es construir una casa para su familia y utilizará los beneficios de su negocio para realizarlo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa, su experiencia en el negocio es de toda su vida porque lo heredó de sus familiares. Su deseo es realizar la compra de ganado y también forraje y pagar las vacunas que necesitan sus animales.
Es por esos motivos que Wilzon solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, forraje, pago de vacunas y con los beneficios construirá una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 34 year old man who lives with his partner and has 3 children; one of 6, one of 3 and one of 1 year old.  His business is the sale of live cattle. He is independent, hardworking, responsible, understanding and a good father.  He does his work in the community of Isquellani near Lake Titicaca where the locals work in agriculture or fishing to earn a living.  

Wilson is of dark complexion, medium height, his mother tongue is Aymara and he knows Spanish because of his work in sales.  His business is the rearing and fattening of cattle for its sale in the local fair.  His dream is to build a house for his family and he will use the profits from his business to make this dream a reality. 

This is the first sequence of loans for his company; his experience in the business is lifelong as he inherited the business from his family.  His dream is to buy live cattle and feed and pay for the vaccines that the animals need.  It is for this reason that Wilson is applying for a loan, for the purchase of live cattle, feed and payment of vaccines and with the profits build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy live cattle, feed and the payment of vaccines and with the profits build a house for his family.

loans.name: Manuel Ernesto

texts.es: Manuel de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un molino de nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de discos, fajas, cuchillas y darle mantenimiento a su molino para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 68 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has a corn mill located in his place of residence. In addition to this, he also grows corn and sorghum. With the earnings from his work, he succeeds in going forward. 

He is requesting a loan to buy disks, belts, and blades and to maintain his mill so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy disks, belts, and blades and to maintain his mill.

loans.name: Maria Aracelia

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter who works and helps her economically. Maria is a street vendor who sells clothing in different markets. She has many regular customers for the quality of her clothing and good prices. She seeks a loan to buy clothing at wholesale in order to be able to continue her sales and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es un hombre joven de 19 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el soporte y mantenimiento de software y hardware (técnico en computación).
Él es independiente, inteligente, emprendedor, cuidadoso, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de Sacaba, un lugar caracterizado por la variedad de comida típica y por su clima semi-tropical.
Ariel es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español y habla aymara porque es su segunda lengua. Su negocio es la reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras y ya lleva dos años de experiencia en el rubro. Su vida la realiza sólo porque vive en casa de su tía que vive en el extranjero y él se encarga del cuidado de su casa, esta cuenta con servicio de agua y luz. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la universidad pública la carrera de ingeniería forestal y le faltan cuatro años para terminar. Esta es su primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y para conseguirlo necesita realizar la compra de una computadora portátil que le facilite estudiar y trabajar.
Es por esos motivos que Ariel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con su trabajo y estudios.
texts.en:
Ariel is a 19 year old single man, without children. His business is supporting and maintaining software and hardware as a computer technician. He is independent, intelligent, enterprising, careful, responsible and hard-working. He works in Sacaba, an area known for its type of traditional food and semi-tropical climate. Arial is dark-complected, medium height, dark short hair, and his first language is Spanish and he also speaks Aymara as his second language.

His business is repairing and maintaining computers and he has done this for 2 years. Single, he lives in his Aunt's house while she lives abroad, and he takes care of her home, including paying the water and electricity.

Today he studies forestry engineering at the public university and he has 4 years until he finishes. To continue his studies he needs to buy a laptop computer that will enable him to study and work. So for this reason Ariel seeks a loan to buy a laptop computer to continue his work and studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to continue his work and studies.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man with 4 children and 3 attend school. He does farming as his main source of income alongside charcoal selling. He started the business so as to sustain his family and educate his children.
 
He desires to educate his children and construct a house for his family. He faces a challenge of weather vagaries, pesticides and diseases which affect his crops and thus lead to poor yields.

He wants a loan to plough and weed his garden.

loans.use: to plough and weed his garden

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente,trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y papaliza como sus principales productos agrícolas en parte de su terreno propio con una extensión de 2 hectáreas. Produce con rotación de cultivos como la avena forrajera y cevada para el consumo de su ganado vacuno, tiene una experiencia de 14 años en la actividad agrícola, también cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno(1 lechera y 2 vacas-yuntas). La señora requiere el crédito para la compra de un camión de abono orgánico(gallinaza), ocho cargas de semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos para el fumigado de los cultivos, con el fin de incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia lives and works in Colomi. Economically, she is independent, hard working, and responsible. She works in agriculture, growing potatoes as her main agricultural product on part of her own land, with a two-hectare extension. She produces on rotation products including oat fodder and barley for her cattle. She has 14 years of experience in agricultural work. She also has 3 cows (1 dairy cow and 2 cows for a yoke). 

She needs a loan to buy a truck of organic fertilizer (from hens), eight loads of potato seeds, and agrochemical products to exterminate insects from her crops. She aims to increase her production and improve her income for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy a truck of organic fertilizer (from hens), eight loads of potato seeds, and agrochemical products to exterminate insects from her crops, with the goal of increasing her production.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben de 49 años vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene  a la hora de manejar y  por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ruben está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ruben is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his two daughters. He has been a driver transporting cargo for 15 years. He has many customers because he is a responsible driver and has accessible prices, with which he obtains work in order to pay household expenses. Ruben seeks a loan to buy tires and perform maintenance on his truck in order to continue working and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance on his truck.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas. Normelita has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from selling native products.

Normelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Ainamoi area within Kericho County can be considered a hardship area. Even with savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall, a farm with over 2 high-pedigreed Fresian cows, producing over 20 liters of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat, considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, like the lack of electricity from the national grid and also having to be dependent on traditional methods of harvesting water. 

Kiva lenders, meet Charles, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a loving husband and has been farming for the past 10 years. Charles passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that he knows his cows, each individually, because he works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. He and his wife have even named one of them “Lelmet”. Because he loves the cows, he runs his operation by four simple rules that have kept him and his herd happy. The rules are: breed them well, feed them well, clean them well and milk them well. 

His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, vegetables  and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, motorbikes, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. Charles source of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kericho area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Charles is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Charles is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. All that Charles waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver products to the market on time

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 69 años de edad,  no estudio pero si aprendió a escribir, esta viudo y tiene 3 hijos y solo uno vive con él, trabaja en la agricultura y solamente los 2 viven en casa.

Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y aprendió por su padre y abuelo, siembra por lo general maíz, frijol y yuca, actualmente tiene sembradas 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 28,000 de yuca, su hijo le ayuda en las labores.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas y abono para los cultivos.

Espera que su cultivo tenga buenas producciones, así pagara los gastos del hogar y pagar el crédito sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Antonio is 60 years old, he didn't go to school but he did learn how to write. He is a widower, has 3 children and only one lives with him at home. He works farming. Ever since he was a child he farmed, learning from his father and grandfather. He generally grows corn, beans, and yucca. Today he grows 14,000 square meters of corn and 28,000 of yucca. His son helps him with the work.

The loan he seeks from CREDICAMPO is to buy pesticides, herbicides, and manure for his crops. he hopes his harvest will yield a good production in order to pay the household expenses and pay the loan without any problem.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides, and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Ever Omar

texts.es:
Ever de 32 años de edad, estudio 1° año de bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Sus hijos viven con ellos, el mayor asiste a la escuela de la comunidad y viven juntos como familia.  

Ever tiene un taller de carpintería en su casa, trabaja en esto casi desde niño, aprendió de un vecino que tenía y de su papá que trabajaba en esto. Ahora que se casó decidió hacerlo de forma independiente para tener mayores ingresos para su familia. Ever trabaja en actividades agrícolas en la siembra y cultivo de maíz aunque esto es solo para consumo familiar.

Ever trabaja en su casa, la madera la compra a productores de la zona que se la llevan a la casa y los demás insumos (clavos, visagras, tornillos, pinturas y barnices) los compra en la ciudad a 6 km de su casa y viaja en bus. 

Con el prestamo el cliente comprará madera para trabajar en la fabricación de muebles en noviembre y diciembre eso le da la oportunidad de tener mayores ingresos para su familia.  Sus sueños son para el futuro de tener un taller más grande y enseñar el oficio a los jóvenes de la comunidad y para sus hijos que estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Ever is 32 years old and has studied until the first year of his degree. His wife is dedicated to household tasks. His children live with them; the oldest attends school in the community, and they live together as a family.

Ever has a carpentry workshop in his house. He has worked in this field almost since he was a child. He learned the work from a neighbor that he had and from his father who worked in the field. Now that he is married, he decided to do carpentry independently to have a better income for his family. Ever does agricultural work by sowing and growing corn, though this is only for his family’s consumption. 

Ever works in his house. He buys wood from producers in the region that bring the supplies to his house. He buys the remaining supplies (nails, hinges, screws, paint, and varnish) in this city, which is 6 km from his house; he travels by bus to get there.

With the loan, he will buy wood to make furniture in November and December, which will give him the opportunity to have better income for his family. His dreams for the future are to have a bigger workshop and to teach the work to young people in his community. He also dreams that his children will study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: El Wafaa Group

texts.en:
Wafaa is the featured borrower for El Wafaa Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Wafaa is a 47-year-old widowed mother of six children and a Palestinian refugee who started baking ten years ago to cover the needs and expenses of her family for she is their sole earner. Today, Wafaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying a kneader which will facilitate her work and satisfy her customers' with better service. 

With respect to the other group members, Amira is a 60-year-old widowed mother of six children who works in tailoring and wants to help her son in renovating his house, while Randa is a 38-year-old married mother of three children who has a bird shop and wants to open a hooka shop as a second source of income. 

Wafaa is the lady standing in the middle, Amira is the first lady on the left, and Randa is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a kneader

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr: COURA est une femme qui est âgée de 55 ans et qui vit avec son mari et ses grands enfants. Elle est très brave et s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans cette activité. Elle évolue dans l’aviculture et demande ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour la pratique de l’aviculture. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait avoir une grande ferme avicole et en même temps pratiquer l’élevage. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coura is a 55-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her grown children. She is very brave and has been working in this business for over ten years.

She works in poultry farming and is requesting this amount to purchase chicks and feed. She helps her husband with the household’s daily expenses and the children’s schooling costs. She starts her day 8 a.m. and ends it at 7 p.m. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a large bird farm and continue raising livestock. This way, she will be able to increase her revenues and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed to raise poultry.

loans.name: Rita Yolanda

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer que desde muy joven conoce lo que es el trabajo duro, es madre de dos maravillosos hijos que son el principal motor en su vida y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Desde hace muchísimos años trabaja como obrera de campo, ha sido un trabajo un poco difícil, pero un reto que ella siempre lo asumió con mucho entusiasmo, con el fruto de ese trabajo ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Rita está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá empezar a construir su casa, de esta manera su calidad de vida mejorará y así podrá vivir una vida cómoda y tranquila junto a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Rita has known hard work all her life. She is the mother of two marvelous children who are her reason for living. Rita lives with her family in Ica. Rita has worked as a farm laborer for many years. It has been difficult work but she has completed her work with much enthusiasm. With the fruit of this work she has been able to support her family.

Rita is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to begin construction on her home. In this way she will improve her quality of life and be able to live a comfortable and tranquil life with her loved ones.

loans.use: to begin construction on her home using quality materials.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Saidi, who is in his mid-30s, is married with three children; two of them are in school and one is still small. He has been selling charcoal for four years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Saidi's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and opened a retail shop.  He has paid back all his loans successfully and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a fridge and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customer demand and to increase on the shop inventory.  He dreams of buying a minibus for a transportation business. 

Saidi will share this loan with his loan group "Paradise," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet customer demand and to increase on the shop inventory

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat lives with her family in the south of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are adults.

Muhabbat is a highly-educated woman. She has a higher pedagogical education and has worked for more than 11 years in a school. Muhabbat has a great experience in this field, so she is one of the best teachers.

Muhabbat always tries to give a good education to her children. Now, her son is a student and she must pay for his education in the university but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to pay for the education of her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her son

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling peanut butter. Sarah is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like malong, pajamas, blouses, etc. to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like malong, pajamas, blouses, ect. to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 74-years-old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonisa has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Purnima Shg Group

texts.en: Purnima is a group formed by 10 hardworking women who strive hard to lead an independent life. They are engaged in different occupations, namely embroidery, weaving, tailoring, and grocery retailing to sustain their livelihood. The featured borrower, Santibala, is a 39 years old, married and pictured with her hand raised with the other members of the group. She lives with her husband and two school-going children in a village that is around 20 kilometres from town. Her husband works in a brick field (one kilometer away from their house) as a daily wage earner to support his family. Santibala makes beautiful embroidery wraparounds and shawls to sell. “It has been more than 15 years that I have been doing embroidery work,” she said. She can embroider two shawls or wraparounds per week and sells the end products in the market at the rate of 300 INR each. Embroidery fabrics are very popular among young girls and women and are worn during occasions and at work places. She does the household chores and when she has free time, she does embroidery work at home. The income she gets from the embroidery work is used for paying monthly school fees for the children and for buying the necessary articles for the household. She now aspires to sell embroidery fabrics with higher costs ranging from 500 INR to 800 INR to increase her income. With the Kiva loan, she will buy better quality beads, threads and fabrics for her embroidery to sell the products at a higher price. She wishes to save some of the profit she makes for school admission fees for the new session for her children and the coming festive season. She is excited to take the loan and give her thanks to the lenders for their beneficent support.

loans.use: To buy different shapes of beads, colourful threads and fabric for the embroidery that she sells.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos, ollas, sartenes de aluminio, etc. asi como los que muestra en la fotografía, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 39, sells plastic products, pots, aluminum frying pans, and similar items such as those seen in the photograph.  Her business has been located in the municipal market for several years. 

She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale products in order to continue with her sales, and thus have better income.

loans.use: to purchase plastic products, pots, aluminum frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  new chairs, new cups, new plates and food ingredients for mama lishe business.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a humble house. His brother works as a teacher in a public school where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Odai is a student at a local collage where he studies Economics. He wants to finish his studies and find a job to support his family. 

Odai took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a printer for his studies. He will be able to print his reports and home work easier with less cost. 

Odai appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a printer for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 47-year-old married male living in Masindi-Uganda. He does cattle fattening and sells milk as his additional income. He started the business so as to cater for his family needs. He has hopes of educating his children, however, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital.

Joseph wants a loan to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Kaplamai, Kapsowar area of Kenya is a jobless man-turned farmer named John and his family of four lovely children. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. Kapsowar area constitutes wrenching statistics of people living in hardcore poverty but beyond the numbers you will see bright, vibrant and open faces searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible.  

Armed with this conviction, John has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 7 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. John is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. \

Through this loan from Kiva lenders John will buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan, and will also go towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from the cow manure which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. John waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is a young and successful girl. She is a student of the first course at Tajikistan University of Economic and Finance. Mahina studies well and she tries to get a good financial knowledge and she dreams to work in the future at any bank. Mahina reads a lot of books. She is not married and lives with her parents. They live far from the capital of Tajikistan but her university is located in the capital of Tajikistan. Mahina must to pay for her tuition and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy is a 21-year-old freshman at a university living in Kratie Province of Cambodia. His major is marketing. Recently, he has been employed as a security guard earning $5 daily. Due to the fact that he is short of financial support, Savy would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee for his first year. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees for his first year

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal El esfuerzo está conformada por catorce integrantes doce mujeres  y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables de veinte hijos menores de edad, son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Por lo que luchan día  a día para mantener surtidos su negocio y que sea rentable día a día.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante y sus ganas de superación personal, la coordinadora es  Ciprina  y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal el Esfuerzo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
“The Effort” Communal Association is composed of 14 members, 12 women and two men, who are responsible mothers and fathers of 20 minor children. They are from Malpaisillo, located in the northern zone of the region.  All are characterized as responsible workers with a desire to advance personally, and each is involved in a different economic activity. They all struggle daily to keep their businesses well-stocked so that they will be profitable day to day.

Thanks to their desire to succeed and their desire for personal advancement, the coordinator is Cipriana whose economic activity is buying and selling live pigs. Her business is located in her home. The objective of her loan is to invest working capital to supply her business, so that in the near future, she can earn a better income. 

“The Effort” Communal Association is grateful for the help Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources from poor countries like Nicaragua to create worthy sources of work.

loans.use: to buy and sell live pigs.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Phan, 26, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, he is a lovely father of three dependent children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, growing many kinds of vegetables and selling them to the local dealer. On average, he can earn around USD 5.00 a day to support his family's daily expenses. So far, he has been involved in this career for 14 years.

To keep his vegetables growing well, Phan is going to use natural fertilizers in his farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, he would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process. With the support from this loan, he hopes that it can make his vegetables grow better and produce more benefit for him. 

He also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gie Kom Kom Group

texts.fr: Le GIE KOM KOM  est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se regroupent une fois tous les fins de mois. Elles ont comme président Madame AMY  qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le sucre, le lait, le riz et l’huile. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle demande ce crédit de ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir augmenter et diversifier son stock de marchandises ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Gie Kom Kom is a group composed of five women who reside in the same neighborhood and convene at the end of each month. Their president is Mrs. Amy, who is raising her hand in the photo.

Amy works in food retail, selling products such as sugar, milk, rice, and oil. She is married and a mother who helps her husband with the family’s daily expenses. She is requesting a loan in this amount to increase her stock of merchandise and to keep his customers satisfied. She has over five years of experience in this business. She starts her days at 8 a.m. and ends them at 6 p.m.

In the future, she would like to increase and diversify her stock of merchandise. In this way, she will be able to increase her revenues and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products (such as cereals) to retail.

loans.name: Ermilita

texts.en:
Ermilita is 49 years old, married and has three children. One of her children is in school.

Ermilita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

Ermilita has been raising cattle for ten years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ermilita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Agileo

texts.en: Agileo is a hardworking married man with four children. He lives in Masindi-Uganda and wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation. He has a motorcycle business alongside brick laying as his other source of income. He started the business to earn a living. He is affected by inadequate capital and bad roads that cause mechanical break downs. He desires to buy more motorcycles to add more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa a 64 ans et vit dans le quartier Adidomé. Elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Soucieuse de l’éducation de ses enfants, Adjowa  vend depuis 2010 la bouillie et des beignets à domicile. Elle s’occupe seule de son activité et s’y consacre 7 jours sur 7. Pour augmenter son stock auprès du fournisseur grossiste, elle sollicite un prêt pour s’acquérir 40 bols de maïs, 10 bols de farine de blé et 12 l d’huile. Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa is 64 years old; she lives in the Adidomé neighborhood. She is widowed and a mother of five. Because she wants to insure that her children get an education, Adjowa has been selling porridge and donuts from her house since 2010. She manages her business alone, and dedicates herself to it seven days a week.

To increase her stock from her wholesaler, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase forty bowls of corn, ten bowls of wheat, and twelve liters of oil. Profits will allow her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase forty bowls of corn, ten bowls of wheat, and twelve liters of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an amount of livestock to raise and to benefit from their milk and meat.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 39-year-old married male. He is a hardworking man who sells fish. He takes care of six children with ages between 22 and 9, of which four attend school. He decided to rear goats after realizing that selling fish alone does not earn him enough income. However, inadequate capital hinders his business.

He needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting his fish.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting his fish.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de maracuyá, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de la fruta y los buenos precios, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, insecticidas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old and dedicated for more than 10 years to cultivating passion fruit. She sells her products in the different markets found near her house. Marta has many customers due to the quality of the fruit and her good prices. She lives with her life's companion and their four children in their own house. 

Marta is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, plague controls, insecticides, etc., to be able to continue with her work and to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, plus plague controls and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 62-year-old youthful guka (old man) and smallholder farmer based in Kericho, which is a small agricultural center near the Rift valley area of Kenya. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely 55-year-old wife, and they have been blessed with lovely angle-like children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 30 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a “side hustle” business. 

From Kiva lenders, Alfred is seeking a loan worth KES 40,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Alfred access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Alfred’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow his horticulture business

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es: Susana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, Susana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor para obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana, 32, lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She works by selling fruits and vegetables, which she's done for 8 years. Her business is located in the town market and she has many customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices.

Susana is requesting this loan to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables so she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hardworking divorced woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for looking after three children, two of whom attend school. She sells used clothes to generate income. She has hopes of buying land in the future. Mary needs a loan to buy clothes to sell. However, she faces a great challenge of inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem, 65, is a  widow with two children. She lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in a rice framing business on a small farm since 1999. On average, she can make an income of USD 5.00 per day.

For supplementary income, she wants be a tailor during her free time from farming. Because there is not enough money, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a sewing machine. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to improve her living standard. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a hardworking man and runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise, alongside selling fish. He used the previous loan to buy fishing nets, which has helped him stabilize his fishing business and increase his income.

He has a great dream of buying land to start farming. He needs a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is thirty-years-old and married with two children living in Kasese Uganda. Juliet operates a bar and used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has a dream of educating her children and buying land. Juliet is faced with a challenge of limited capital and high license fees. Juliet is a hard working woman requesting money to buy sodas and beers for selling.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for selling.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 52-year-old married man with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Joseph‘s main business is buying and selling to produce more like maize, beans and G nuts which he has been doing for many years.
