He started this business because small scale farmers in his area could not access better markets in major towns around Kyenjojo . He gets additional income from food vending.  He is faced with a problem of transporting his produce to the market and hopes to buy his own means of transport. He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy and produce more business like maize to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined our organization primarily to create a better future for her children, Yahuza, Fridaus and Hadiza, and is excited that Babban Gona offers a way to end the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loans, Mary expects to harvest up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, she would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent more than the market price at harvest. This allows Mary to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Mary said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to pay various expenses.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Agée de  30 ans, Yawa vît dans le quartier Adidomé avec sa famille. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants. 
Yawa est devenue depuis 2009 une revendeuse des couverts et les verres à boires.  Elle vend à domicile et parfois circule dans son quartier et les environnants pour augmenter ses ventes. Elle s’y consacre plus de 8h par jour et ce 6 jours sur 7. Yawa est très dynamique et souhaite agrandir  son activité par ce microcrédit en achetant 04 cartons de verres de différentes marques.
texts.en:
Yawa is 30 years old; she lives in the Adidomé neighborhood with her family. She is married and has three children.

Since 2009, Yawa has retailed cutlery and drinking glasses. She retails from home and sometimes door-to-door in her neighborhood and nearby areas, to increase sales. She dedicates herself to her work for over eight hours a day, six days a week.

Yawa is very active and wishes to grow her business thanks to micro-credit financing, by purchasing four boxes of glasses from various brands.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of platters and 2.5 boxes of drinking glasses.

loans.name: Miryana Group

texts.en:
Afifa is the featured borrower for Miryana Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living conditions at the same time.

Afifa is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started five years ago preparing and selling "mouneh" to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Today, Afifa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income. This loan is very important to Afifa, for it will help her improve her family's living conditions. 

With respect to the other group members, Mariam is a 47-year-old married mother of four children who works in both a nursery and handicrafts and wants to renovate her house, while Alia is a married woman who works in a nursery and as a makeup artist who wants to increase her merchandise with more colorful makeup, as she also wants to renovate her house. 

Afifa is the lady sitting in the middle; Mariam is the first lady on the right; and Alia is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-two year old married female with 2 children who all go to school. She has a business, selling food, located in the market. She has been in that business for fourteen years. Agnes hopes to buy land, educate her children and expand her business into new markets. However, lack of enough capital and seasonal changes affect her business since she works from an open place. Agnes is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling

loans.name: Bernarda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Bernarda de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta 1° año de bachillerato. Está acompañada, su pareja trabaja la agricultura y con ganado, tiene dos hijos que viven en casa y están estudiando. 

Bernarda trabaja con ganado bovino, lo ha hecho por unos 6 años y lo aprendió de su familia y decidió hacerlo buscando un ingreso económico. Además hace ventas para los fines de semana en las canchas de fútbol. Antes solo eran oficios domésticos. La distancia está como a 2 km y viaja a pie o en carreta. Le apoya su compañero de vida y sus hijos cuando no tienen clases. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto, para continuar con ese negocio.

Sus sueños son poder trabajar lo mejor que se pueda siempre, así para poderles dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bernarda, 33, went to school through the first year of secondary school. She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture and livestock. She has two children who live at home and go to school.

Bernarda works with cattle, which she has done for six years. She learned this work from her family and decided to start doing it herself to earn income. She also sells on the weekends at the soccer fields. Previously, she only did domestic work. She travels the 2 km distance by foot or wagon. Her husband and children, when they don't have class, help her.

The loan she is requesting is to buy cattle so she can continue this business.

Her dream is to be able to work the best she can so she can give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Halal

texts.en: Halal is applying for a new loan from Kiva lenders to buy more home appliances and furniture. The first loan which he took out from Kiva helped him very much to improve living conditions in his house, and he is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support. Halal has not yet finished repaying all the installments from this first loan, and is requesting an additional loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva lenders to buy more new furniture and appliances to make his home more suitable for living. Halal hopes to finance acquisition of these items, because his house stills lack many things it needs.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and appliances for his home

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 64 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su hijo en casa propia, Daniel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 64, has devoted himself to agriculture, especially growing beans, for 20 years.  He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house.  He lives with his son in his own house.

Daniel is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc.  He will improve the land shown in the photo in order to be able to continue with his work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Blanca Maria

texts.es: Blanca de 39 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 6 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Blanca está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 39, lives in her own house with her family.  For six years she has had a small store at her house.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices and the kindness she shows her customers when she sells.

Blanca is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet breads, etc.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is 48 years old, divorced and the mother of five children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the last 14 years, she has earned a living by selling firewood. She dreams of buying land and expanding her business despite inadequate capital. She is requesting this loan to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Altagracia Group

texts.es: Grupo Altagracia está conformado por tres socias laboriosas y emprendedoras, una de ellas es Linda de  23 años de edad, casada; su negocio es venta de comida desde hace dos años en su domicilio. Este crédito lo solicita para la inversión de granos básicos como frijoles, arroz, cebolla, aceite, verduras, frutas, etc. La segunda socia es Fátima de 42 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su hogar y doña Ana de 41 años de edad, se dedica a brindar el servicio de un salón de belleza – estilismo.
texts.en:
The Altagracia Group is made up of three industrious and enterprising members. One of them is Linda who is 23 years old and married. For the past two years, she has had a business selling food from her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in staple foods such as beans, rice and also onions, oil, vegetables, fruits, etc. 

The second member is Fatima, who is 42 years and runs a grocery store business from her home, and Ana, who is 41 years old and who makes a living providing beauty and styling services in a salon.

loans.use: to invest in staple foods such as beans and rice and also onions, oil, vegetables, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy knives, discs, belts, and to perform maintenance on her grinder

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca y su esposo Esteban, viven en la provincia Chapare,tienen 42 y 46 años de edad respectivamente, con un nivel de instrucción primario, de estado civil convivientes por más de 10 años, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad agrícola, siembran Papa, Oca y Haba en una superficie de 4 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuentan con un mercado consolidado en Colomi, La señora requiere el crédito para la compra de terreno agrícola en la misma comunidad donde vive, ya que sus ahorros los invirtio en la compra de ganado vacuno de yuntas. De esta forma podrá tener mejores ingresos e incrementar su patrimonio familiar en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca and her husband Esteban live in the province of Chapare. They are 42 and 46 respectively. They studied up to primary level at school. They have lived together in a common-law partnership for over 10 years. They are economically independent, and both work in agriculture, sowing potatoes, yams and beans in a 4-hectare plot of land. They use a well-established market in Colomi to sell their produce.

Francisca is asking for loan to buy agricultural land in the community where she lives, as she invested her savings into buying a pair of beef cattle. Doing this, she can increase her income and augment their assets to benefit the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 44 years old, a widowed professional cook with a child, a student, living with her siblings in Takeo province of Cambodia. 

Being a cook since 2013, she can earn approximately $4 per day. To improve the family’s finances, Saroeun would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her brother to run as motorcycle taxi. This loan will help her brother earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to help her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her brother to run as motorcycle taxi

loans.name: José Odil

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, no estudió, está acompañado. Su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos. Tiene tres hijos que viven en casa de los cuales uno trabaja y dos estudian. 

José trabaja con ganado, lo ha hecho por unos 20 años y lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió trabajar para buscar ingresos económicos para su familia. También trabaja la agricultura en donde cultiva maíz, frijol y maicillo. Antes solo era empleado jornal. La distancia está como a 3 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta.

 Le apoyan dos hijos cuando no tienen clases. Su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. El pr{estamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar dos bueyes para trabajo. El préstamo le mejorará porque podrá realizar sus trabajos con sus propios recursos y eso le dejará mayor ganancia porque no pagará porque le ayudan y así también optar por una mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es la oportunidad de seguir trabajando. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y pidiéndole a Dios por su salud, para darles estudio a los hijos y que puedan tener en el hogar lo indispensable.
texts.en:
José, 41, did not attend school. He lives with his life partner, who works as a housekeeper.  He has three children who live at home, one of whom works, and two who are attending school.

José has been working with livestock for about 20 years, having learned from his parents. He decided to go to work in order to earn an income for his family.  He also works in agriculture, cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum.  Before, he was only employed as a day laborer.  His work is about 3 kilometers from his house, and he travels there on foot or in a cart. His two children help him when they don’t have classes, and his schedule is from 6:00 A.M. until 5:00 P.M. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase two oxen for work.  The loan will help him because he will be able to carry out his work using his own resources.  This will leave him with more earnings because he won’t have to pay for help.  In this way, he will have a better quality of life, and he will be able to continue working.

His dream is that he may continue working; and he asks God to grant him good health so that he may provide his children with an education, and give them what they need at home.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen for work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y ay tiene clientes fijos que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, el joven vive con su madre en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar mas semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The youth's face has been pixelated in the photo because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He earns his living with the sale of roasted cashew nuts. He has held this occupation for a number of years and he has regular clients that choose him for the quality of his products and the good prices. The youth lives with his mother in their own house. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew nuts in bulk in order to continue his work and achieve a better quality of life for himself and his mother.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts in bulk

loans.name: Sangaly

texts.en: Sangaly is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. Last year he has applied to the Kurgantube State University. His parents are workers. Their income is small to pay for Sangaly’s tuition at the university. He is asking for a loan of 900 USD to pay for tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto es un hombre de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la construcción.
Él es independiente, fuerte, resistente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en diferentes lugares de su ciudad.
Remberto es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que vende huevos en el mercado, y sus dos hijas una de ellas ya asiste a la escuela, todos viven en su casa propia que cuenta con agua de pozo y luz, próximamente le instalarán el alcantarillado. Él comenzó su trabajo cuando terminó la escuela secundaria y lleva más de siete años en el negocio de la construcción. Su sueño es concluir su casa para brindar a su familia un hogar más seguro y necesita realizar la construcción de cimientos en su domicilio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución.
Es por esos motivos que Remberto solicita un préstamo para la construcción de cimientos para darle a su familia un hogar seguro.
texts.en:
Remberto is a 28-year-old man. He lives with his partner and he has 2 daughters, aged 6 and 3. He works in construction, in several places throughout the city.

He is an independent, strong, tough, responsible and hardworking man. Remberto has a dark complexion and short black hair. Quechua is his mother tongue and he also speaks Spanish.

He shares his life with his partner, who sells eggs in the market, and his two daughters, one of whom is already in school. They live all together in their own house. It has well water and electricity, and soon they will install drains.

He started working in construction when he graduated from high school and he is been doing this job for more than seven years.

His dream is to finish building his house to provide his family with a safer home. To do so he needs to build the foundations of the house. This is why Remberto is requesting a loan. It is the first sequence of loans he requests at the institution.

loans.use: to build the foundations of his house to give his family a safe home

loans.name: Haikona Ageteraine Kukurakurana Group

texts.en:
Fred, aged 41, is shown with a hand raised. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a produce business and gets extra income from a bar and farming, where he is assured of constant income throughout the year. 

Despite his progress, he is challenged by price fluctuations and the bad roads that make transportation of the produce to his customers difficult. However, his vision is to be economically well off.  

Fred has asked for a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Julia Iliana

texts.es: Julia tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad. Julia  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de limpieza desde hace  mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y de esta forma junto al apoyo de su esposo mantiene la economía del hogar. Julia no cuenta con el servicio de agua potable por lo que desea invertir en la compra del derecho y en la conexión del vital líquido. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir lo antes posible en la conexión del agua potable y compra del derecho para la conexión.
texts.en:
Julia is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and small six year old daughter. For a long time now, Julia has had a small business selling cleaning products for a long time. She makes her sales as a street vendor and, with the help of her husband, she is able to support the household finances. 

Julia does not have potable water service, so she wants to invest in the right to access and connect to vital drinking water. For this reason, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in a connection to drinking water and the right to access it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in the right to access and connect to drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic poultry manure, and potato seed for planting.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 27-year-old married man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He lives with his parents in a small house and works as a farmer in the family land where they plant olive trees. Thaer would like to improve the living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Thaer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. by taking this loan, Thaer will be able to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Thaer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Baghaberd village with her husband. 

She works at local factory: she does labeling-packing work. Emma, in addition to her work, also runs a farming business. 

She is specializes in beekeeping. Emma and her husband currently keep 46 colonies of bees and get high quality honey. As honey is a must-have product for Armenian families, the honey that they get is in high demand.

So to able to enlarge her agribusiness, Emma asks for this loan. She plans to purchase 15 bee families and 8 colonies of bees. 
Due to this loan, Emma will be able to enlarge the production of honey and expand her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for 15 bee families and 8 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Emilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Emilia de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo desde hace 6 años, adicional a eso también tiene una pequeña tienda, Emilia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir con la elaboración de los tamales como: maíz, pollos, verduras, tomates, consomés, etc. todo por mayor y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Emilia is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has been working making and selling chicken tamales for 6 years. She also has a small store. Emilia is requesting a loan to be able to buy the ingredients she needs to continue to make her tamales like: corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, consume etc. She will buy them wholesale and then continue with her work in order to make more income.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, consume, etc.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura (siembra maíz), comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her mother. For 15 years she has worked in agriculture (growing corn). She sells her product in the neighboring communities and has many clients. Maria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc and improve the land that is shown in the photo. Then she can continue her work and make more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 24-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah. He lives alone in a small room in the city. Hani has a small food stall in the city which has been working for one year. He sells traditional sandwiches like falafel and shawarma. It is a good business but the income is not high. 

Hani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw food for his food stall to resell. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Hani appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more raw food for his food stall to resell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is a 22-year-old married young client. The family has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Rustam is a farmer and has 3 years of  experience in this field. He raises seasonal vegetables (corn, greens, beets, spinach, turnips, celery, cucumbers and zucchini) and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

People like eating fresh vegetables and using them in preparing of national dishes (bughlama, sadjh ichi, kuku, dovgha, lobya chighirtmasi, etc.) These are recipes from ancient times and they are still very famous. Local restaurants are permanent customers of Rustam’s green grocery.

Though people have a high demand in fresh vegetables, unfortunately, this business isn’t profitable enough to cover Rustam’s family’s demands. He decided make an innovation in his business. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to buy husbandry and increase his income because meat and milk are in high demand and these products don’t depend on a season.

loans.use: to buy husbandry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toys and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooker for her mum, for greater safety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more corn and peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La Srta. Mariela, nacio en una provincia del departamento de Chuquisaca, muy pequeña perdio a su padre por una enfermedad y su madre se hizo cargo de ella y de sus tres hermanos, a los cuales logro hacerles estudiar hasta el bachillerato, en cuanto salio bachiller se fue a la ciudad de Sucre ha seguir estudiando y trabajar para pagar todos sus gastos, trabajo en varios lugares, pero no le daba el tiempo para seguir con sus estudios, por eso decidio tener un negocio propio, y empezo a vender ropa para mujeres y niños, actualmente ofrece a varias instituciones públicas y privadas. El crédito lo solicita para capital de operaciones, ya que muchas veces entrega la ropa a sus clientes a crédito, y necesita comprar mas cantidad de ropa y de diferente variedad para  ofrecer mas opciones a sus clientes, de esa forma lograra mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariela was born in a province of the department of Chuquisaca. She lost her father at a very tender age through a sickness and her mother took care of her and her three brothers. She had them study until they graduated secondary school.

When she completed her studies she went to the city of Sucre to continue her studies and work to pay all her expenses. But she didn't have time to continue with her studies so she decided to have her own business. She started to sell clothing for women and children. Currently she offers them at various public and private institutions.

The loan she is requesting is for operating capital as she often gives the clothing to her clients on credit. She needs to buy a greater quantity and more variety of clothing to offer more options to her clients. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing of different types to offer more options to her clients.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with six children of school age. They live in their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated an agricultural selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan she is requesting of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump to irrigate her farm. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump to irrigate her farm

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twelve years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to have maintenance done on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to have the maintenance done on his taxi. Therefore, Gulnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Gulnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities so that he can earn a profitable income. Gulnaz also plans to save part of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's future needs.

Gulnaz is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the bathroom in her house to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Karen Yuliana

texts.es:
Yuliana es una microempresaria muy joven, con muchas ganas de superarse, y tener independencia económica, es la primera vez que solicita crédito a una organización para su negocio, Tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a los servicios de manicure y pedicura, con un Centro de Uñas en su casa.  Además desea incursionar en estética, que actualmente está preparándose en esa aérea, en una  Academia de Belleza. Su record crediticio está limpio, encluso no tiene consultas realizadas. 
La actividad es pequeña, y los ingresos generados producto de negocio son para reinversión, que es su prioridad, luego se cubren algunos gastos del negocio.  
Inicio su negocio con capital propio, y se costeó su primer curso de manicurista, luego compró sus  primeros esmaltes. Actualmente tiene una cartera de clientas consolidada, sin embargo en este momento necesita hacer una inversión  de capital de trabajo, y adquirir los insumos para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y aumentar sus ingresos.
Yuliana y su familia acondicionaron una de las habitaciones de su casa, para el Centro de Uñas, ofrece servicios de esmaltado, puesta de uñas en acrílico, gelatina, resina, encapsuladas y otras técnicas, como en 3D, extensiones de uñas, mantenimientos y otros. Sus aspiraciones son seguir  preparándose en un Centro de Belleza para ampliar sus conocimientos y servicios en el aérea de estética.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a very young small business owner with a great drive to improve herself and gain economic independence. It is the first time that she is requesting a loan from an organization for her business. She has spent more than 3 years offering manicure and pedicure services in a nail salon in her house. In addition she would like to venture into esthetics; she is currently preparing herself in this area in a beauty academy. She has a clean credit history, she hasn't even had any consultations carried out.
It is a small-scale occupation, and the income generated from the business is intended for reinvestment, which is her priority. Later, some costs of the business will be covered. 
She started her business with her own capital, and she shouldered the costs of her first manicurist course, then she purchased her first nail polishes. Currently, she has a register of established clients; however, at the moment she needs to invest in her working capital, and acquire the funds to improve the quality of her services and to increase her revenues.
Yuliana and her family have outfitted one of the rooms of their house for the nail salon, which offers nail painting services, the application of acrylic, gelatin, resin, and encapsulated nails, as well as other techniques such as 3D, nail extensions, upkeep, and others. Her aspirations are to continue preparing herself in a beauty centre to deepen her knowledge and services in the area of esthetics.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, shellac, acrylics, wax, creams, as well as equipment such as a lamp and examination table

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 25 years old and married with a son. She and other members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is laborer and gets additional earnings for family. The main source of income for family is gardening. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them at local bazaar. She gained good skills working in this field for 4 years. Her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Local people have high demands in foods, especially fresh fruits and vegetables. They visit the local bazaar every day and attend Farida’s green grocery every morning. They know that Farida doesn’t use pesticides on her fruits and vegetables. 

Farida’s family settled in an IDP settlement recently and they need to build their house. Unfortunately her monthly income isn’t enough to do this. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy new fertilizers for her garden.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for her garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Kiptere is a typical village in Kericho area of Kenya where around 100 families live, suffering from poverty and malnutrition. Most of the people make their livelihood by working as labourers in the agricultural fields belonging to farmers in neighboring and more distant villages. 

Robert has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for parents and siblings, he has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from his farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, he has been engaging in other small personal businesses. 

The Kapsowar area has high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from his region, Robert finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and he stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” His biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. He lacks funds to increase his poultry farming, so he is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being from a marginalized community, he finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, he feels relieved knowing that his dream will be achieved, and he will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, he will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary man, he intends to accumulate more profits and expand his poultry business to other markets. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. The extra income he will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing his living conditions, and securing the future of his school-going siblings who depend on him for school fees.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Alamjan

texts.en:
Alamjan is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Alamjan is providing sewing services and is earning income to contribute to the management of the household. 

She needs accessories for her business, such as needles, threads, pieces of fabric, as well as a machine; but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above items she needs, which will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Alamjan is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stitching accessories and a sewing machine for her stitching business.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is 21 years old, a student at a university and living in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He has also been employed as a Boarding Staff at an airport in the province. 

Being a staff member since 2013, he can earn approximately $8 daily. Because of a shortage of finances, Vannak would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to run a souvenir shop and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Levance

texts.en:
Levance is 37 years old. He is married to Juliet and together they have been blessed with nine children of ages between 18 and 5 years respectively.

He is in the transport business via motorcycle. This has been his business as well as income-generating activity for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Levance has requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000 which he will use to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle.

With the anticipated profits, Levance will be able to repay his loan as well as educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to save enough money to buy himself his own motorcycle so as to get all the profits and full benefits of owning one. He desires to have several motorcycles and provide employment opportunities for others as well.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a fifty-four-year-old male married with nine children, living in Kasese Uganda. He operates a restaurant, does farming, and has a motorcycle transport to get additional income. 

 He is hard-working with a dream of setting up a retail shop besides a restaurant. Abdu is faced with a challenge of high government taxes.  He wants money to pay taxes for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay taxes for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is a 43-year-old married woman, from the village of Koreti. She lives with her daughter, her pensioner mother-in-law and her husband. 

Ia is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in providing for their family, and covering their increasing needs. They make an income from selling  agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. They own a milk cow and produce milk products for trading and for family use as well. However, the income is not sufficient to meet all their daily costs, which is leading to financial difficulties.
 
Ia lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain a loan to start a business. However, the Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo will enable her to get a loan of 1,300 Georgia Lari (GEL), and to start her trading business.  She will buy a stock of clothing, and will sell it in her community with a mark-up. With the support of the Start Up program, Ia will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and to tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To start her own business specializing in trading clothing.

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en:
Ovsanna and her 16-year-old son live in Shaqe village, Syuniq region. Ovsanna's husband has migrated to a neighboring country with the hope of finding a new job to be able to sustain his family's living expenses.

To tackle her financial hardships, Ovsanna has been involved in agribusiness. In the small farm near her house, Ovsanna keeps 6 cows and 10 calves. As well, she cultivates haricots and potatoes and sells them to local wholesalers.

To enlarge her farming business, Ovsanna now asks for this loan. She needs some funds to be able to purchase forage for the livestock and feed them during the coming winter season.

Ovsanna, as an organized and hardworking farmer, hopes for lenders' support to her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and fertilize his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es: El señor Agapito actualmente se encuentra viviendo con su pareja,en una zona muy alejada de la poblacion de Entre rios, su actividad económica es agrícola, tiene una experiencia de 7 años, actualmente se dedica a la producción de piña, la producción promedio anual es 18.000 unidades, la estacionalidad de la produccion consiste en que el programa la induccion floral para obtener 4 cosechas la cuales estan acorde a los precios de venta y de entrega al mercado, el credito solicitado es para la ampliacion de la produccion de piña el cual genarara un incremento en sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Agapito is currently living with his partner in an area very distant from the town of Entre rios. He earns a living in agriculture and has 7 years of experience. 

He is currently producing pineapples, the average annual production is 18,000 units. The seasonal nature of the production means that he can plan the induced flowering to obtain 4 harvests, which are appropriate to the sale prices and the delivery to market.

The requested loan is to expand pineapple production which will generate an increase in his income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to expand pineapple production to increase his income and provide a better quality of life.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is a 21-year-old single man. He is a refugee and lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. He is a farmer, and has raised fruit trees and sold fruits at a local bazaar for almost three years. His monthly income is 160 AZN and this is not enough for him to make his hard life better. That’s why he works additionally as a laborer when he has time.

Fresh fruits are very useful for people’s health because they include lots of vitamins. People know this and buy fruits more often than other foods and products. They prepare different sweets, jams, etc.

The condition of Ismayil’s garden is very bad. Because of the rainy climate in that region his harvest dies and he can’t sell enough fruits to cover his demands. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to buy garden tools and make a small greenhouse for his trees.

loans.use: to buy garden tools and make a small greenhouse for his trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is a 21-year-old diploma student majoring in managerial information systems, and she is in her second year. She has been planning to experience work life after getting her Diploma degree, but because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 28 years old and a married young man. His wife is a housekeeper. Elshan grows fruits (apples, pears, cherries, pomegranates, etc.) and vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, eggplants and different kinds of greens) in a handmade greenhouse on a small part of land. He sells these products at the local bazaar. He has six years of experience in this business and it brings him a 240 AZN income.

Azerbaijani people know that fruits and vegetables are full of various vitamins useful for health. They prepare different healing drinks from fruits and vegetables and make various remedies from therapeutic greens. Beside that, vegetables and greens are used to cook tasty dishes and salads (choban salad, mimosa salad, capital salad).

Elshan is borrowing a 1200 AZN loan from Aqroinvest CU for the third time. He is planning to buy more land, grow more fruits and vegetables and get more income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more land and grow more fruits.

loans.name: Desmond

texts.en:
Desmond has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for 16 years now. He is 36 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. He also has a green grocery and a hotel and the businesses have been profitable.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and onions to sell in his grocery business. He will also buy cooking oil and sugar for use in his hotel. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to buy a vehicle for his transport business and also educate his children.

loans.use: to buy grocery food to sell.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik is an agronomist from Katnaghbyur village in the Aragatsotn region. She lives with her pensioner husband.

To take care of her family, Sofik is engaged in cattle breeding, and in the cultivation of wheat.

With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Sofik currently needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock in winter. Sofik and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock in winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his mechanical workshop and make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es conocido por toda su ciudad, ya que ha sido un hombre emprendedor que no deja de trabajar a sus 52 años de edad. Poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en su negocio, no hace mucho solicito un préstamo para comprar CDs de música y lentes de sol para vender, teniendo excelentes resultados. Por esta razón se siente sumamente agradecido con las personas que lo apoyaron económicamente en el préstamo anterior. 
Ahora hasta pudo establecer una pequeña pulpería con lo ahorrado. Mariano solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más CDs de música, películas, lentes de sol para vender, así mismo para invertir en su pequeña pulpería. , ya que ha visto cómo las ventas se incrementan cada vez que invierte en su negocio. Él sueña con tener un establecimiento más sólido y convertirse en un empresario autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Mariano is known throughout the city as he has been a entrepreneur who hasn't stopped working at 52 years old. Little by little he has been investing in his business. Not long ago he requested a loan to buy music CDs and sunglasses to sell and had excellent results. For this reason he feels very grateful to the people who supported him financially with the previous loan. Up to now he has been able to establish a small store with his savings.

Mariano is requesting a new loan to buy more music CDs, movies and sunglasses to sell as well as investing in his small store. He sees his sales increase each time he invests in his business. His dream is to have a more solid establishment and become a self-sufficient entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy music CDs, movies, sunglasses, basic grains, milk, toilet paper, amongst others.

loans.name: Mari Cruz

texts.es:
Mari Cruz es una joven de 24 años, nació en la provincia Andres Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia y vive con sus padres. 

Ella trabaja en una institución financiera como cajera y nos comenta que le gusta su trabajo pues encontró su pasión en los números, razón por la cual escogió la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial y solicita un crédito educativo para poder culminar sus estudios ya que los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor fuente de inspiración para salir adelante son sus padres, ya que si bien ellos no pudieron estudiar una carrera universitaria por motivos económicos, han logrado sacar a su familia adelante.

Mari Cruz además de trabajar y estudiar, se da el tiempo necesario para participar en diferentes actividades artísticas relacionadas con la cultura, ya que forma parte del Ballet de su universidad. 

Mari Cruz considera que lo que la hace diferente a otros estudiantes es su fuerte anhelo de superación. Su sueño es ser una excelente profesional y poder optar a un mejor puesto de trabajo  o poner su propio negocio. Se siente muy agradecida con el Programa y con aquellas personas que confiaron en ella y le están dando una oportunidad de ser profesional y así alcanzar sus sueños que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Mari Cruz is a young 24-year-old woman. She was born in the province of Andres Ibáñez, Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia and lives with her parents.

She works at a financial institution as a teller and she tells us that she likes her job because she found her passion in numbers, and that is why she chose the degree of Commercial Engineering and requests an educational loan in order to be able to finish her studies, since she uses the income that she receives to support the expenses of her home. Her greatest source of inspiration to get ahead is her parents. Even though they could not study at university for economic reasons, they have achieved getting their family ahead.

Mari Cruz, besides working and studying, gives the time needed to participate in different artistic activities related to her culture and she is part of her university’s Ballet.

Mari Cruz believes that what makes her different from other students is her strong desire for improvement. Her dream is to be an excellent professional and to be able to aim for a better job position or create her own business. She is very grateful for the program and for those people who believe in her and are giving her the opportunity to be professional and in that way reach her dreams that she desires so much.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in Commercial Engineering.

loans.name: Joaquin Emilio

texts.es:
Joaquin es un campesino de 45 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un cultivo de flores, cultivo que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus tres hijos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, semillas y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus flores. 

Joaquin, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquin is a 45 year old farmer, he is hardworking and humble. When he was a kid he learned to work the land through teachings from his parents.

This activity has allowed him to progress and today he owns a field where he grows flowers. He maintains it every day and his flowers are welcomed at the plaza of the municipal market.  In addition, he works as a journeyman in different ranches of the region. This complements his income to ensure the well-b.eing of his three children.

With the loan he will buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices (organic fertilizers, pesticides, seed and others). This will allow him to continue taking care of his flowers and to have a better harvest, more productive. This will increase his income at the time to sell the flowers.

Joaquin with his entrepreneurial spirit, his hard work and tenacity; wants to continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own ranch. In it, he wants to be able to plant a variety of products and improve the profitability of the business, guaranteeing economic stability to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices (organic fertilizers, pesticides, seed and others).

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en:
Esmira is 37 years old, and she is married with 2 daughters. Her husband is a worker. They are refugees and live in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) settlement. 

Esmira is a farmer and has been growing fruits and vegetables for 15 years. She sells her produce at the local bazaar and earns 190 AZN per month.

Her products are in high demand. The Azerbaijani people like eating fresh fruits and vegetables because they are very good for one's health. And people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables at the local bazaars because they know that these products are fresh. Esmira's customer's use her vegetables to prepare different delicious dishes.

Esmira needs to increase her income in order to cover her family’s demands. She needs money to provide her children with a good education. 

Esmira has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizer for her garden. This will be her first loan, so please support Esmira.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Erick Alonso

texts.es:
Erick despierta todas las mañanas para cuidar de su siembra de tabaco, ya que con más ocho años de experiencia como agricultor, esto le ayuda a producir la mejor siembra de la zona. Este hombre de 37 años de edad está casado con una mujer que lo apoya incondicionalmente y es padre de tres hijos que lo miran como su modelo a seguir. Esta actividad ha ido de generación en generación en su familia, quien tras pasar varios años trabajando en Costa Rica, decidió regresar con sus ahorros para seguir con la tradición.
Actualmente vende su tabaco a una empresa privada que vio su calidad en la siembra. Además sirve de albañil cuando ha terminado su jornada laboral en el campo. Ahora Erick está solicitando un préstamo para alquilar un terreno de forma anticipada para asegurar la próxima siembra de tabaco. Sus planes son mejorar su vivienda, comprar herramientas agrícolas, comprar más terreno propio y vender su producto a muchas más empresas que se dediquen a exportar tabaco.
texts.en:
Erick wakes up every morning to care for his tobacco crops, since he has more than eight years of experience as a farmer.  This helps him to produce the best crops in the area.  He is 37 years old and married to a woman who supports him unconditionally.  They have three children who see him as a role model.  Farming has been passed down from generation to generation in his family.  He spent a few years working in Costa Rica and decided to return with his savings to continue the tradition.

He currently sells his tobacco to a private business that saw the quality of his crops.  He also works in construction when he has finished his daily work in the fields.  Erick is requesting a loan to rent farmland and pay in advance to ensure he will have his next tobacco crop.  His plans are to improve his house, purchase farming tools, purchase more of his own farmland, and sell his product to more businesses that export tobacco.

loans.use: to rent farmland.
